jobText: TXT/50295764.txt	§Customer Service - Connect Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service - Connect Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Universal Communications Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Service - Connect Coordinator §      §        §The role:§        §Based at our head office in Penrose, you will liaise with our end customers and field technicians to ensure appointments are scheduled for their house or building to be connected to the UFB (Ultra-Fast Broadband) street network.§        §You will monitor jobs and service orders on our CRM system as well as update any information sent back from the Delivery Partners and keep our client's network records updated.§        §We are looking for a talented individual who has:§        §          §Previous experience dealing with customers and clients over the phone, with a high attention to detail and driven to perform at a high level.§          §Proven experience monitoring service orders and updating any information sent back in  a CRM system.§          §Experience scheduling work and working with local Fiber Internet companies would be an advantage. §        §        §The benefits of working at UCG include:§        §          §Competitive salary §          §Bonus plan§          §Employee assistance program§          §Social club and events§          §Outstanding performance awards§          §Flexible working options §          §Marram Community Trust membership§          §Great team environment§        §        §UCG:§        §UCG is one of New Zealand and Australia’s leading suppliers of network design, cabling, construction, maintenance, operations and contractor management services. Particularly for next generation cable and broadband networks, plus smart community infrastructure. UCG is at the forefront of where the telecommunications industry is heading today thanks to our experienced, highly innovative and respected team.§        §Our Values:§        §UCG and our team members are committed to our core company values of Performance, Respect, Innovation, Teamwork, Quality, Safety and Integrity. Our values are our promise to each other and are non-negotiable behaviours that underpin our company culture. §        §How to Apply:§        §If you feel you can positively contribute to UCG's company culture and you want to empower your career, click on the 'apply for this job' link and submit your application today.§        §Only persons with current work rights in New Zealand should apply. Whilst we thank all applicants, only those shortlisted will be will be contacted directly by our recruitment team.§        §Follow us on LinkedIn:§        §https://www.linkedin.com/company/universal-communications-group.§      §    §  §§§The role:§ §Based at our head office in Penrose, you will liaise with our end customers and field technicians to ensure appointments are scheduled for their house or building to be connected to the UFB (Ultra-Fast Broadband) street network.§ §You will monitor jobs and service orders on our CRM system as well as update any information sent back from the Delivery Partners and keep our client's network records updated.§ §We are looking for a talented individual who has:§ § §Previous experience dealing with customers and clients over the phone, with a high attention to detail and driven to perform at a high level.§ §Proven experience monitoring service orders and updating any information sent back in  a CRM system.§ §Experience scheduling work and working with local Fiber Internet companies would be an advantage. § §The benefits of working at UCG include:§ § §Competitive salary § §Bonus plan§ §Employee assistance program§ §Social club and events§ §Outstanding performance awards§ §Flexible working options § §Marram Community Trust membership§ §Great team environment§ §UCG:§ §UCG is one of New Zealand and Australia’s leading suppliers of network design, cabling, construction, maintenance, operations and contractor management services. jobText: TXT/50528918.txt	§Customer Service Representative - Dental Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative - Dental Industry§§Advertiser: §Ivoclar Vivadent Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§We are seeking a Customer Service Representative to join our team. Reporting to the Customer Service Manager, your proven customer service and organisational skills will be critical in providing exceptional service to our customers nationwide.  This role is full-time, working Monday-Friday 9.00am-5:30pm. We are looking for a team player who likes to be in a busy environment and has a sense of pride when helping others.§ §Location:§ Rosedale, Auckland§ §Your responsibilities:§ § §Participate in achievement of the sales budget by processing customer orders received by telephone, email, Webshop, CRM and over the counter.§ §Follow up on customer enquiries pertaining to product, deliveries, or supply shortages.§ §Handling of customer queries relating to company product or service.§ §Processing of return authorities through to credit note onto customer accounts.§ §Outbound calls to existing customer to promote special updates/offers.§ §Creation of new customer accounts and amendments.§ §Provide support to field sales team and other departments§ § §To be successful for this role, you will have:§ § §experience in customer service within the healthcare industry, preferably dental;§ §exceptional attention to detail; as well as accurate data entry;§ §the ability to prioritise and manage time;§ §excellent communication skills, both written and verbal;§ §ability to multi task in a fast paced, open office environment;§ §a resourceful and resilient approach to problem solving;§ §previous experience in SAP ERP & SAP CRM systems or similar software. § §Join us on our journey to shape the future of dentistry.§ §Ivoclar Vivadent is one of the world's leading dental companies with approximately 3500 employees globally. We love innovation and we thrive on it. We are known for our long-standing experience and high quality. We are guided by our strong values and the company culture of a sustainably operated family-owned business with a long-term vision.§ §Our mission is making people smile§ §In order to achieve this goal, we are looking for people with good ideas, courage and exceptional drive: focused minds who share our passion. We offer a multifaceted work environment which is characterized by mutual respect and close collaboration. We translate words into action and continue to evolve. Become part of our team today.§ §If you believe you have the necessary skills for this position, we would like to hear from you by sending your resume and covering letter addressing the key selection criteria listed above.§ §We look forward to receiving your online application!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50536711.txt	§Customer Services opportunities§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services opportunities§§Advertiser: §Amtech-Newtech Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Wanganui§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§·         §Vibrant culture rich collaborative environment§  §·         §Growth and development opportunities on offer§  §·         §Enviable work life balance with so much on offer!§  § §  §We’re an organisation with multiple companies including Amtech Medical and Newtech Bathroomware. We challenge traditional ways and methods of doing business, and we have grown exponentially over the last ten years. Our customers, and their experience with us, come first so we make it a top priority to have one of the best customer service teams around.§  §To enable us to continue delivering excellence, we are on the lookout for standout, top-notch Customer Services Team Members to join us. Vacancies currently exist with both Amtech and Newtech, based here in Whanganui.§  §Our team is a fast-paced environment but we aim to have fun and work well together. We believe that it truly takes teamwork to achieve our goals and provide service we can be proud of. You’ll be surrounded by and working with an inspiring bunch of folks dedicated to service excellence.§  §In this dynamic role you will: §  §•          Communicate clearly with all our customers in a calm and professional manner§  §•          Provide information and support regarding our products and services§  §•          Develop and maintain productive working relationships with customers and fellow staff alike§  §Some of the key things you'll possess to successfully perform this role include: §  §•          The availability to work §Monday to Friday 8:30am – 5:30pm §  §•          Proven experience in customer service or retail to deal with a diverse range of customer queries§  §•          A willingness to learn and take on board our policies and procedures§  §•          Comfort using new systems and processes §  §•          Strong communication skills to engage our customers, discuss products and services that they need and provide solutions.§  §This role will suit you if you're looking for an opportunity to grow your skills and challenge yourself. It's rewarding, fun and you’ll work with energising people. No two days are the same and it’s essential that you’re not afraid to wrangle a variety of different tasks at once and learn new things. You will be expected to be a willing problem solver with a “gets things done” attitude. Above all we value kindness and a good sense of humour.§  §If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, we’d love to hear about how you can add value to our business. Send us your CV, plus a quick note why you think you’re the one for us.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§§§

jobText: TXT/50540301.txt	§Consumer Sales and Service - Energy/Telco Industry§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consumer Sales and Service - Energy/Telco Industry§§Advertiser: §Movinghub§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Outbound§§§§§§Arguably, one of the coolest places to work in Auckland.§  §Here at the Movinghub, we believe in the work hard/ play hard mantra and it's important to us to have someone that fits in well. We're a small team in a rad Ponsonby office with a huge grassed deck, napping couches, a sales environment which is all about working hard & having fun, exceeding results & soon-to-come gaming room! Our mascots are 2 little pups named Tank and Cerberus who come to the office every day, so you must be a dog lover.§  §Your job as a Movologist is predominately to help Kiwi's move home with ease; arranging the connection of various utility and home services including but not limited to electricity, gas, phone/broadband, and pay-tv. You will be reporting to the Sales and Operations Manager answering & undertaking inbound and warm outbound calls, responding to queries, liaising with customers and business clients as well as other general administration. §  §A big part of the role is answering the phone and calling so you must enjoy talking to people.§  §We want our employees to enjoy their work and its critical you learn and develop your skills while you work here. There is huge potential for advancement as we promote in-house, so people are always moving up the ranks.§  §Your Job Checklist:§ § §Monday to Saturday shifts§ §Strong brand – Movinghub is a market leader and operates in New Zealand, Australia, UK, and USA.§ §On-going coaching and development§ §Fantastic Ponsonby location§ §Great Commissions and incentive structure§ §You love work banter and a good meme  § §We're looking for someone with ICT sales and/or Power sales experience, organised, has great time management, and good computer skills who can pick up new systems easily. You must be confident and friendly with a great phone manner. We value street smarts and willingness to learn, over experience. If you lack energy and drive, this role is not for you. §  §If you're self-motivated and want the opportunity to advance with a fun, fast-growing company, please apply now.§  §Auckland, Auckland Central§  §Work Type - Full Time§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50547073.txt	§Customer Service Professional§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Professional§§Advertiser: §Sonova Audiological Care New Zealand Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§At Triton Hearing our customers come first so finding the right people to join our team is very important.  We have a network of over 70 locations around New Zealand providing hearing services and solutions with a focus on hearing diagnosis and hearing aid fittings.§ §We currently have a vacancy for a full time Customer Service Professional to join our fun contact centre team. Due to our growth, we are looking for dynamic, client-focused people to join our brand new Customer Service Centre (CSC) based in §Albany.§  This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is sales driven and passionate about customer service. § §Our Customer Service Professionals are highly regarded and a key part of our business, often providing the first impression for clients. Working exclusively by phone they are our first point of contact for our clients and provide positive, helpful experiences around their hearing care appointments.§ §If you love interacting with people via the phone and have an innate understanding that client happiness is the key to a successful business, this could be the right career move for you.§ §Our perfect match for Triton Hearing would have:§ § §A passion for providing excellent customer service§ §Inbound and Outbound Calling experience § §Sales focused § §Strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills – oral and written§ §A positive attitude and enjoy working in a team environment§ §Key tasks:§ § §Inbound calls both campaign based and clinic overflow. Dealing with new and existing clients.§ §Outbound calls to existing clients in the Triton database, or clients generated through iPad or online hearing tests (No cold calling).§ §Dealing with voicemail and email enquiries.§ §Insurance requests.§ §Reaching daily and monthly KPI Targets.§ §Benefits:§ § §Birthday Leave.§ §Community Day Leave.§ §Sick leave from day 1. § §Generous Family Discount. § §Flexible hours negotiable.§ §Brand new call centre space, just opened June 2020.§ §In return for your excellent skills, we offer full training and the opportunity to work for a great team dedicated to helping New Zealanders reconnect with the world they love.§ §Applicants must currently be able to work in New Zealand.§ §Click §Apply Now§ and attach a current §CV§ and §cover letter §telling us why you're keen to join our friendly Customer Service Team.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§§§

We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§To be successful in this role you will be able:§§To demonstrate strong customer service skills.§Quality decision making.§Be solutions focussed.§Have the personal confidence and resilience to adapt to a dynamic work environment.§§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the "Apply" button below to complete an online application form and submit your CV and cover letter.§ §For tracking purposes, all applications must be submitted via our online process.§ §Only applicants with the right to work in New Zealand will be considered for this position. § §If you are successful, then you will be invited to an onsite National Service Delivery Frontline Assessment Centre on §Wednesday 7th October at 4.30pm or Thursday 8th October at 4.30pm§ §The start date is expected to be 23rd November 2020.  §§ §You may have this role in mind, but we assess you for suitability to work in any of our five frontline roles, ensuring we appoint the right people in the right roles.§ §The starting salary range for this position is generally $48,853 - $57,473 dependent on skills and experience.§ §Applications close on §Sunday 20th September 2020§ §If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§ and use reference number §MOJ/1482403§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50549809.txt	§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Face-to-Face Fundraiser §§ §§Be part of the largest humanitarian network in the world! § §Help establish New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising team and make a difference.§ §Competitive hourly rate, paid training and opportunities to grow within New Zealand Red Cross.§§ §§New Zealand Red Cross is extremely excited to be announcing the launch of §its first ever in-house face-to-face fundraising team§.§ We are looking for a select number of friendly, outgoing and confident individuals to help build and grow this initiative. §§As an In-House Face-to-Face Fundraiser, you will play an integral role in building the culture and dynamic of the team. By inspiring members of the public to become a New Zealand Red Cross supporter, you’ll be making a massive difference to the lives of millions of people. This role will provide you with the opportunity to use your passion for making a difference, not only here in New Zealand, but all over the world, whilst building your career in the sales, marketing and the charity sector.§Key responsibilities:§§Inspire members of the public to become regular monthly donors and encourage people to be part of this global humanitarian movement.§ §Represent New Zealand Red Cross in a positive and inspiring manner.§ §Build rapport with people and provide an excellent donor experience.§ §Support new and existing team members.§ §Actively participate in relevant New Zealand Red Cross team building, meetings, training or group activities.§ §Assist with other duties as assigned by the In-House Face-to-Face Fundraising Team Leader or Manager.§ §Adhere to the New Zealand Red Cross policies and Public Fundraising regulations.§ §Ensure accurate processing and administration of donor sign-ups.§The position is based in Wellington with an expectation to travel within the region. This is an exciting opportunity to stamp your mark and contribute to the overall establishment of New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising programme. Along with this, you will be improving your communication and marketing skills, as well as obtaining many transferable skills for your future career.§What’s in it for you? §§Competitive hourly rate and incentives§ §Social, fun and supportive team environment§ §Paid, full comprehensive training on fundraising skills and charity knowledge§ §Charity uniform and tablet to use while working§ §Being an integral part of the foundation of the team§ §Opportunity for career progression and growth§ §Leadership opportunities and training§§To be considered for this role, you must be:§§Confident, social and passionate about the cause§ §Energetic, with a can-do positive attitude§ §Reliable, trustworthy and hardworking§ §Fluent in English, with strong communication skills§ §A supportive team player§ §Motivated, with the willingness to learn§ §Driven to meet targets§ §Committed to a minimum of three months’ full-time work§ §Experience in a public facing role is preferred§ §A New Zealand citizen or permanent resident or hold a valid working visa§ §Immediate start is available.§To apply for the position, please apply at §https://mclaren.co.nz/vacancies/§Applications to: §Ngan Nguyen via mclaren.co.nz§Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§ §§Applications will be reviewed and actioned as received.§§ §P: §04 499 1069§W: §mclaren.co.nz§E: §admin@mclaren.co.nz§§ §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50550135.txt	§Customer Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service§§Advertiser: §Wilderness Motorhomes / SmartRV§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§Who we are§Here at SmartRV, we are passionate about matching our customers with their very own dream motorhome and supporting them throughout their ownership journey. To achieve this we sell premium products and back this up by providing superior support and service. If you want to find out more about what we do, go to www.smartrv.co.nz §Who you are§To join our team and be successful in this role you will be looking to build and diversify your strong customer service skills, be solution focussed, and a pro at problem-solving. You will have a calm and pragmatic approach that allows you to successfully juggle multiple demands at one time whilst being effective and efficient at getting through your task list. Your verbal and written communication skills will be second to none and you will confidently be able to pick up new systems and processes quickly.§What you’ll be doing§Variety is at the core of this role with each day being different. You will perform a variety of tasks such as handing over the keys of your customers brand new motorhome, answering calls and emails as well as provide face to face service with our valued clientele.  The support you provide throughout each owner’s journey will be something you take great pride in and full ownership of.  This is a unique opportunity for someone who is up for a new challenge and is only genuinely satisfied once the customer is. §This is a great opportunity to develop your customer service career in a passionate and dedicated team, so don’t hesitate to apply today!§How to Apply§If you think this sounds like your dream opportunity, we'd love to hear from you so please apply now by sumitting your CV and cover letter and then follow up by leaving a voicemail message with all of your details on our dedicated recruitment number §09 281 3619§, which is listed at the bottom of our application form.§Application Process & Updates§Part of the application process includes completing a job specific application form and calling and leaving a voicemail message to tell us why you think you have what it takes. Depending on the job board and device you apply with, you'll either see the form on the next screen or it will be emailed to you immediately, upon receiving your application. §Please check your inbox (and junk mail) for application updates. Emails are sent via our recruitment software, Chilli Factor. §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50550176.txt	§Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time§§Advertiser: §Fullers Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Wharf Host - Waiheke - Fixed term part time §      §        §About us§        §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. Because that’s us, out there. On the Gulf. And getting paid for it. Fullers360 was born of a love for the Hauraki Gulf in 1981. And 35 years downwind, our network unifies the entire Gulf. Through a reliable network and the passion of 350 crew and staff, Fullers360 ferries nearly 6 million people every year, getting commuters to work and visitors to play. We’re in an exciting phase of growing our tourism market, restless to elevate the experience we deliver to every single one of our customers. §        § §        §Our Purpose §        §Unifying the Hauraki Gulf by bringing together friends and whanau, supporting communities and businesses, opening up treasured destinations and sharing our local taonga.§        § §        §About the role§        §Do you take everything in your stride and with a smile on your face? Are you confident commanding a crowd? Able to negotiate and persuade others with ease?§        §You’ll be confident, outgoing and not afraid of commanding a crowd.§        §This is not your average summer job, and you won’t be stuck in an office! Instead you’ll be on the wharf in the heart of the action validating tickets and directing & assisting customers with whatever their needs are, ensuring they are in the right place and boarding the correct service. You’ll also be keeping them updated when services reach capacity and advising of the next service time, along with any other general enquires.§        §We are currently looking for an energetic team player to join our team on a fixed term part time basis - from October until approx February 2021§        §This is a role full of customer interaction where you will be responsible for providing information and general assistance to our customers. §        § §        §What we are looking for:§        §You will need to be a people person with great customer service and excellent communication skills as you will be assisting customers to face to face and helping them plan their experience with us.§        § §        §          §Someone who is outgoing, reliable and has a positive attitude!§          §Excellent communication skills.§          §Previous experience in customer service desired, but not essential§          §Ability to build and sustain relationships with our customers.§          §Promotes a positive team atmosphere.§        §        § §        §Our Company Values §        §Welcoming§ - There’s nothing we love more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close.§        §Restless§ - We’re hungry for innovation and excellence and always on the look-out for The Better Way.§        §Safe & Shipshape §- Our operations run like clockwork, so we can look after those on board.§        §Straight up§ - We say what we mean, and we do what we say.§        §Owning it §- We’re an efficient team and rely on each other. And people rely on us for a seamless experience. Let’s not let them down.§        § §        §Benefits:§        §Fullers offer many benefits including:§        §          §Discounted gym membership;§          §Discounted healthcare;§          §Leisure travel§        §        § §        §Hours:§        §As Fullers operates 7 days a week, this position is on a roster basis and will include weekend shifts and public holidays.§        § §        §Candidates must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§        § §        §Please note: Any information you provide will be used to evaluate your suitability to this position. We will hold onto your details for any future opportunities unless asked otherwise.§      §      §      §    §  §§§About us§  §Sometimes we feel the need to pinch ourselves. Because that’s us, out there. On the Gulf. And getting paid for it. Fullers360 was born of a love for the Hauraki Gulf in 1981. And 35 years downwind, our network unifies the entire Gulf. Through a reliable network and the passion of 350 crew and staff, Fullers360 ferries nearly 6 million people every year, getting commuters to work and visitors to play. We’re in an exciting phase of growing our tourism market, restless to elevate the experience we deliver to every single one of our customers. §  § §  §Our Purpose §  §Unifying the Hauraki Gulf by bringing together friends and whanau, supporting communities and businesses, opening up treasured destinations and sharing our local taonga.§  § §  §About the role§  §Do you take everything in your stride and with a smile on your face? Are you confident commanding a crowd? Able to negotiate and persuade others with ease?§  §You’ll be confident, outgoing and not afraid of commanding a crowd.§  §This is not your average summer job, and you won’t be stuck in an office! Instead you’ll be on the wharf in the heart of the action validating tickets and directing & assisting customers with whatever their needs are, ensuring they are in the right place and boarding the correct service. You’ll also be keeping them updated when services reach capacity and advising of the next service time, along with any other general enquires.§  §We are currently looking for an energetic team player to join our team on a fixed term part time basis - from October until approx February 2021§  §This is a role full of customer interaction where you will be responsible for providing information and general assistance to our customers. §  § §  §What we are looking for:§  §You will need to be a people person with great customer service and excellent communication skills as you will be assisting customers to face to face and helping them plan their experience with us.§  § § § §Someone who is outgoing, reliable and has a positive attitude!§ §Excellent communication skills.§ §Previous experience in customer service desired, but not essential§ §Ability to build and sustain relationships with our customers.§ §Promotes a positive team atmosphere.§ § §  §Our Company Values §  §Welcoming§ - There’s nothing we love more than being able to call the Hauraki Gulf home. But sharing it with others comes pretty close.§  §Restless§ - We’re hungry for innovation and excellence and always on the look-out for The Better Way.§  §Safe & Shipshape §- Our operations run like clockwork, so we can look after those on board.§  §Straight up§ - We say what we mean, and we do what we say.§  §Owning it §- We’re an efficient team and rely on each other. And people rely on us for a seamless experience. Let’s not let them down.§  § §  §Benefits:§  §Fullers offer many benefits including:§ § §Discounted gym membership;§ §Discounted healthcare;§ §Leisure travel§ § §  §Hours:§  §As Fullers operates 7 days a week, this position is on a roster basis and will include weekend shifts and public holidays.§  § §  §Candidates must have the legal right to work in New Zealand.§  § §  §Please note: Any information you provide will be used to evaluate your suitability to this position. We will hold onto your details for any future opportunities unless asked otherwise.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50557341.txt	§Customer Service Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Adult Toy Mega Store§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§ATMS Customer Satisfaction Team Leader§  §You could get a regular customer service role… Or you could join the fun-loving team at Adulttoymegastore.co.nz where there's no such thing as a boring day!§We're BIG on customer care here at ATMS – you only need to read our online testimonials to see how seriously we take good service. We’re growing and so too is our Customer Satisfaction team. That's why we're looking for a new hands-on Customer Satisfaction Team Leader to join our wellington based crew and lead our growing CS team.§Adulttoymegastore.co.nz has become the biggest online retailer for adult toys in New Zealand, and now we deliver to Australia, USA, Canada and the UK too. We have grown in leaps and bounds, and it’s all because we have a great team, and hire great people. We're local, owned and operated here in Wellington - come join us!§What we'll need from you§- Proven experience as a customer service team leader or manager§  §- Great communication skills and dedication to good service which will mean our customers love shopping at ATMS - even when things don’t go quite to plan, you and your team will make sure everything gets put right.§- You'll be a multi-tasker like no other, assisting your team to facilitate emails, instant chats and phone queries, all while working on projects that enhance customer service within the business§  §- You’ll have great relationship management skills that will assist you in getting the best from our third party delivery partners§  §- You'll be a great ambassador for our brand – you'll be the face, voice and values of our company to our customers.§- Your mature and positive attitude to sex, sexuality will guide your team and will mean our customers always feel comfortable getting in touch.§  §- While this is a largely online role, you'll be just as confident with face-to-face customer service when we take ATMS on the road to expos and events.§What you'll get in return§- A supportive working environment where your development will be a priority. Our people are important to us, so there's always lots of opportunities to try different tasks and learn new skills.§- Good work-life balance. We work (very!) hard, but we play hard too. We have a high-performance culture so we like to have fun and celebrate our wins along the way.§- A really decent coffee machine so you and your team can whizz through those customer emails at an impressive caffeine-induced pace§- Some pretty great work stories. jobText: TXT/50564202.txt	§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Hawera§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Hawera§§Advertiser: §Amplifon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §Rest of Taranaki§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Who are we?§  §At Bay Audiology, the heart of our mission is to help people rediscover the joy of hearing.  With over 100 clinics located throughout New Zealand we have grown to become the country's largest Audiology provider.  We offer a range of services from diagnosing hearing difficulties, to fitting, servicing and maintaining hearing aids, and offering ongoing support and care for our customers.   We aim to provide an excellent experience, and that’s where you come in...§  §About the role:§  §As our Client Care Coordinator you will be the smiling face at our Hawera Clinic providing an exceptional service to our locals in the area, making a real difference in the lives of those with hearing loss.  This is a varied role working closely with our Clinician, and no two days will be the same. You will be responsible for the scheduling of appointments,  sales and customer service including basic hearing aid repairs and onsite hearing screening - full training is provided.§  §This is a fixed term contract position working 8.30am - 5.00pm, Tues/Wed/Friday until 31st March 2021 §  §What we are looking for:§ § §Genuine passion and experience in providing excellent customer service§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Sound computer skills as we are a paperless clinic§ §Great self-management and initiative and able to work alone at times§ §Well-developed problem solving skills§ §Previous customer service/administration background§ §A positive, friendly personality§ §What we offer:§  §We are part of the Amplifon Group - the global leader in hearing services and are at the forefront of innovative hearing care services.  We offer solid training, a competitive salary, and a warm, supportive leadership team.  Though this is a contract role, there is potential for this role to go permanent.  Explore your future with us!§  §Apply online with your CV and covering letter today.§Applications close 30th September 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobTitle: Customer Services Manager Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50574972.txt	§Customer Services Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Manager§§Advertiser: §Reese Engineering Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Customer Services Manager§ §Palmerston §North§ §About us§ §Aitchison celebrates 50 years in the market this year and as a market leader in New Zealand, Australia and with sales in Europe, Japan & North America we continue to manufacture New Zealand made seed drill machinery from our Palmerston North site for a global customer base. Our reputation for high quality innovative machinery and impeccable after market service drives our passion within this primary sector.§ § § §About the role§ §An opportunity to join the team in Palmerston North within our Customer Services has become available. Due to the investment growth we are seeking a high calibre customer services manager with proven sales order entry, call centre experience, customer fulfilment operational skills and customer sales information services within the agriculture sector and preferably knowledge of the machinery sector.§ § § §Key responsibilities include§ §•Promoting the products and services to our existing and new customer base.§ §•Call centre activities and managing all enquiries from phone, email, and website.§ §•Practical knowledge of our Agri range machinery.§ §•CRM interfaces within our ERP system Epicor.§ §•Order entry for whole goods and spare parts orders from NZ, AU & UK.§ §•Meeting annual and monthly KPI targets.§ §•Achieving the annual sales plans and supporting our field base sales executive.§ §About you§ §To be successful in this role, you will likely have:§ §•Proven track record within the agriculture, machinery or manufacturing sectors or similar.§ §•Excellence in interpersonal and communication skills , phone and PC dexterity.§ §•An understanding of client relationship management and over the phone customer experience in solving and managing customer queries.§ §•Attention to detail and effective computer literacy – MS Office, Epicor / SAP or similar ERP software.§ §•Tertiary qualified at degree level marketing, digital, or business-related professional qualifications.§ §Sounds like your kind of role?§ §If being encouraged to pursue excellence every day inspires you, you'll fit right in here. Not only do we strive to be the best in New Zealand's market, we're also a global brand with ongoing projects to keep us moving onwards and upwards. For someone with your motivation to succeed, it doesn't get any better than this. An attractive remuneration- performance based and the opportunity to develop within an exciting phase in the company's strategy direction are on offer.§With our ongoing commitment towards health and safety, you'll undergo a pre-employment drug test that will form part of your application and you should be aligned to our values of Passion for people, Entrepreneurial spirit, Agile productivity, Courage to reach new horizons and Best in class workplace practices.§Applications close on Friday, 30th September 2020.§ §Please send your details, resume to §alistair@reese.co.nz§ or contact for an informal discussion on §021431002§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services manager?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50578064.txt	§Customer Service Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Manager§§Advertiser: §Mr Blinds New Zealand Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§Do you have a passion for excellent customer service and want to build on a strong delivery culture through developing a great team? Can you combine strategic input into the direction of the company as well as roll your sleeves up for day to day action? §We are looking for someone who can lead our customer service team and further develop our customer service strategy. The position sits with the leadership team and reports directly to our COO.§About us:§We are Mr Blinds, a leading New Zealand manufacturer and retailer of blinds. Proudly kiwi owned and operated with key family value; positivity, can do attitude, respect, taking responsibility, treating all fairly and constant communication. We take great pride in our customer engagement market leading position, many satisfied customers and we continually strive to improve our customer experience. §Your work:§Provide effective day to day leadership and direction of your team§Mentor, train and encourage staff to fulfill their potential and promote our values§Identify opportunities of process improvement and continuous customer service improvements§Embracing our overall vision build capability, develop KPI’s, and a sustainable structure for future growth and changing market conditions.§Manage the day to day activities of our team of in-field technicians including contractors §Ensure fit for purpose systems and technologies, analyse trends and data providing meaningful reporting§Ensures strong support for other business functions including production and sales force §Strongly supports and enhances H&S across own functions and throughout the wider business§Provide cover for Saturday mornings in our showroom§About you:§A minimum of 10 years’ experience in a sales or customer service role including 5 years in a management role§A belief in people, training, mentoring, personal development and encouragement with the ability to listen and offer solutions§Naturally positive and collaborative in your outlook with the ability to engage with people at all levels§Customer centric with the ability to empathise with the customer balancing with the needs of the business§The ability to handle surprises, identify and lead change growing your teams capabilities§Excellent communications skills both written and verbal§IT savvy with competence in MS and ability to learn new systems.§A glass half full person with a willingness to make things happen.§ §If this sounds like you and you want to be part of leading a great team in a dynamic and varied role don’t delay in getting your details in front of us. §In return we will offer a competitive package, a supportive culture and, we think, some pretty decent workmates. §For more information or confidential discussion phone Charlie Gray on §021931864§ or apply by providing your CV and a cover letter outlining why you would like this role. Applications close on Friday 9th October at 5pm. Interviews will be arranged as applications arrive. Only successful candidates will be notified. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services manager?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50580007.txt	§Customer Care Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care Manager§§Advertiser: §Airwork NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Salary§§$85,000 - $109,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§About the role:§ §We are looking for a Customer Care Manager who is quick-thinking and solutions-focussed and provides a refreshing and positive experience to our internal and external customers. This role requires a leader who is passionate about developing others and delivering successful customer outcomes.  You’ll have a strong customer centric focus, be someone that is patient, empathetic and happy to work through options with customers to find the best solutions. You must be able to work in flexible work environment that caters to different time zones.  You'll join a great team, who knows how to have fun as well as work hard.§ §Our Company:§ §Airwork NZ (AWNZ) is a globally recognised helicopter engineering, sales and leasing company based at Ardmore Airport with bases globally. The company has a comprehensive range of capabilities, in-house expertise, world class technology and certifications that distinguishes them within the global aviation market.§ §Airwork’s first priority is safety in everything we do.  This role must work across the wider team to ensure that all maintenance activities are safe and build a culture of commitment to safety. We have a highly engaged workforce through great people, practices and excellent career and training opportunities and offer a competitive salary. We pride ourselves on having a great work life balance.  Our asset is our people and their passion for their industry.§ § §Responsibilities will include:§ § §Responsible for ensuring that AWNZ’s clients and stakeholders receive a high-quality customer experience, driving an increase in parts sales and increasing revenues in the external ASP programme. § §Full ownership of customer issues and for following problems through to resolution.§ §Responsible for ensuring that the workflow of customer jobs is meeting and exceeding their expectations with regular updates provided.§ §Responsible for ensuring that the customer experience continually improves and is effective at engaging customers, supporting sustainable growth of the AWNZ business§ §Responsible for managing and growing the Airwork Support Plan (ASP) business§ §Provision of first-class technical assistance and product/service advice§ §Act as an information advisor, providing customers and colleagues across the business key information to enable business success§ §Provide pricing and availability information, cross-reference, research & source of products for customers and sales thereof§ §Where required make proactive outbound calls in line with marketing campaigns, quotes follow-up etc§ §Proactively inform the Sales & Leasing Team of potential product /leasing etc leads§ §Build and maintain effective relationships with internal and external customers§ § §What we are looking for:§ § §Proven management and customer service experience§ §Focused and driven to provide quality customer outcomes§ §Proven ability to lead a team§ §Approachable with good interpersonal skills, accompanied with a positive and friendly personality§ §Excellent verbal communication skills, with an exceptional phone manner, and strong listening skills§ §Ability to multitask and handle pressure§ §Able to remain calm in challenging situations§ §High degree of computer literacy, including intermediate working knowledge of Microsoft based programmes (database experience would be an advantage)§ §Accurate and efficient data entry skills§ §If you believe you tick all the boxes, then apply now!§ §This position should have valid New Zealand working rights.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a care manager?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

From talking to people on our products, merchandising, and driving sales, you’ll never be bored in this role! §  §15 - 20 Hours a week, Monday, Wednesday & Thursday, 1-5pm (potential to be adjusted) §  §About you §  §To be successful in this role you will be a self-motivated, professional with good communication skills and the ability to build a rapport with a diverse range of people. You will preferably have a background in customer service within either hospitality or retail. §  §Other responsibilities include: § § §Developing the store§ §Driving sales and initiatives§ §Inventory and stock control§ §Store administration§ §Working with others in the business§ §Our Story§  §Fonterra Farm Source is the face and place of Fonterra in the community, and our hubs combine the benefits of a rural retail store and community facility. We also have awesome training and development opportunities and provide a web of natural career progression opportunities across both Farm Source and the wider Fonterra business. Take your career forward – apply today!§  § §§§§

Call Centre§§§§§§We love making a difference in the lives of kiwis with their hearing needs and are currently looking for people to join our §Contact Centre,§ offering people hearing checks. § §Amplifon are the world’s leading hearing specialists, operating in 29 countries worldwide.  In New Zealand, we trade under two brands that you may recognise; Bay Audiology and Dilworth Hearing, making us New Zealand’s largest Audiology provider.  § §With 120+ clinics nationwide, the heart of our mission is to help people rediscover the joy of hearing.  Our contact centre plays a very important role within our business, and that is where you come in…§ §Our Contact Centre Representatives start our customer journey, delivering an exceptional experience with every interaction.  Full training is provided on our systems and you will be joining a wide variety of people who all want to make a difference.§ §We have two roles available:§ §1 x part time role 20 hours per week§ §1 x full time role 40 hours per week§Working Monday to Friday 8.30am - 5.00pm or 10.30am - 7.00pm§ §About you:§ § §You will have previous experience in Customer Services/Retail/Contact Centre or Hospitality§ §You'll love talking and listening to people§ §You work hard to deliver brilliant service to make a difference for your clients§ §You are adaptable and able to deal with different people and situations, easily building rapport§ §You bring your savvy learning agility to pick up new systems in a dynamic changing environment and work with multiple screens!§ §You demonstrate a naturally empathetic and resilient nature to stay positive when the pressure is on§ §Legal entitlement to work in New Zealand§ §What’s in it for you?§ § §Full training and support on our processes and products§ §Variety as no two queries will be the same§ §A real sense of purpose and making a real difference to the people you speak with each call§ §The opportunity to work for a successful and established business with career progression opportunities§ §Plenty of recognition for demonstrating our values and other rewards§ §Sound like you?  We’d love to hear from you.  Apply online today with your §covering letter and CV §and§ let us know why you are the perfect person to join us!§ §** Please advise whether you are looking for full or part time hours in your cover letter**§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§Please indicate if you consent to the company holding your application information on file at the conclusion of this process in relation to any future employment opportunities within the Amplifon Group.§§§

jobText: TXT/50581986.txt	§Customer Care Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care Specialist§§Advertiser: §Torpedo7§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Care Specialist §      §        §Company Description§        §Torpedo7, who are part of The Warehouse Group is New Zealand's largest multi-channel outdoor adventure retailer, with 19 stores nationwide and a dedicated webstore. We are unique in NZ in that our stores have all sorts of toys and experts under one roof - bike, camp, tramp, water, snow and motor-sport§        §The heart of our business is a great customer service team – not only are they skilled in the art of delivering great service to our customers but they have a passion for what they do. Due to a re-alignment within the teams we are now looking for additional team members to join our Customer Care team in our Hamilton site. So if you have the passion and you truly “get” what outstanding customer service is all about then this can be a perfect option for you!§        §Job Description§        §Reporting through to a Customer Care Coach (Team Leader) you will handle a variety of incoming customer enquiries, with your main job purpose being to provide an effortless customer experience for our customers.§        §As a Customer Care Specialist your key responsibilities will be:§        §          §Responding to customer enquiries, taking ownership through to resolution.§          §Building rapport with the customer by active listening and adapting communication style.§          §Running efficient case management and follow-up within agreed timeframes.§          §You will manage a majority of customer contact via phone, however, follow ups may be via written communication.§          §Keep up to date with processes and procedures to ensure accurate information is provided.§        §        §Qualifications§        §Just like us, the ideal candidate will have a love for the outdoors and/or fitness,  and could even be a regular at one of our many stores!§        §Further to that:§        §          §Vast experience in a customer services environment with a proven track record of offering exceptional customer service.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§          §An outstanding phone manner – being able to express ideas, thoughts and concept clearly, using correct and appropriate language, organisation and structure.§          §Experience with Salesforce, CRM, Microsoft Dynamics and the full MS Office suite is an added benefit.§          §Great attention to detail and accuracy of work.§          §The ability to work with a sense of urgency and thrive working under pressure.§          §Have the ability to work with a diverse array of people and build successful working relationships both internal and external customers.§          §An ability to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability – thinking outside the box.§        §        §As this role is all about team work and working to KPIs and tight timeframes, we are after someone that can be relied on to have great punctuality and who has a proven attendance record.§        §Additional information§        §This role is a great foot in the Torpedo7/The Warehouse Group door; the role will offer you loads of development and insight about the Torpedo7  business with some good fun and laughs along the way. We have some great staff perks and the opportunity to work in an energetic and fast paced environment. If you want an opportunity to combine your passion for the outdoors with a great job then this is it.§        §You will need to be available to work 40 hours a week between 8:00am-6pm. style.§ §Running efficient case management and follow-up within agreed timeframes.§ §You will manage a majority of customer contact via phone, however, follow ups may be via written communication.§ We’re growing and so too is our Customer Satisfaction team. That's why we're looking for another §customer service mega star§ to join our team based in the Wellington CBD.§Adulttoymegastore.co.nz has become the biggest online retailer for adult toys in New Zealand, and now we deliver to Australia, USA, Canada and the UK too. We have grown in leaps and bounds, and it’s all because we have a great team, and hire great people. We're local, owned and operated here in Wellington - come join us!§What we'll need from you§- Your great communication skills and dedication to good service will mean our customers love shopping at ATMS - even when the odd thing doesn't go quite to plan, you'll make sure everything gets put right.§- You'll be a multi-tasker like no other – working efficiently to finish that email, process that return and answer that phone call – all before you've had your breakfast!§- You'll make a great ambassador for our brand – you'll represent the face, voice and values of our company with our customers.§- Your mature and positive attitude to sex will mean our customers always feel comfortable getting in touch.§  §- While this is a largely online email based role, you'll be just as confident over the phone or with face-to-face customer service when we take ATMS on the road to expos and events.§  §-You will be available to work 40 hours per week, including some shifts on Saturdays and Sundays in the busy periods (these can be completed remotely from home)§What you'll get in return§- A supportive working environment where your development will be a priority. Our people are important to us, so there's always lots of opportunities to try different tasks and learn new skills.§- Good work-life balance. We work (very!) hard, but we play hard too. jobText: TXT/50586974.txt	§Customer Support Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Support Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Mission Labs Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§ABOUT US§Mission Labs is a fast-moving and fast-growing tech company. We're using modern technologies and new ways of working to rethink and develop solutions for the telecoms industry. The way that people communicate and the tools they use are evolving; we’re proud to create innovative products of the future which improve the digital customer experience.§With the likes of JD, Capita and the National Trust as clients, it might not seem like we are a startup. But we are very much a startup. §At Mission Labs you can expect to become part of a fast paced and rewarding environment mixed with plenty of fun and laughs thrown in for good measure. We continuously challenge ourselves and our ways of working. Whether using the latest tech to push what we think is possible, collaborating on new business proposals or working on a tight deadline fuelled by Pizza - there’s never a dull moment here.§With successful year on year growth in the UK, we’re now on an exciting trajectory with a vision to bring the future forward faster.  §THE ROLE§We’re on the look-out for an inspiring and energetic Team Leader to build our small dynamic CircleLoop team in Wellington, New Zealand.§This role and location is a first for us, and you will be able to help shape the team, culture and grow with us - including helping us find a location for the office!  This is an excellent career opportunity within a fast growing, forward thinking industry.§What you will be doing §Your responsibility will be to lead and develop a team of Customer Support Executives, inspiring them to deliver the best service possible and challenge the norm.  This is very much a hands on role, providing training, coaching, development and general office management in order to help us grow within the New Zealand market.  You won’t be afraid to roll your sleeves up - from developing programs and procedures to enhance team performance, liaising with the software engineers to improve the product, to jumping on the phones and speaking with customers alongside your team.  Key Responsibilities include:§Developing inventive processes to power the department forward and drive productivity, always with customer satisfaction at the forefront§Prioritising, progressing and monitoring your team’s support tickets and requests to ensure they are resolved within the agreed timescales.§Coach, train and develop the team around you to ensure the highest standards of customer service are always provided to our customers§Scheduling the team to ensure that adequate resource is in place to cover the core customer facing hours§Deal with customer ticket escalations on behalf of the team, providing coaching where applicable§Prioritising, progressing and monitoring porting tickets and porting requests to ensure they are processed within the agreed timescales. The ability to communicate with a range of external partners and report back to our customers is vital.§Build long-lasting relationships with CircleLoop customers and partners - so that customers will love speaking with the team!§Use our CRM and sales support software tools including Hubspot and our internal CRM Super to assist customers and utilise these to enhance the customers or partners experience§Liaise with our UK team to establish best practices and enhance knowledge§Lead the team to work together on achieving KPI targets and help the business grow!§Who we’re on the lookout for§To be successful in this role you will have great customer service experience to boot, but of course have exceptional leadership skills that allow you to influence and build great working relationships with your team.  You will have a knack for problem solving, motivating others and be especially tech savvy.§You need to be confident, assertive and inspiring - success in this role is about building a great team who our customers love speaking to!§Our new and existing customers will love speaking with you and you'll need to know your stuff on our product (which we’ll provide full training on of course!)§It’s the first of its kind on the market, so all we ask is to bring with you an fiery energy, a passion to learn and an exceptional attitude.  You’ll need:§At least 2 years’ experience in a Team Leader or Management role§Previous experience in a varied customer support role (example roles include Service Desk, Online Customer Services and first line IT Support).§An understanding of Cloud based telecommunications and the marketplace is desirable§The ability to assist customers in the configuration of our product and troubleshoot issues (full training on our product will be given)§Logical and methodical problem-solving skills§Natural ability to lead and develop a team in forward thinking ways, providing 1:1 coaching, training, call listening and auditing for continuous improvement§Ability to work well under pressure and multitask - taking the lead on a variety of tasks and roles§Ability to convey technical issues and processes simply to both the team and customers (at all types of seniority)§Be a great communicator, with an enthusiastic, engaging telephone manner§As well as friendly and outgoing, enjoying being part of a dynamic and close-knit team§A proactive nature, using initiative to self learn and problem solve, staying up to date with the latest industry trends§Excited about the prospect of rolling your sleeves up and getting stuck in!§BENEFITS§In exchange for your talent and commitment, we offer lots of benefits to keep you whistling while you work:§Competitive starting salary with opportunities to increase this quickly§Flexi-time§25 days holiday per year§Never work on your birthday§NZ Superannuation§Private Healthcare (after qualifying period)§Bonus scheme§Chilled dress code§Close-knit team§Free refreshments§Regular social events§This is a fantastic opportunity to join a very fast growing company and will report into our CircleLoop Operations Manager.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

We are a 100% kiwi owned agribusiness company with over 30 years’ experience in the development of software for the rural sector. With more than 10,000 farmers and businesses throughout New Zealand and Australia using our software, our role is to help them to measure and manage their business performance and make better decisions for their future. §   § The recent release of our next generation solution Cash Manager Focus almost completes our evolution to a fully cloud based SaaS business. But there is still plenty to do and we would love you to come and join us on the journey! §   § We aim to keep our customers at the heart of everything we do and are looking for a Client Services Specialist to join us on our mission. If that’s you, read on! § §The role §Based in our Masterton office, the Client Services Specialist is a pivotal part of our business and provides exceptional service to our customers. Every day, you will be building strong relationships with our customers and assisting them with queries in a timely way. You will also be the one to share information with customers about new products and services that may help them with their farming or agricultural business.  Day to day this role will: § § §Engage with customers over the phone, email and chat to resolve issues and problem solve § §Escalate issues when appropriate to the CST Manager § §Share customer feedback with the CST Manager to assist with product or process improvements § §Look for ways to add value to customers by suggesting additional products  § §Keep up to date with our product, including any new features or upcoming releases § §Share knowledge with the wider Client Services Team and contribute to our collaborative culture § § §About you § You will be a natural when it comes to engaging with a variety of people and have a customer-centric approach to your work. Ideally, you will come from a farming or accounting background and be able to connect with our customers quickly. You will be a self-starter who is motivated and passionate towards providing exceptional customer service. §  §You will also have: § § §Proven experience in a service centre environment § §Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal § §An ability to pick up new technologies and technical concepts quickly § §An analytical approach towards problem solving § §A highly organised and proactive approach to your work § §A drive towards promoting our product in a positive way § §A background in farming or agriculture would be an advantage. § § Our CST are a busy team and will need someone who can hit the ground running.  In return we offer a supportive and flexible environment where you will have room to learn and grow. § §If you think you have what it takes, then what are you waiting for?  We have partnered with Kin to fill this exciting role. If you are ready to go, apply now with your CV and cover letter telling us why you’d be a great addition to the team. Or, if you have some questions, please contact Tracey Fletcher on tracey.fletcher@kin.co.nz.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50595644.txt	§Shopify Support Advisor (Customer Service Representative)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Shopify Support Advisor (Customer Service Representative)§§Advertiser: §Shopify§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Fixed salary of $51,000 + perks§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Kia Ora! The work of a Shopify Support Advisor is incredibly rewarding and equally challenging. Our merchants have amazing stories filled with highs and lows, frustrations, and triumphs. It is in these moments and many in between that you would make an impact.§ §As an Advisor, you’ll work remotely from the comfort of your home while working within a dynamic, diverse and supportive environment. You won’t always know the answers to the questions you’re being asked, so your ability to be resourceful is key! We believe in human-centred, high-quality customer experiences. Using chats, phone calls and emails, you’ll be there to listen, teach, problem solve and explore growth opportunities with Shopify merchants. As part of that growth, you’ll be there to connect merchants with potential new features or plans to ensure they get the most out of the Shopify platform. § §If you’re up for the challenge and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment, we encourage you to apply and take part in a hiring process that will allow you to meet folks at Shopify and get a taste for what the job entails. We aim to provide you with as much information about the role early in the process so that you know what to expect throughout, and in your first few months.§ §Following 4 weeks of training and 2 weeks of mentoring, you will begin responding to our merchants on live channels as part of a small squad, who is there to support you. All Advisors work a combination of weekdays, weekends and holidays in a full-time capacity. § §We believe in supportive teams, an inclusive work environment and providing growth opportunities within your role. We also work remotely - which means you get to be part of a fast-growing global tech company from the comfort of your home.§ §Even if you’ve never held a similar position but you’re interested so far and relate to the things we’ve outlined below, we want to hear from you! § §Responsibilities:§ §Adhering to a daily schedule that includes a mix of: Phones, three (3) simultaneous chats, and emails.§Ensuring merchants have a quick response time by staying on top of your assigned tickets, with same-day ticket review.§Acting as a business coach and thinking about the merchant’s business holistically when offering solutions.§Completing essential follow-up documentation after each interaction.§Engaging in human conversations with merchants to identify and resolve issues, and provide coaching/growth opportunities for their businesses.§Offer needs-based solutions, not pushy sales.§Advocating for merchants and the Shopify platform by communicating with stakeholders.§Owning your own development through reflection, reviewing past interactions and preparing to discuss growth opportunities with your lead in regular 1:1 meetings.§ §Requirements for the role:§ §Live and have legal authorization to work in New Zealand.§Extensive experience providing exceptional customer service in a contact centre, retail or service environment.§Have appropriate remote work set-up - such as quiet space, stable internet connection, and a back-up location in case of issues with the primary location.§Have access to a wired internet speed of at least 25 Mbps download speed and 10 Mbps upload. You can check your speed here.§The hours that we are currently hiring for are set to be a rotating schedule with varying 8-hour shifts starting anytime between 7:00 am - 11:00 am in your local timezone. This means some days your shifts could be as early as 7am-3pm, and as late as 11am-7pm. You would have notice well in advance for your scheduled times, and the idea would be to have them as consistent as possible, but due to varying needs we do require full availability. This would also include rotating weekend shifts.§Proven track record of being incredibly resourceful and finding solutions even when there is no clear path.§Ability to adapt to new processes and work accurately in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.§Proficiency with technology paired with excellent typing skills.§Have strong reading, writing and communication skills.§Willingness to learn all about entrepreneurship, care deeply about people support and enjoy having genuine human conversations.§Possess high level of understanding, patience and empathy. Able to navigate more difficult conversations/interactions with professionalism.§Are committed to continuous growth and learning. You understand that every challenge is an opportunity and you get excited about learning new things.§Ensure privacy and security practices are followed at all times for both merchants and Shopify.§ §Bonus experience:§ §A background or interest in business, marketing, retail, or sales.§Ran or had exposure to running a business or being an entrepreneur.§ §At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.§ §If your experience is §this§ close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.§ §Join a world-class team§ §PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY on our careers page through this link: https://jobs.lever.co/shopify/4490db27-9d2f-483e-abeb-0bc25a4b2194?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=Seek§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50598596.txt	§Roadside Assistance Call Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Roadside Assistance Call Centre§§Advertiser: §Apollo Motorhome Holidays§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About the role§ §  §Apollo guests travel from all corners of the globe to visit Australia and New Zealand and travel in an Apollo campervan or Motorhome. If any guest requires assistance while on the road, our team provides the support they need to continue enjoying their holiday. In this role you would be providing our traveling guests with solutions over the phone ranging from quick & easy trouble-shooting to more complex logistical solutions in order to get vehicles repaired and guests back on the road.§  §Key objective: §To provide an outstanding guest experience by providing fast, friendly and timely service thereby minimising any impact or downtime to our guest’s holiday.§  §To achieve this, your key activities will include: § § §Assist guests and other departments with vehicle related problems.§ §Negotiate best possible outcomes for guest experience while balancing business requirements.§ §Track incidents to ensure guests are kept well informed of solutions and repair progress.§ §Minimise vehicle repair time.§ §Ensure repairs are being carried out in accordance with standard repair practices.§ §This position is based at our Auckland Rental Centre, and is a permanent full time role with approximately 40 hours per week plus some reasonable additional hours on a ten day per fortnight roster. Shifts are between 8am and 7pm. This position requires some weekend shifts as per roster. §  §Skills and Experiences§  §We are looking for a well-organised and team-focused individual with high energy levels and a passion for helping external and internal customers.§  §You should possess the following skills and experiences to be successful in this role:§ § §Guest services and call center experience,§ §Excellent interpersonal skills and an empathetic communication style,§ §Strong problem solving abilities,§ §An automotive understanding or mechanical aptitude would benefit but is not essential§ §Good time management and the ability to prioritise tasks and remain calm under pressure,§ §Comfortable with following processes and procedures,§ §Intermediate computer skills.§ §A second language such as, German or any other European language would be beneficial.§  §Culture and Benefits§  §We offer a supportive team environment and unique industry benefits such as paid camping leave in addition to annual leave. You will also be able to take advantage of our generous staff rental policy which allows you to use RVs free of charge.§  §If you are looking for a fast-paced, yet rewarding role in an exciting industry, and you believe you possess the required skills and experiences, then please apply now.§  §About the company§  §Apollo Motorhome Holidays is a division of Apollo Tourism & Leisure Ltd (ATL).  ATL is listed on the Australian Stock Exchange and is a multi-national, vertically integrated manufacturer, rental fleet operator, wholesaler and retailer of a broad range of recreational vehicles, including motorhomes, campervans and caravans.§  §With locations in Australia, New Zealand, the USA and Canada, UK/Ireland and Europe opportunities to join our team at any level are endless. Explore a new career in anything from customer service to management, either at our branches or within our Head Office in Brisbane.§  §Your future at Apollo is limited only by your imagination. Our dedication to staff development is a reality, not just a slogan.§  §With every role making real contributions to the business, you have the unique opportunity to make history as part of the Apollo success story.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§What's your expected hourly rate?§§§
