jobText: TXT/50599619.txt	§Customer Operations Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Operations Advisor§§Advertiser: §Canterbury of New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Salary§§Base, clothing allowance and other buying benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About Us§ §Canterbury of New Zealand was established back in 1904 when John Lane, Pringle Walker and Alfred Rudkin began producing woollen garments deep in the Canterbury Province of New Zealand.  Before long, they were making uniforms for the army during the First World War, and they earned themselves a reputation for manufacturing tough, durable kit.  So much so, the legendary All Blacks rugby team approached them to produce rugby attire in which they could play. § §The rest as they say is history; Canterbury of New Zealand outfitted the All Blacks team for over 75 years and is now the largest dedicated rugby brand in the world.  Canterbury currently supplies kit to numerous high-profile national teams; England Rugby, Ireland Rugby, British & Irish Lions, Australian Rugby league as well as leading clubs such as NZ Vodafone Warriors, Canterbury Bankstown Bulldogs, NSW State of Origin, Leinster and Bath Rugby including a number of NPC sides.§ §About the Role§ §This is a highly administrative Customer Operations Advisor role working across a range of sales channels.  Although your role will be focused on our Wholesale customers, you will also be cross trained in Teamwear and Credits/Returns as part of collaborative team that supports each other through the busy periods and provide cover for leave.§ §As the key conduit between our customers and the supply process you will be responsible for high volume order processing and administration of customer accounts.   No doubt about this, it is a busy role requiring strong administrative skills.§ §Your day to day includes§ § §First point of contact for our customers across the ANZ region§ §Process customer orders through our phone, web and email queues for multiple sales channels§ §Processing customer returns and credits§ §Provide pricing and delivery information§ §Provide prompt customer service and issue resolution§ §Escalate unresolved issues to appropriate departments§ §Providing Sales Support to our reps in relation to their customer accounts§ §Responding to social media channels§ §And more….§ §Our business has evolved significantly over the last two years with the introduction of new online systems, automating ways of working etc however some of our systems still require administrative support.§ §About You§ §You’ll be used to working in a fast pact customer focused environment and able to manage multiple tasks across different sales channels.  Your skills will include§ § §Fast and accurate data entry§ §Advanced Excel skills and intermediate on other Microsoft Office products§ §Excellent organisational skills along with attention to detail§ §Ability to multi-task and prioritise workloads§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills§ §A hard working, motivated team player§ §A problem solver with good analytical skills§ §Sense of urgency§ §Effective in negotiation and communication (both verbal and written)§ §What’s on Offer§ §As an iconic kiwi brand our name is a household name.  Whilst you don’t have to be a sports buff to work here, an interest in the industry is an advantage.§ §We are a close-knit team of business professionals who work hard but love a good laugh and a shared lunch.§ §In addition to your salary we provide a uniform allowance to wear our brand, discounted products across Canterbury products and other brands from within the Pentland group, onsite parking in Avondale and other perks including the odd game day ticket (when we are allowed out!)§ §How to apply§ §Please apply via Seek with your current CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

If you are professional, articulate, have great attention to detail, §believe in delivering outstanding customer experiences§ and keen to grow with us, we want to talk to you.§ §This is a remote role, supporting our team in both the north and south islands - reporting to our Customer Engagement & Operations Manager based in Auckland§ §We want people who are:§ § §Committed to delivering outstanding customer experiences§ §A great cultural fit – professionalism, respect and honesty sum you up§ §Great work ethic – A no job is to big or too small attitude§ §Self-starter – there will be no shortage of things to do§ §Integrity - reputation and credibility mean everything to you §(as they do to us)§ §Hungry to grow - yourself and the business§ §For the right person we'll build a role around your skill set and contribution§ §Requirements include:§ § §Strong people skills§ §Previous Customer Service experience, ideally within a services business§ §Inbound and outbound calling experience§ §Accurate data entry skills§ §Experience with MS Office§ §Excellent time management§ §Previous scheduling experience would be ideal§ §Previous Accounts/Xero experience would be even more ideal§ §You'll be working alongside (albeit remotely) a dedicated team who will support you to extend your current skills and grow your competencies. collaborate internally with other Samples team members, sales teams, customer services, despatch and the marketing team.§ §Responsible for:§ §Sample finishing.§:  Ensure all samples are correctly finished, labelled, and stored as required for each brand, and for clients with custom range requirements.§Sample assembly§: ensuring the timely production of sample folders, sample boards and sample boxes.§Client service§ §and despatch§ – promptly responding to requests for samples via website, internal samples portal, via email and direct to the Samples room.§Helping the Sample Distribution Manager in c§arrying out regular stock reviews, and other tasks as required.§ § §Benefits and perks§ § §Be part of a small tight-knit team who takes pride in providing a high level of customer work hands-on as part of a team in a supportive and positive manner.§High attention to detail, especially with correct spelling and layout of sample labels.§Experience in a customer-facing role§A sense of humour and an ability to deal with the unexpected in a calm and professional manner.§Excellent relationship/communication skills and ability to relate at all levels§Good standard of written questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How would And it's the perfect time to jump aboard and be part of the journey.§      §Customer Service Representatives §      §What is the role?§        §This is a 6 months fixed term contract in a unique customer service role with variety and plenty of customer contact. Your duties will range from taking calls, making bookings, to checking in passengers, marshalling vehicles, handling luggage and working on the lines to prepare our ships for its voyage across the beautiful Cook Strait. §You will be required to drive our luggage truck from the terminal to our ships. A full and clean drivers' licence is required, as will your ability to drive a manual vehicle. §Our days revolves around our ships sailing times, therefore, you may be required to work nights, weekends and public holidays. §This is a varied role where no two days are the same and you'll be guaranteed to have fun while striving to deliver a memorable service for our travellers. You'll be part of an awesome team based at the Picton Ferry Terminal, we're a tight knit bunch, supportive and passionate about exceeding our customers' expectations.§What are we looking for?§You must love working with people and have a passion for delivering excellent customer service! You will get to meet and interact with a diverse group of travellers from all over the world and different walks of life, and you will get the opportunity to make their experience on the Bluebridge Cook Strait Ferries just a little bit more special. §We are looking for enthusiastic team players with a positive can-do attitude, fantastic communication skills and ability to remain calm under pressure. You'll be tech savvy and can pick up new systems quickly and have high attention to detail.§If you're looking for a fantastic career in tourism or customer service, then this could be the perfect role or you. We would love to hear from you, please apply online now!§      §      §      §      §Sailing between downtown Wellington and the Sounds 50 times a week, StraitNZ Bluebridge is part of one of New Zealand's largest transport companies, which also includes Linehaul and Freight Forwarding operations.§    §  §§§What is the role?§This is a 6 months fixed term contract in a unique customer service role with variety and plenty of customer contact. Your duties will range from taking calls, making bookings, to checking in passengers, marshalling vehicles, handling luggage and working on the lines to prepare our ships for its voyage across the beautiful Cook Strait. §You will be required to drive our luggage truck from the terminal to our ships. A full and clean drivers' licence is required, as will your ability to drive a manual vehicle. §Our days revolves around our ships sailing times, therefore, you may be required to work nights, weekends and public holidays. §This is a varied role where no two days are the same and you'll be guaranteed to have fun while striving to deliver a memorable service for our travellers. You'll be part of an awesome team based at the Picton Ferry Terminal, we're a tight knit bunch, supportive and passionate about exceeding our customers' expectations.§What are we looking for?§You must love working with people and have a passion for delivering excellent customer service! You will get to meet and interact with a diverse group of travellers from all over the world and different walks of life, and you will get the opportunity to make their experience on the Bluebridge Cook Strait Ferries just a little bit more special. §We are looking for enthusiastic team players with a positive can-do attitude, fantastic communication skills and ability to remain calm under pressure. You'll be tech savvy and can pick up new systems quickly and have high attention to detail.§If you're looking for a fantastic career in tourism or customer service, then this could be the perfect role or you. We would love to hear from you, please apply online now!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50605742.txt	§Customer Service Superstar - Holiday Homes!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Superstar - Holiday Homes!§§Advertiser: §Bachcare§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Guest Sales and Services - Bachcare Holiday Homes§ §We're on the lookout for a passionate Customer Service Superstar who loves everything about travel, tourism, and property!  Does this sound like you?  Here is your chance to join a fast-paced team who dedicate their days to ensuring that our guests find their happy place in one of our awesome holiday homes!  Right now, you'll be joining at an extraordinary time where staying at home and exploring the unique and stunning parts of Aotearoa, is keeping our whānau safe.§ §The Role:§ §You’ll be based in our Auckland office with a wonderfully supportive team around you. As a Guest Sales and Services Representative, you are pivotal to the success of our business as you are the first point of contact for our holiday guests.  You will be responsible for answering all inbound and email enquiries with the focus on converting them to holiday home bookings.  In addition, you will actively promote some of New Zealand's best holiday homes.  There will also be the requirement to support our holiday home owners too.§ §We are looking for:§ §Someone that is passionate about delivering an exceptional customer experience throughout our entire customer journey.  You must be fanatical about helping people find their happy place for their next holiday. Being a team player is really important too! You must have a can do attitude and are happy to roll up your sleeves and get stuck in.  Exceptional customer service is your forte and is something that you will not sacrifice.  You are a natural problem solver, but are confident and happy to ask when you need to.  You go above and beyond for your customers and colleagues.§ § § §Important Skills to Have:§ § §Meticulous eye for detail§ §12+ months call centre experience§ §Exceptional work ethic§ §Exceptional verbal and written communication§ §Results driven§ §Highly motivated§ §Great problem solver and lateral, innovative thinker§ § § §Our Culture:§ §We are a team that is happy to roll up our sleeves to get the job done!  We're honest and humble, curious and innovative, and most importantly we deliver amazingness in everything that we do.  We are fully supportive of a flexible working environment too, so we are happy for your time to be spread between our Support Office in Parnell and your home office, if remote working is your jam. We've proudly been selected as finalists for The Westpac Business Awards' Employer of the Year, 2020.§ § § §About Bachcare Holiday Homes:§ §Since 2003, Bachcare has been helping holiday home owners and holidaymakers find their happy place. We fully manage the holiday home on behalf of the owner - they simply give us the keys and we will deliver them a return and take care of everything else, including listing on multiple booking sites. Not only are we now managing over 2000 holiday homes nationwide (the largest in New Zealand), but we also have a high performing guest site where over 2 million holidaymakers visit every year and can directly book a Bachcare Holiday Home.§ § § §Ready To Apply? Send your CV and cover letter through via Seek.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§If you could only choose one NZ holiday destination to visit for the rest of your life, where would it be and why?§Can you give a specific example of a time that you have gone above and beyond? Describe why you took this approach?§This role is made up of a variety of day, evening and weekend shifts which will run across 5 days out of 7, any time Monday-Sunday, between 7am and 12am.  Are you able to commit to these type of shifts?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50607934.txt	§Customer Service Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative§§Advertiser: §Toyota§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Customer Service Representative §    §    §      §        §Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand. We constantly strive to deliver customer satisfaction and continually transform ourselves to meet our customer's needs and styles, passion’s and dreams.  From the moment you enter Toyota - you will notice a difference!  We back our people to do extraordinary things and believe that if you can dream it, you can do it!§        §Based at our National Headquarters in Palmerston North, we currently have a full-time position within our award-winning Customer Care Centre to work as a Customer Service Representative (Monday - Friday).  The CSR position is an empowered one that represents the voice of Toyota New Zealand and our customers, and the role offers the opportunity to deliver exceptional service to our customers every day.  In a supportive team environment, you are working directly with our customers, dealers and internal departments via phone, email, chat and social media. You will offer personalised customer support and be a team player. Alongside that you will be organised, willing to take ownership of cases, proactive in sourcing information and able to investigate and find solutions that benefit both Toyota and our customers. §        §We pride ourselves on our people so to be successful in the role you will need:§        §          §The ability to speak Mandarin is advantageous§          §To be a Self-Starter – you will be motivated, energetic, have great pride in yourself and your work and open to change§          §An EXCELLENT attitude – you are optimistic, positive and always look for the ‘yes’§          §EXCEPTIONAL customer service skills, you naturally go the extra mile for both the customer and your colleagues §          §A case management approach - you proactively ‘own’ and manage your cases, look for solutions and build “customers for life” along the way§          §Excellent time management skills and the ability to handle multiple cases with ease§          §The ability to relate to, understand and communicate with a wide variety of people§          §The ability to actively listen, use initiative and consider multiple points of view without judgement§          §To be emotionally resilient, able to work under pressure and be able to handle difficult situations with confidence§          §Strong attention to detail and ability to notice and act on opportunities for improvement §          §Intermediate computer skills (Word, Excel)§          §Previous automotive industry experience advantageous but not essential§          §Strong written and verbal English§        §        §Are you confident that you meet the above?  Then please apply with your cover letter and CV online today telling us why you think you have what it takes to excel in this role! §        §For a confidential discussion please do not hesitate to contact Annette Weatherall on §0800758673§.§        §Screening for this role will begin immediately.  Only applicants with New Zealand Citizenship or New Zealand Permanent Residency should apply.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Toyota New Zealand is a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation, Japan and in 2020 celebrated 33 years of vehicle market leadership in New Zealand. We constantly strive to deliver customer satisfaction and continually transform ourselves to meet our customer's needs and styles, passion’s and dreams.  From the moment you enter Toyota - you will notice a difference!  We back our people to do extraordinary things and believe that if you can dream it, you can do it!§Based at our National Headquarters in Palmerston North, we currently have a full-time position within our award-winning Customer Care Centre to work as a Customer Service Representative (Monday - Friday).  The CSR position is an empowered one that represents the voice of Toyota New Zealand and our customers, and the role offers the opportunity to deliver exceptional service to our customers every day.  In a supportive team environment, you are working directly with our customers, dealers and internal departments via phone, email, chat and social media. You will offer personalised customer support and be a team player. Alongside that you will be organised, willing to take ownership of cases, proactive in sourcing information and able to investigate and find solutions that benefit both Toyota and our customers. §We pride ourselves on our people so to be successful in the role you will need:§  §The ability to speak Mandarin is advantageous§  §To be a Self-Starter – you will be motivated, energetic, have great pride in yourself and your work and open to change§  §An EXCELLENT attitude – you are optimistic, positive and always look for the ‘yes’§  §EXCEPTIONAL customer service skills, you naturally go the extra mile for both the customer and your colleagues §  §A case management approach - you proactively ‘own’ and manage your cases, look for solutions and build “customers for life” along the way§  §Excellent time management skills and the ability to handle multiple cases with ease§  §The ability to relate to, understand and communicate with a wide variety of people§  §The ability to actively listen, use initiative and consider multiple points of view without judgement§  §To be emotionally resilient, able to work under pressure and be able to handle difficult situations with confidence§  §Strong attention to detail and ability to notice and act on opportunities for improvement §  §Intermediate computer skills (Word, Excel)§  §Previous automotive industry experience advantageous but not essential§  §Strong written and verbal English§Are you confident that you meet the above?  Then please apply with your cover letter and CV online today telling us why you think you have what it takes to excel in this role! §For a confidential discussion please do not hesitate to contact Annette Weatherall on §0800758673§.§Screening for this role will begin immediately.  Only applicants with New Zealand Citizenship or New Zealand Permanent Residency should apply.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50610099.txt	§Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard), Richmond§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard), Richmond§§Advertiser: §Goldpine Industries Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Tasman§, §Nelson§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard), Richmond §    §      §        §Here at Goldpine, we are proud of being not just Kiwi-owned, but family-owned. We are the 'Outdoor Timber Specialist', run by and focused on rural people. We are committed to working as a team, to deliver value to our customers and achieve our company and individuals' success.§        §          §Varied yard and customer focused role!§          §If you are keen to learn we are keen to train you!§          §Locally owned/family owned company - for over 40 years!§        §        §Superpost®, Rhino®, Strongbuilt®, Ned's Sheds®, Ecoliving®, GOFENCE® and RainStopper® are just some of the exclusive and innovative products you'll find at Goldpine. These are all products designed specifically to deliver great value options to outdoor timber users.§        §Do you enjoy meeting people? Building relationships? H§elping customers and being part of a team? Keen to learn to drive a Forklift or Loader? §        §We have a new opportunity for someone with the personality, drive and confidence to become one of our Outdoor Timber Specialists. You'll be greeting customers with a smile and 'can do' attitude, talking to them to find out their needs and thrive on giving great service to ensure they receive the best value option for their project. We are all part of team here so helping out in the yard (getting orders ready, putting timber/posts away) will also be required.§        §While a background in sales, customer service or farming may be an advantage, as full training will be provided, it is more important that you are able to demonstrate:§        §          §Self-motivation and reliability.§          §Honesty, integrity and a commitment to deliver what you promise.§          §A friendly, energetic and positive personality.§          §Physical fitness appropriate for lifting timber/posts with a commitment to safe work practices.§          §A willingness to be trained and learn new skills.§        §        §What's in it for you?§        §          §Training and development - this includes our product knowledge as well as developing sales skills that can be used in store or on site. This role has a focus on contacting members of the Māori, Pasifika, and high deprivation community who the Ministry of Health have invited to complete a Bowel Screening kit. §Candidates would need Te Reo or a Pacific language skills. §You will answer questions they may have and will encourage them to participate in the programme.§        §This role requires someone who has:§        §          §the ability to converse fluently either in Maori or a Pacific language (must have)§          §cultural awareness and sensitivity along with the ability to connect with people over the telephone§          §a sense of humour, energy, and resiliency§          §a positive attitude, flexible approach and ability to multitask§          §a desire to ensure people access health services they are entitled to§          §confidence in making and taking calls§          §the technical ability to use a National screening database§          §proven ability to follow procedures and processes§          §a willingness to be part of a new screening programme and growing team§          §a passion for customer service excellence§          §the ability to analyse information before communicating this to a participant on the telephone§          §attention to detail, able to write clearly and concisely§          §quick and alert mind, with the ability to adapt§          §a commitment to quality.§        §        §You will be expected to work Monday - Friday (8 - 7pm rostered). We also work an occasional Saturday (penal rates apply).§        §Why is Bowel Screening Important?§        §Every year, more than 3000 New Zealanders are diagnosed with bowel cancer and more than 1200 die from it.§        §Māori are more likely than non-Māori to die from bowel cancer, partly because Māori are more likely to be diagnosed with bowel cancer at an advanced stage when it is more difficult to treat.§        §This free National Bowel Screening Programme aims to save lives by detecting bowel cancer at an early stage, when it can often be successfully treated and has a focus on initiatives that drive equitable participation for all population groups.§        §How does Bowel Screening save lives?§        §International evidence shows that bowel screening programmes can save lives through early diagnosis and treatment of bowel cancer. There may be no warning signs that bowel cancer is developing. Where cancers are diagnosed through services that treat people who already have symptoms of bowel cancer, only about 40% are found at an early stage.§        §Bowel Screening has health, social and economic benefits. Early identification and treatment results in better outcomes for those with bowel cancer and lower treatment costs when compared to the cost of treating more advanced cancers.§        §A bowel screening programme that has equal screening and follow-up rates for Māori and non-Māori could reduce inequities through early diagnosis and treatment.§        §The National Bowel Screening Programme has a focus on driving initiatives that support equitable participation for all population groups.§      §      §      §    §  §§§If you have the skills set, we are looking for, and speak Te Reo or a Pacific language, apply now.§Due to an internal promotion(s) we are now looking for Service Coordinators to join our team to provide service support to the National Bowel Screening Programme Register team.§A big focus of this role is to take calls and make calls to people to ensure that they receive the test kits and support they need to complete these. We also work an occasional Saturday (penal rates apply).§Why is Bowel Screening Important?§Every year, more than 3000 New Zealanders are diagnosed with bowel cancer and more than 1200 die from it.§Māori are more likely than non-Māori to die from bowel cancer, partly because Māori are more likely to be diagnosed with bowel cancer at an advanced stage when it is more difficult to treat.§This free National Bowel Screening Programme aims to save lives by detecting bowel cancer at an early stage, when it can often be successfully treated and has a focus on initiatives that drive equitable participation for all population groups.§How does Bowel Screening save lives?§International evidence shows that bowel screening programmes can save lives through early diagnosis and treatment of bowel cancer. jobText: TXT/50621451.txt	§Monitoring Operator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Monitoring Operator§§Advertiser: §Electra Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§ §Energetic, forward-thinking and dynamic team environment§ §Keep your days free and work on our night-shift§ §Starting rate of $20.74 / hour with room to grow your skills!§ §Securely™ is a Levin-based company that provides medical alarms, house alarms and business alarms. We offer a 24/7 alarm monitoring service for our wide range of customers throughout New Zealand with offices in Levin, Tauranga, and Lower Hutt.  Securely™ embraces cutting-edge international technology to deliver alarm solutions over and above what is expected and with an enviable product range, we’re experiencing fantastic growth.  The future looks bright.§ §About the role§ §As our newest team member, you’ll be responsible for supporting different customer enquiries in an outbound and inbound capacity.  You will be providing customers with information, updates and managing their queries and complaints, promptly. The types of calls you may receive range from commercial and domestic security alarm queries through to medical alarm activations and electricity outage/fault enquiries. This is a very diverse, fast-paced and demanding role that will see you busy from the start to the end of your day!§ §About you§ §Experience in a customer service role, is a must. ideally in a call-centre environment. You must have a mature mindset, are considered and empathetic when approaching your customers.   § §You must be adaptable and open to change, excited at the possibility of learning new things, and have a great attitude!  You'll also be computer literate and have a good handle on using different systems, including Microsoft Office.§ §About the team§ §You will be working with a close-knit, driven and motivated group of individuals that help one another, no matter how busy they get. With a Senior Monitoring Operator on each shift, you’ll be able to ask questions and approach situations confidently.  We provide great training too!§ §This role is on a night-shift, and the hours are:§ §Shift A § §Saturday – 12am – 8am§ §Sunday – 12am – 8am§ §Monday – 4pm – midnight§ §Why join Securely™?  § §We offer a great solution to having your days free, working on our night and afternoon shift patterns,  a competitive hourly rate, great training and excellent company benefits. § §If successful, you will be required to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol testing and other pre-employment checks.  We’ll expect you to know all about us, so visit https://securely.nz  to find out more!§§§§

jobTitle: Outbound Sales Representative Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50624579.txt	§Outbound Sales Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outbound Sales Representative§§Advertiser: §Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Outbound§§§§§§The Pitch.§The Coca-Cola Amatil NZ Contact Centre has the best Outbound B2B Sales team in the industry and we have a bunch of industry awards to prove it! We've got passionate teams focused on providing a world-class customer experience and a team culture that will make you fizz. To top it off we have the best known brands in the world to sell to some of the best customers in the country. Due to an internal promotion, we are on the hunt for an Outbound Sales Representative to join our awesome team, so if you're looking for an exciting new career, apply now!§The Role.§The key to this role is going to be your ability to influence the sale using your exceptionally savvy sales skills to match our products to customer requirements over the phone. You must have the drive and passion to achieve your results focused KPI's. You'll be proficient in planning and time management as well as being part of our continuous improvement mind set.§What Do I Need?§Drive, Resilience, and Exceptional People Skills! To be part of the Outbound Sales team you will need great communication skills, be an expert at building relationships and have a strong Customer Experience focus. Experience in the sales capacity is a must and you’ll have a proven track record of delivering results. We want you to demonstrate your ability to hit sales targets and thrive on monthly initiatives.§The Benefits.§You'll get a competitive salary, plenty of complimentary product, superannuation, company shares, product gifting, life and income protection insurance, as well as free parking onsite in a convenient Mt Wellington location!  It doesn't get much better than that!  Most importantly, with our world-famous learning and development environment it is your future that will be invested in - who knows where your Amatil NZ career path will take you!§The Culture.§We are exceptionally proud to be recognised as one of NZ’s Best Employers four years in a row! If you ask our team what they love about working here, they'll tell you it's our people, our brands, and our culture. Our vision and values are at the heart of everything we do, and we are committed to creating millions of moments of happiness and possibilities for our employees. Bring the real you and be part of a culture where we embrace equal opportunities and promote diversity and inclusion. We encourage you to apply to bring your unique differences and perspectives to Coca Cola Amatil.§Applications Close: 7 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50625426.txt	§Collections Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Collections Officer§§Advertiser: §Go Car Finance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Who we are:§ §We are a growing vehicle finance company and proud of our strong reputation for customer service excellence, our dynamic and innovative approach, and our great people. We’re not your average car finance company; we’re specialists in getting our clients into the car they need and making sure they stay in it. The way we do it? It’s more than our flexible finance - it’s our wraparound support packages that look after our clients, their finances, and their cars.§ §We’re always on the lookout for great talent and none more so than right now.   Delivering the extra special care that we are renowned for is more important than ever, as we help our clients navigate their loans post COVID-19.§ §This is an opportunity to work alongside some of the best minds in the business who have been recognised at industry level for excellence and you will work in a fun and friendly open-plan office in the heart of vibrant Newmarket.§ § § §Who we need:§ §We are looking for Intelligent, customer-focused individuals to join our Customer Care team.§ §To succeed in this role you need to be 100% customer-focused and solutions-driven.  You’ll be keen to grow and progress in an ethical business that cares about people and celebrates success. You’ll be willing to work hard and be open to a changing environment as things move very quickly here! You’ll need to be compliant with industry regulations so must be comfortable following processes and procedures.  And, as you’ll be communicating regularly with our clients over the phone, you’ll have a great phone manner as well as good written and numeric literacy.§ §The role is forty hours per week from Monday to Friday or Tuesday to Saturday.§ §This is a great place to build your career and, if you have what it takes, the opportunity to progress and grow with the business is very real.  We have a great culture with a set of values that underpin everything we do.§ §We offer a competitive salary which includes KPI's, a generous annual training allowance and an opportunity to grow your career.  And while we work hard, we have fun at the same time with a vibrant culture, thriving Social Club, Chocolate Fridays and our very own Monsters University!§ §We receive lots of applications for roles so don't just send your CV - send a covering letter too explaining why you are interested in working here and would be a great addition to our team.§ §You must be entitled to work full-time in New Zealand.§ §For more information about us, please check out our website: www.gocar.co.nz/§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have collections experience?§How many years' experience do you have in the financial services industry?§§§

With our sister companies, we are specialists in advice, acquisition and directing of clients' investment portfolios.  We pride ourselves in offering a property management service that goes beyond the basics to take a pro-active and strategic approach in maximising the performance of our clients' portfolios.§ §We are seeking an experienced, (must have at least four years experience in the residential or commercial property management industry) senior property manager.   Our team is important to us and we  need a team leader who can be collaborative and drive the culture.   You will have excellent skills in leading the team to success.   Success for us is in our team, they are the reason why we have happy clients who achieve good investment results.   We are looking for a person who loves to play on  a team and strives to see all players become become stars.§ §You will have sound  knowledge of the RTA and understand  the importance of ensuring new legislation is complied with.  You will support the Operations Director in both internal and external training standards; introduction of new legislation; driving KPI's; maintaining portfolio growth; and be proactive and look for resolutions. § §Managing a small portfolio will come with the role and includes all normal property management duties.    With your experience you know that communication, attention to detail and maintaining processes is the success of a great property manager.§ §We are based in smart new  offices in Newmarket.  A good base salary and a generous commission/bonus structure is offered, along with a company car and carpark.§ §If you are ready for your next challenge and want to work in a progressive company with diverse career opportunities, be a star now and apply to be our Team Leader.§ §Applicants must have at least 3 years work experience in NZ/Australia and hold a NZ drivers licence.§ §Please submit your CV and cover letter via the Seek website for consideration.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50637046.txt	§Customer Care online Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care online Specialist§§Advertiser: §The Warehouse Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Customer Care online Specialist §      §        §Company Description§        §The Warehouse Group (TWG) is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand.. TWG consists of six core retail brands: The Warehouse, Warehouse Stationery, Noel Leeming, Torpedo7, 1-day and TheMarket. We have 260+ retail stores, online stores as well as distribution centres throughout New Zealand. We also have two overseas sourcing offices located in China and India. We are a people-centred business with more than 12,000 team members across our locations.§        §Job Description§        §The heart of our business is a great customer service team – not only are they skilled in the art of delivering great service to our customers but they have a passion for what they do.§        §We are now looking for additional team members to join our Customer Care team in our Hamilton site. So if you have the passion and you truly “get” what outstanding customer service is all about then this can be a perfect option for you!§        §Reporting through to a Customer Care Coach (Team Leader) you will be responsible for our supporting our chat-based customers. We are looking for a “gadget guru” someone who is up with the play on the last technology and has the patience to those that may be less techno savvy along§        §As a Customer Care Online Specialist your key responsibilities will be:§        §          §Responding to customer enquiries, taking ownership through to resolution.§          §Quickly ascertaining what the customer’s needs are and being to promptly respond§          §Running efficient case management and follow-up within agreed timeframes.§          §Managing a number of chat interaction at once.§          §Keep up to date with processes and procedures to ensure accurate information is provided.§          §To provide an effortless customer experience§        §        §Qualifications§        §The ideal candidate will have:§        §          §Vast experience in a customer services environment with a proven track record of offering exceptional customer service. Coming from a chat based back-ground is advantageous but not essential.§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills.§          §An outstanding phone manner – being able to express ideas, thoughts and concept clearly, using correct and appropriate language, organisation and structure.§          §Experience with Salesforce, CRM, Microsoft Dynamics and the full MS Office suite is an added benefit.§          §Strong keyboard skills are a must, ideally 50-60words per min.§          §Great attention to detail and accuracy of work.§          §The ability to work with a sense of urgency and thrive working under pressure.§          §Have the ability to work with a diverse array of people and build successful working relationships both internal and external customers.§          §An ability to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability – thinking outside the box.§        §        §As this role is all about team work and working to KPIs and tight timeframes, we are after someone that can be relied on to have great punctuality and who has a proven attendance record.§        §Additional information§        §These opportunities are a great foot in The Warehouse Group door; offering loads of development and insight about the Warehouse Group business with some good fun and laughs along the way. We have some great staff perks and guarantee an energetic and fast paced environment. §        §You will need to be available to work 40 hours a week between 8:00am - 6pm§      §    §    §twg.co.nz§  §§§Company Description§ §The Warehouse Group (TWG) is a New Zealand success story, founded by Sir Stephen Tindall and evolved from a single The Warehouse store to become one of the largest retailing groups in New Zealand.. jobText: TXT/50638791.txt	§Christmas Customer Service Ambassadors – Westfield St Lukes§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Christmas Customer Service Ambassadors – Westfield St Lukes§§Advertiser: §Scentre Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Every day, our people play a vital role in our purpose to ‘create extraordinary places, connecting and enriching communities.’§At Christmas, our customers look forward to experiencing the Christmas festivities at their local Westfield living centres that simply isn’t experienced anywhere else; which is why we are currently seeking Ambassadors to join our Westfield Customer Experience team to make this Christmas§ extraordinary! §Our Ambassadors play an important role in elevating the Christmas shopping experience by making it easy, festive, and fun for our customers across all service areas including Concierge, Valet, and Hands-Free Shopping. These roles will focus on delivering the highest quality customer experience every day to over 27,000 customers across Australia and New Zealand.§What sets you apart as a Westfield Christmas Customer Services Ambassador?§§You are customer-obsessed and ooze enthusiasm and positivity§Always willing to go above and beyond for our customers and retailers; making a difference to their day§Embody patience, empathy and know how to operate in the moment and remain present within a fast-paced retail environment§You are personable and genuinely love interacting with customers§You are curious; think on your feet and like to think ‘outside the box’§Empowered to rectify and resolve customer questions§You feel confident in providing assistance, directions, and information to customers in a busy retail environment.§§Your checklist:§§These positions will commence in §November 2020 §until §January/February 2021 §so regular availability is essential for these roles§Adequate flexibility to work across a 7-day week (Monday-Sunday) including Public Holidays.§§All successful candidates will be required to complete an automated video interview as part of our screening process, a medical assessment, and need to be comfortable to walk up to 10,000 steps per shift and feel at ease on their feet for up to 8 hours. We will be using email as the primary method of communication, so please ensure you keep an eye on your emails to monitor your application status.§What sets us apart?§Our diverse and inclusive workforce is not only something we’re proud of, but something we’re committed to. We encourage and support our people to bring their ‘whole selves’ to work every day. This is because we believe all our differences contribute to our success and ensures a workforce that reflects the customers we serve. Our commitment is backed by executive and employee-led working groups including All Abilities, LGBTI, Mental Health & Wellness, and Gender Equity alongside other initiatives such as our Reconciliation Action Plan to grow our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander workforce.§This is a §seasonal casual position§ and is the perfect chance to shine, gain valuable experience to get your foot in the door for a career at Scentre Group.§If this sounds like you, please click ‘apply’ today to start an application to become a Westfield Christmas Ambassador and make someone’s Christmas Extraordinary! Should you have any questions regarding these positions, please don’t hesitate to email our dedicated Christmas Talent Acquisition team, via §scentregroupcareers@scentregroup.com§.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50641554.txt	§Customer Service Representative - Fixed-term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative - Fixed-term§§Advertiser: §Vector§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About us§ §We’re on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand & Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity.§ §Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§ §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§ §About the role§ §As a part of our Welcome Centre team, you will provide exceptional customer service on behalf of our retail customers, ensuring resolution are found for all metering requests, queries and any disputes that come through as dealt with in timely manner. Your day will be filled with managing queries such as scheduling dates, appointments and ensuring all coordination is being carried out for successful field visits. In addition, you support and challenge work processes/procedures across business units and recommend improvements to customer experience and team where needed.§*Please note this is a fixed-term role until 31 December 2020.§ §Who we are looking for?§ §You'll bring some previous customer service or call centre experience. You're a great communicator and have the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers.§ §You will also bring the following:§ § §Ability to handle customer complaints§ §Strong computer skills - Word and Excel§ §Attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation§ §Personal resilience, positivity and enthusiasm§ §This is an opportunity to join and lead a positive and hardworking team. You will enjoy ensuring that good fun and hard work go hand in hand. You understand the value of internal relationships and enjoy leading a fast-paced, experienced team.§ §What we can offer you§ §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Why wouldn't you want to work here.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50645983.txt	§Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Trade & Enterprise§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §NZTE is New Zealand's international business development agency. Our role is to help New Zealand businesses build strategic alliances and develop commercial relationships internationally.§      § Through a global network of 45 offices, we connect New Zealand businesses with the world, sharing opportunities, knowledge, experience and networks.§    §    §      §Customer Manager - Pou Arahi - Māori Business §      §      §      §        §Kia hiwa ra, kia hiwa ra!!§Ka tangi te tītī, ka tangi te kākā, ka tangi hoki āhau§§        §Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is increasing the number of businesses we work with to grow internationally. We have a strong commitment to growing the number of Māori export businesses we work with.§        §To support this we have three fantastic opportunities in our Māori customer team based in Tāmaki Makaurau and Te Whanganui-a-Tara. We are looking for Customer Managers to join our high performing team of committed and dedicated people, where you can use your Māori and commercial "know how" and "know who" to grow Māori businesses internationally - bigger, better and faster for the good of Aotearoa New Zealand.§        §Who we are§        §Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is New Zealand's international business development agency. Existing for one purpose - to grow New Zealand businesses internationally. Our Customer Manager roles require you to develop strong relationships with a diverse portfolio of Māori customers across a number of sectors including agritech, technology, food and beverage, manufacturing and fashion. §        §What you'll be doing§        §We are looking for Customer Managers to create true partnerships with our Māori customers based in Tāmaki Makaurau and Te Whanganui-a-Tara. You'll work intensively with them to deeply understand their business - their challenges and opportunities, and their international growth strategy, and build a work programme together to help them achieve their goals.Additionally, you will need the ability to be a problem solver and connect your customers to the right experts to address challenges and raise opportunities.§        §What you'll need to be successful§        §Understanding Māori businesses is a core component of the role. This combined with your strong commercial acumen (preferably gained with export businesses), and a proven ability to deliver results will be support you to be successful in the role. Building relationships across the NZTE and NZ Inc network is an important part of what we do, along with Māori customer growth success. You will understand the context for Māori business, be confident in working with Māori businesses, their shareholders and owners. You will have the ability to build relationships inside and outside of Māoridom. You will be enthusiastic, a strong communicator and have the ability to not only build rapport but develop strong and trusted relationships. Your ability to work independently and connect with the broader NZTE team will be paramount. You will be proud of your skill sets and have the ability to grow others through sharing your knowledge of Māori culture, people and business for Māori customer growth success. You will also have a willingness to learn from others.§        §You will possess passion and energy to help regional businesses succeed on the global stage. You will be customer centric, where you understand the customer's opportunities and challenges. This will be done by connecting to our customers with empathy, credibility and commercial reality.§        §An understanding of and experience in tech and food and beverage sectors is a benefit, particularly in start-up and growth.§        §Why you'll love working here§        §You will be exposed to an array of businesses across different sectors. You will be joining a commercially astute team who learn from each other's depth of experience and have strong commitment to lifting New Zealand's economic performance. Not only will you be a part of a team of 700 across the globe, you will be part of our specialist Māori Business Team - Te Pora Māori. Te Pora Māori is a dispersed team based in NZ and Internationally, who champion the success of Māori exporting business through investment opportunities, strategic relationships and capability uplift.§        §What's next§        §If you are passionate about assisting Māori businesses to grow bigger, better, faster internationally, and have an adventurous spirit that enjoys challenges and complex work, we'd love to hear from you - apply now!§        §Applications close at 5.00pm on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§        §We believe New Zealand is good for the world.  A country embracing its diverse landscapes and people. At NZTE it's all about the people. We work flexibly at NZTE and we're keen to talk to you about what that might mean for you in this role.  We're deeply connected to the diversity of our people across the globe and embrace how that drives our organisation and the country forward. §      §    §    §FOR MORE INFORMATION about NZTE and this role please visit https://www.nzte.govt.nz/about/careers/jobs/§ Date: §  §§§Kia hiwa ra, kia hiwa ra!!§Ka tangi te tītī, ka tangi te kākā, ka tangi hoki āhau§§Te Taurapa Tūhono - NZTE is increasing the number of businesses we work with to grow internationally. The successful applicant will display excellent communication skills, high presentation standards, honesty and an excellent work ethic. Legal entitlement to work in NZ is mandatory.§        § §        §The Foodstuffs North Island Limited’s vision is to make sure New Zealanders get more out of life (in tune).  By delivering sustainable shopping experiences so awesome, New Zealanders have more of what matters to them by (inform). So that we are most preferred by customers, employees and suppliers.  Create purposeful careers and bright futures for New Zealanders who work with us. Build a sustainable and profitable future for our customers, colleagues, Co-op, communities and country (in front).§        § §        §This role is crucial to live and embed the FSNI vision and role model the §values§ of:§        §Think customer§ - Thinking customer is about every decision and every action being grounded in understanding all New Zealanders, and what matters most to them. Someone who thinks customer always communicates why they’re doing things from a customer point of view, and considers the impact it will have on customers. §        §In it together§ - People who are in it together look after each other, back one another, and work together as one winning team, every time. They collaborate, play in position, and communicate proactively, because they know it’s not good enough to wait for other people to come to them… they go out and get that conversation started themselves.  §        §Courageous §- This is about being bold, innovative and unafraid to try new ways of doing things to stay ahead of the game for our customers. It’s about that Co-op fighting spirit and people who don’t give up, even when it’s hard.  Courageous people aim high, because they aren’t afraid to try. They take responsibility, ownership and accountability for what they do and how they behave every day. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand and Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity.§        §Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§        §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§        §About the role§        §As part of our new project, we are looking for a representative to join us and be the key contact point for our customers and field technicians. This role will take ownership of all work orders and queries of customers and field technician to ensure they are met. You will be flexible to support the workflow of your peers and be comfortable to participate in shift-rosters and when needed along with:§        §          §previous customer service or call centre experience and a strong commitment to a quality and courteous customer service§          §great communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers§          §customer issue management and resolution experience§          §computer literacy - Word and Excel§          §attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation§          §personal resilience, positivity, and enthusiasm.§        §        §What we can offer you§        §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Why wouldn't you want to work here.§      §      §      §      §www.vector.co.nz§    §  §§§About us§ §We're on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand and Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity.§ §Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§ §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia.§ §About the role§ §As part of our new project, we are looking for a representative to join us and be the key contact point for our customers and field technicians. This role will take ownership of all work orders and queries of customers and field technician to ensure they are met. The role will be required to work an 8-hour shift to enable the customer services from 7am to 7pm Monday to Friday.§ §Other key areas of responsibilities include the following:§ § §Responding to general enquires received via phone or email promptly and efficiently with excellent customer service with a focus on first call resolution§ §Managing service requests end to end§ §Identify areas for continuous improvement§ §Work within set standards and processes to ensure Vector meets its compliance requirements§ §Liaise with the relevant parts of the business and service providers to investigate and resolve complaints promptly§ §Who are we looking for§ §We are looking for a great team player who thrives in a busy and collaborative environment. You will be flexible to support the workflow of your peers and be comfortable to participate in shift-rosters and when needed along with:§ § §previous customer service or call centre experience and a strong commitment to a quality and courteous customer service§ §great communication skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external customers§ §customer issue management and resolution experience§ §computer literacy - Word and Excel§ §attention to detail and accuracy in processing documentation§ §personal resilience, positivity, and enthusiasm.§ §What we can offer you§ §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Why wouldn't you want to work here.§§§§

The newly formed leadership team has been given the keys to an iconic New Zealand heritage brand, and we are looking for dynamic and experienced §Customer Service Representatives§ to help support our Bendon and Frederick's of Hollywood online businesses.§ §We are unique in that we design, manufacture and sell our own products including Pleasure State, Fayreform, Lovable, Fredericks of Hollywood and of course Bendon. We put our customers first, and we have a team who empower and lead relentlessly to provide exceptional product and customer service. We believe that if we collaborate as one team, we have the ability to deliver amazing experiences to our loyal Bendon and Frederick's customers.§ §We are looking for someone who is excited about coming on our journey of transforming this amazing brand.§ §What you'll do:§ § §Provide exceptional customer service for our Frederick's of Hollywood customers though email and live chat§ §Process customer returns and refunds§ §Monitor customer feedback through external platforms§ §Escalate website issues/pricing inaccuracies to e-commerce team§ §Who you'll be: § § §Experience in a Contact Centre or a similar Customer Service role§ §High level of resilience - the ability to maintain a cool calm approach/remaining calm under pressure§ §A fast learner with excellent communication and customer service skills§ §A product master, be able to identify our product and assist customers in the buying journey (training provided)§ §Be able to work shift work and on weekends to service the US market§ §An understanding of US states and major cities (training provided)§ § §What we can offer you:§ § §Being part of the Bendon family in a casual and warm environment§ §Being part of a team who wants to make a difference§ §Competitive salary, flexible working and the ability to purchase leave in advance and achieve real work/life balance§ §Company discount card that offers great discount prices at our stores§ §Full induction and orientation package§ §Ability to join Bendon's corporate mobile phone plan§ §Career development opportunities§ §Funded professional development opportunities§ §Free car parking onsite§ §If you are passionate about retail and people, love lingerie, want to work for an international company and this sounds like an opportunity you'd like to explore further, then we'd love to hear from you. Apply online now.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50657684.txt	§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Henderson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Henderson§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Henderson §    §      §        §Job Ref: 34921§        §23 November 2020 start date§ §        §          §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§          §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture §        §        §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §        §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Henderson.    §        §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day.  Our comprehensive and modern training approach will equip you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§        §What we offer§        §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy modern training and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§        §Our current operating hours are:§        §          §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 10.00pm, and§          §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§        §        §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day.  You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§        §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §        §About you§        §          §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§          §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§          §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§          §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§          §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§          §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§        §        §Key recruitment process information§        §We are using alternative ways of interviewing whilst COVID-19 restrictions apply. If you are short listed the recruitment process may include, video interview, online assessment testing, and reference checking.  §        §          §Applications close:§ Sunday 11 October at 11.30pm §          §Successful candidates’ start date:§ 23 November 2020§        §        §Current MSD employees; it is important that you please apply through your myHR careers portal at work, so you are recognised as a current employee. Please apply from a work computer on the MSD network.  §        §All external candidates, please click the apply now button. we look forward to your online application.§        §All candidates must include a current / updated CV with their application.   A cover letter is not required as there are additional online application questions.  §        §For further queries please contact Maureen on §(09) 913 0383§.§        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 34921§  §23 November 2020 start date§ § § §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§ §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture § §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §  §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Henderson.    §  §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day.  Our comprehensive and modern training approach will equip you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§  §What we offer§  §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy modern training and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§  §Our current operating hours are:§ § §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 10.00pm, and§ §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§ §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day.  You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§  §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §  §About you§ § §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§ §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§ §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§ §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§ §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§ §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§ §Key recruitment process information§  §We are using alternative ways of interviewing whilst COVID-19 restrictions apply. If you are short listed the recruitment process may include, video interview, online assessment testing, and reference checking.  § § §Applications close:§ Sunday 11 October at 11.30pm § §Successful candidates’ start date:§ 23 November 2020§ §Current MSD employees; it is important that you please apply through your myHR careers portal at work, so you are recognised as a current employee. Please apply from a work computer on the MSD network.  §  §All external candidates, please click the apply now button. we look forward to your online application.§  §All candidates must include a current / updated CV with their application.   A cover letter is not required as there are additional online application questions.  §  §For further queries please contact Maureen on §(09) 913 0383§.§  §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents.  We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§  §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§
