Are you looking for that next career move and want to continue being part of the Suncorp success story?§        §An exciting opportunity is available within our Life team, to provide an excellent customer experience within an extremely fast-paced, inbound contact centre environment. At Suncorp, we believe in being brilliant in the moments that matter, and customer service is at the heart of everything we do. In this role, you will be effectively managing customer queries and look for opportunities to go above and beyond their expectations.§        §Key responsibilities§:§        §          §Provide a professional, efficient and responsive service to our customers.§          §Meet the needs of customers and look for opportunities to exceed their expectations and provide solutions to meet their needs.§          §Build positive relationships with internal and external customers.§          §Pursue First Call Resolution by fully utilising product and process knowledge skills Use call control and service techniques to help & support our customers§          §Contribute to the overall continuous improvement of the Contact Centre by proactively making suggestions.§          §Effectively resolve customer enquiries through a multitude of platforms including over the phone, live chat, email and social media §        §        §What we are looking for:§        §          §At least 18 months experience in a fast-paced customer service role – ideally in a first-line, contact centre environment§          §Exceptional phone skills and a passion for helping people over the phone§          §Solution focused with strong problem-solving abilities§          §Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written§          §Strong attention to detail and positive attitude§          §Flexible and resilient with the ability to cope under pressure§          §Comfortable using multiple company, supplier and technology systems§        §        §Hours§        §This is a part-time position, working 22.5 hours per week. You must be available §Monday§, §Thursday§ and §Friday§ each week to work rotating shifts between the operating hours of 8am-6pm. §        §Our Benefits§        §          §Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§          §Discounted insurance through Vero, Asteron Life and Southern Cross§          §Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§          §Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§          §We offer support and various programs for our people: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), $250 annually towards Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Company share options, Years of Service Recognition, etc.)§        §        §About Us§        §Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. In New Zealand, we offer insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands Vero and Asteron Life.§        §Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.§        §If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today. For further information please visit our careers website: §https://www.suncorp.co.nz/careers.html§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Suncorp is an organisation committed to our people, we have a culture where leaders are empowered to make decisions and individuals are able to succeed in a supportive environment that rewards both team work and ambition. You must be available §Monday§, §Thursday§ and §Friday§ each week to work rotating shifts between the operating hours of 8am-6pm. §Our Benefits§§Free life, salary continuance and trauma insurance cover§Discounted insurance through Vero, Asteron Life and Southern Cross§Flexible working environment and arrangements; genuine focus on work-life balance§Numerous discounts with our corporate partners (retail & shopping / travel & holiday / health & wellbeing)§We offer support and various programs for our people: Employee Assistance Program (EAP), $250 annually towards Health & Wellbeing, Study Support, Employee Referral Program ($600), Company share options, Years of Service Recognition, etc.)§§About Us§Suncorp is a leading financial services provider in Australia and New Zealand, enabling more than nine million customers to better protect and enhance their financial wellbeing. With a heritage dating back to 1902, we have grown to become a top-20 ASX-listed company with over 13,000 people. In New Zealand, we offer insurance products and services through our well-recognised brands Vero and Asteron Life.§Working within the Suncorp Network we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating an inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.§If this opportunity sounds like the challenge you have been looking for please apply online today. jobText: TXT/50662253.txt	§Customer Service§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service§§Advertiser: §Safety & Apparel Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§The Company:§ §Safety and Apparel supplies NZ industry with personal protective equipment (PPE) and related products and services. We have been successfully operating for over 18 years and have a large existing national customer base with branches in Hamilton, Auckland and Christchurch. § §We pride ourselves on our exceptional customer service and same day delivery promise, which sets us apart from our competition. Our values of Service, Trust, Integrity and Respect underpin everything we do.§ §The Role: Customer Service Team Member§ §We are looking for an individual who can deliver exceptional customer service and aligns themselves with our core values. You will be required to receive customer orders via, phone, e-mail and from our website, then accurately key those orders for processing and dispatch.§ §You will also be required to serve in our retail shop, interacting with customers face to face. You will display strong communication and relationship building competencies and will have the ability to deliver a high standard of accuracy while operating in a fast paced environment. § §This role is based at our main branch located in Te Rapa, Hamilton.§ §This will be a positive and rewarding position for someone who craves:§ § §Fast-paced work environment.§ §Opportunity to highlight their impeccable customer service skills.§ §Opportunity to immerse themselves in a company where success is recognised and rewarded.§ §Full support from the Customer Service Team, committed to your success.§ §You:§ § §Motivated by delivering exceptional customer service. § §Ability to learn computer systems quickly.§ §You will have a high attention to detail and take pride in producing accurate work.§ §Thrive on working together in a team environment.§ §Detailed and methodical in your approach.§ §You will enjoy working in a tight-knit team, have a positive attitude and a willingness to learn.§ §Details:§ § § A competitive remuneration package that recognises your efforts and success.§ §Company uniform is provided.§ §Full training and support to ensure your success.§ §Monday to Friday work week.§ §If you are the Customer Service Star we are after - apply now.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We aim to provide a premier service experience to our clients with cutting-edge job tracking and notification systems, excellent technical work and fantastic customer service.§ § § §A permanent position has recently become available for an energetic Customer Services Representative to be the face of our Penrose service operations and deliver industry-leading customer service our clients have come to expect.  This role serves as the primary point of contact for customers on all matters related to our products and services.§ §Primary duties include:§ § §Frontline customer service§ §Incoming and outgoing calls§ §Booking and processing service jobs-experience with i0S devices will be an advantage§ §Responding to service status enquires from end-user customers§ §Responding effectively and efficiently to our inbound customers§ §Processing deliveries, both incoming and dispatch§ §Other day-to-day & ad-hoc duties with regards to the service centre operations§ §To be successful in this role you should possess some of these core skills:§ § §Love working with customers and always willing to assist§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Excellent communication skills & time management skills§ §Ability to professionally handle various situations with a wide range of customers§ §Hands-on, ambition and drive to succeed - "Makes things happen"§ §Self-motivated and able to work with minimum supervision§ §Well presented, Outgoing and Confident - Positive attitude and strong interpersonal skills§ §Excellent data entry skills and accuracy§ § § §If you think you've got what it takes and want to part of a fast-paced service/logistics company apply, online now!§ §**** Please make sure before you apply that you have the legal right to work in New Zealand. data entry, complaint/conflict resolution and problem-solving§          §Intermediate-advanced level of proficiency in the Microsoft Office suite§          §Ability to work effectively under pressure and consistently meet deadlines§          §You will have a collaborative working style yet be able to stand on your own two feet§          §You will be a doer and capable of speedily delivering high volumes of quality work§          §You will be curious, and keen to learn more, and constantly looking at what’s possible§        §        §Who we are§        §A true kiwi success story, Foodstuffs North Island are a co-operative with a team of 22,000 in a growing network of 300+ stores (PAK’n’SAVE, New World, Four Square, Gilmours and Fresh Collective).§        §We serve over 1.3 million customers every week in the most awesome little country in the world. A typical day includes answering calls and emails from customers, answering questions about our products, processing invoices and handling customer concerns. Our ideal candidate is a team player, has great written and verbal communication skills, enjoys working in a fast-paced environment, and can maintain their sense of humour when under pressure. An interest in the Automotive Industry would be a bonus, but not essential.§ §We are a Hamilton based business. DTM is an importer and distributor of wheels and tyres and was established 30 years ago. The company has a nationwide and loyal customer base with a significant amount of business completed through the call centre§ §The Role§ §Reporting to the Customer Services Manager, we are looking for someone who is highly motivated and enjoys working in a Customer Services role. You will be part of a small team who are responsible for managing customer related telephone and electronic enquiries, orders and processing data. With a future opportunity to get into other roles if they arise.§ §What Do We Offer?§ §We offer a competitive salary and free car parking at our office.  You will benefit from working in a friendly office team with a wider network of dedicated, hard - working colleagues across NZ.   We provide ongoing training and development and we like to have a bit of fun!§ §About You§ §To be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate:§ § §A customer focus and an ability to develop strong relationships.§ §Experience of managing a busy workload and managing your time effectively§ §That you are a strong team player§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Excellent skills in the use of computer systems§ §Good email edacity § §Polite Phone Manor§ §So if you think you have what it takes to join Our Team, please apply, attaching your CV and covering letter in the first instance to:  §marketing@dtm.co.nz§ §Applications will close on 30th§ October 2020§, or earlier should the right candidate be found.§ §For more information about the company go to www.dtm.co.nz §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Have you worked in a call centre before?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§How many years' experience do you have as a customer services officer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50664017.txt	§Help Centre Coordinator (Fixed-Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Help Centre Coordinator (Fixed-Term)§§Advertiser: §Young Workers Resource Centre§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$22.10 - $26.72 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Are you interested in supporting young workers to have positive work experiences and achieve employment justice? §  §We’re looking for someone to join our passionate team of activists and educators in our Hamilton office. This is a fixed-term position (0.8 FTE) until July 2021, as the funding is tied to the MBIE Workers and Workers Assistance Fund. We will be seeking additional funding to extend this role if possible.§  §The successful candidate will be responsible for coordinating the YWRC help centre services, providing employment rights and relations information to young workers though our helpline and online processes. Our help centre is a new initiative in that we have received funding to expand the scope and breadth of our existing support services offered to young workers. §  §The successful candidate will be able to self-manage and also work co-operatively and will have excellent communication skills. They will be compassionate and have an innate sense of fairness. We are looking for someone who will:§ § §Be passionate about supporting young people, particularly regarding employment outcomes.§ §Possess well-developed written and oral communication skills.§ §Be able to work autonomously, and with self-management and prioritising skills.§ §Be able to work collaboratively in a small close-knit team, to multi-task and respond quickly and effectively to requests.§ §Have a well-developed understanding of employment legislation.§ §Possess well-developed interpersonal skills, and an ability to relate to people from diverse backgrounds.§ §Possess well-developed computer skills.§ §Have some experience operating successful helpline support services.§ §Be culturally competent and have an understanding of the Treaty of Waitangi.§ §The appointee will be a member of a small but supportive team of dedicated community activists. This is an exciting opportunity for a positive, enthusiastic, and politically aware person to join a passionate and progressive community organisation. In your covering letter let us know how you will successfully apply your skills, experience, and attributes to this role.§  §Applications must be received via email by 5pm on Wednesday 21 October 2020, and must include both a cover letter and CV. It is provisionally intended that interviews for this position will take place on Tuesday 27 October 2020. Applications should be addressed to:§  §Tony Stevens§YWRC§34 Harwood St§HAMILTON§  §Any queries about this position or to requests for a full position description may be sought from Tony Stevens by emailing admin@ywrc.org.nz or calling §07 834 7122§. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50666510.txt	§CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§CUSTOMER SERVICE MANAGER§§Advertiser: §SIFA NEW ZEALAND§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§ABOUT SIFA§  §With 30 offices, worldwide in 16 different countries, SIFA is a well-known French freight forwarder and a leading consolidator to the French overseas territories. The company has over 600 employees worldwide in its own network and a total turnover of AUD 100M (for more information visit our web site www.sifalogistics.com).§  §Our New Zealand branch ensures direct consolidation services to the Pacific Islands, Import and Export Air/Sea operations globally.§ §ABOUT THE ROLE §  §Currently, we are looking to add a stellar Customer Service Manager. Ideally the successful candidate will have a minimum of 3-5 years experiences within the freight forwarding industry.§ §DUTIES §  §Integral part of a small team, we are looking for someone flexible, hard worker and willing to evolve in the position and the company. The role is ensuring the customer service side and the operations of our “French Pacific” trade. You will be doing sea freight (LCL & FCL) and air freight, as well as dealing directly with customer and SIFA offices in New Caledonia and Tahiti.  The main tasks and duties are:§ § §Following up orders§ §Liaising with both NZ suppliers and our customers in New Caledonia and French Polynesia§ §Collection and dispatch of cargo§ §Quoting existing customers§ §Ensuring all documentation processing from A to Z§ §Travels to the French Territories§ §To success, you will need to be able to understand the client’s needs and requirements and the technical side of the freight chain.§  § §SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE§  §Air/Sea Import/Export knowledge§ § §Excellent customer service skills, both verbal and written§ §Excellent time management skills & a 'can do' attitude§ §French speaker is required§ §GOOD REASON TO JOIN? §  §Hard working but friendly work environment in a multicultural team. You will be given the opportunity to learn and evolve in the company. §  §Strong training policy§  §Package depending on profile.§  §****§  §To apply send your resume and cover letter to  atornel@sifalogistics.com  or on Seek.§  §****§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have freight forwarding experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50670302.txt	§Tip Shop Staff Members§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tip Shop Staff Members§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Is being physically active up on your radar?§Do have exceptional customer service skills?§Keen to be part of the Tip Shop Crew?§If you have ticked all the boxes, we would love you to apply for this role based at the Southern Landfill in Happy Valley.§Our Tip Shop is looking for 2 x permanent full-time staff members to work 5 days a week (1 role is Thursday to Monday and the other one is Tuesday to Saturday, §please specify in your cover letter if you have a preference§).§As a member of the team, you will help ensure our busy Tip Shop and Recycle Centre are resourced and up to the customer demand. You will be someone who can instantly engage with people and deliver an excellent customer experience as you will be dealing with the public receiving, sorting and diverting goods that would otherwise go to Landfill.§Rain, hail or shine you will be comfortable working at our operational site, on your feet with your high energy and positive attitude. You will be responsible for§Guiding customers with their goods§pricing and displaying goods in the Tip Shop§sales and cash handling§processing e-waste§performing daily cleaning tasks§providing informative and friendly advice to customers about correct use of our recycling facilities§Everyone loves knowing that they are contributing to something positive and we promise that is exactly how you will feel in this job. In short, our customers love us (they tell us every day), and we are a team of dedicated professionals who are working hard to make a great place that does good things, even better.§You will bring to this role;§a good level of physical fitness§excellent communication skills§competency using computers (i.e. ability to learn the touchscreen till operating system)§and most importantly heaps of enthusiasm and a can-do attitude§We offer the WCC living wage ($22.10/hr) and provide training to ensure you are able to perform all required tasks.§In return we offer a lot of benefits along with 5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff and a great culture to make your time with us meaningful and enjoyable§If this opportunity sounds exciting, then we welcome your application. Hit the apply button and/or to view the position description. All applications must be submitted online.§Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand and should have a full New Zealand Drivers licence.§If you have any questions, please get in contact with Shelali Shetty, Recycle Centre Manager at §Shelali.shetty@wcc.govt.nz§. Applications for this role close §12 October 2020.§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Case Managers - Palmerston North Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670350.txt	§Case Managers - Palmerston North§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Case Managers - Palmerston North§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §Case Managers - Palmerston North §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35094§        §Permanent and Fixed Term, full time§        §          §Can you play a key role supporting New Zealanders to achieve their goals?§          §Are you looking for a dynamic, varied role where building relationships is key to success?  §        §        §Case Managers play a vital role in our communities. §        §As a Case Manager, every day is busy and demanding but very rewarding as your work will have a meaningful impact on people's lives.§        §As part of one of our teams, you will work alongside clients to provide support to help improve their lives and enable them to move into employment and other development opportunities. §        §We offer a great work environment, a fabulous team culture and a way to make a real difference to the lives of New Zealanders. §        §It will appeal to highly motivated, adaptable, progressive candidates, who have a strong client-focus and are driven by service excellence and achieving results.  §        §If you are keen to join our team, please apply.  §        §About you§        §Your welcoming approach, Manāakitanga and excellent communication skills will enable you to establish a rapport and get to know and understand how best to support our clients as you work with them to support the achievement of their goals.§        §We are looking for someone who is focused on achievement and can practically help others to access job opportunities, training and development, education programmes and work experience because they understand the labour market, employment and career advisory.   §        §You’ll bring a high level of personal integrity, initiative and relationship management skills to the role. You’ll be comfortable navigating your way around computer systems and enjoy finding solutions to problems. You are curious and like to uncover details, enjoy analysing an issue and using good judgement to solve a problem.§        §If you are focused on achievement and can practically help others to set goals and discover their potential, you will enjoy the challenges and team-work within our Service Centres. §        §You will be well-organised, have good listening skills and an empathic and a non-judgmental approach to serving others.§        §What we offer§        §We will provide you with a positive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. We will also provide great training, support and on-going professional development.§        §Remuneration for this role is from $47,622.00 to $65,480.00 (Range D). It’s an extension of the very successful Hawke’s Bay Business Hub Ahuriri, which is recognised nationally as an outstanding example of regional business support and collaboration. §  §This is a part-time, fixed term Business Connector role, and is vital in connecting Hawke’s Bay businesses with the services and wider support networks available locally and through national agencies. §  §About the Role:§ § §Connect clients with Business Hub partners, making referrals, appointments, and offering services as appropriate.§ §Work closely with Business Hawke’s Bay team members and Hub partners and sponsors to align connections and referrals.§ §Ensure the Hub premises are maintained to a high standard for use by our clients, partners, and sponsors. § §Manage event planning including advertising, websites and social media, location, ordering and co-ordination of equipment, refreshments, invitee and attendance lists, together with management of the agreed budget.§ §Contribute to maintaining Business Hawke’s Bay partnership and engagement processes, systems, and procedures.§ §Utilise the online visitor management system to check-in new general enquiries to the HBBH Hastings together with the room booking system to manage and optimise room availability.§ §The Business Connector may be required to work different days and hours on occasion to perform the role, including attending meetings and functions outside of normal working hours.§ §About You:§ § §A genuine interest in businesses, the people who work in them and supporting their development, together with business acumen and the ability to develop rapport.§ §Demonstrated experience of customer service, co-ordination and support skills.§ §Strong administrative and marketing support skills, ideally with a relevant qualification in an office, administration, or marketing discipline.§ §Proven ability in developing and maintaining strong relationships with clients, and internal and external partners.§ §Demonstrated experience in event organisation and management.§ §Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate effectively and work successfully with people from a diverse range of backgrounds.§ §Demonstrate awareness of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and including Te Reo Māori in relevant and practical ways in interaction and engagement to demonstrate respect and value of Tikanga Māori in appropriate settings. § §Self-motivation, energy and initiative.§ §Strong accuracy and attention to detail skills.§ §Experience with the Microsoft Office suite of applications including Word, PowerPoint and Outlook, together with a sound working knowledge of database management and CRM software.§ §Willingness to work across our Business Hub sites in Ahuriri and Hastings and travel across the wider Hawkes Bay region.§ §Ability to work occasional evenings to support workshops and events.§ §Current clean Driver’s Licence.§ §We work in a small team so your actions will count; working collaboratively within the team supporting the smooth running of the Hawke’s Bay Business Hub across the region.§  §If you have the skills and experience we are looking for then apply now providing an up to date CV and cover letter.§  §For a confidential discussion about the role please contact §Louise Penprase§ on louise@businesshb.nz or 021 710219.§  §Applications close on Friday 16th October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

You are experienced in customer service and sales. You will have at least 3 years experience and a proven sales history in B2B.§ §You will manage this role unsupervised or as part of the team as we are setting up other areas of the business and need someone exceptional on the front desk. My business is process driven and you will follow them for success!§ §Our customers love a high level of customer service. We have a 60 minute customer service level. Contact is via the phone, email, facebook and via the online store.§ §We are results driven and we track all results, send out customer surveys and love great feedback. We expect a high level of positive feedback.§If you have all of this, love fashion, colour, chemistry and education then please apply. § § § § §Benefits and perks§ § § §Great location§ §Free parking § § § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You will have excellent administration and customer service skills with a focus on sales. jobTitle: Operations Adviser - Wellington Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50671921.txt	§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Fixed Term Contract till 31st July 2021§You must be able to start training on the 2nd November 2020§Application progressed you must be able to attend an Assessment Centre on the 14th October 2020§Competitive salary: $57,398 - 67,527§§ §Are you looking for a role in which you can work with exciting technology and dedicated people while making a difference to the communities we live in? This could be the job for you.§Our Operations Advisers are part of 24/7 teams based at the Department of Corrections based in the Wellington Region. We assist frontline staff in the management of over 4000 electronically monitored offenders and defendants around NZ. Our tight-knit teams are busy, focused and committed to keeping the community safe. The environment is dynamic, fast paced, and energetic.§Any given shift in these teams will involve important responsibilities such as liaising with Police to coordinate a welfare check or the arrest of a high risk individual, assisting a Probation Officer in the management of their offender, or problem-solving over the phone with offenders or defendants who are facing difficult and stressful situations.§This is a demanding role - the phones can be exceptionally busy and no two days will be the same. People who are successful in this role will possess the following attributes:§§The ability to communicate and engage clearly with people from all different cultures and backgrounds§Integrity and professionalism§People skills and a sense of humour§Resilience to deal with shift work, challenging people and situations§Strong computer literacy§The ability to make sound decisions whilst adhering to process and established frameworks.§§Although a degree or experience in a relevant field would be beneficial, we value life experience, the ability to work the required shift patterns and a "can do attitude". This is a fantastic opportunity to kick-start your career in the Department of Corrections.§You will be using modern GPS technology and software. While training will be provided for these platforms, you must also be competent with Microsoft applications including Outlook, Word, and Excel.You can expect to be challenged, but also to leave each shift with a sense of satisfaction that comes from making an important contribution towards managing the people in our care and keeping our community safe.§Operations Advisers in our teams work a mixture of shifts 6am-4pm, 12-10pm, 8.30pm-6.30am, which will change on a rotational basis Monday-Sunday including public holidays. Please note that for all shift pattern options above, approximately four weeks of 9am-5pm Monday-Friday will be required for initial training when the role begins§Remuneration range: $57,398 - 67,527 (starting rate within the range may be negotiable based on relevant experience).§§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §§Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§§§§

Due to increasing customer numbers on both sides of the Tasman, we are looking to add a superstar to our current team to help deliver the best possible experience for our customers and partners.§ §Customers are at the heart of everything Hnry does and this role provides a great opportunity to really help make a difference for people. This role is about being a champion for customers, whilst getting first-hand experience of working in a fast-paced environment, and working hard as part of a highly motivated and results-driven team.§ §Reporting into the Customer Success Lead, this is not a traditional Call Centre role - there are no scripts, every customer is unique and needs to be treated as such. jobText: TXT/50674393.txt	§Customer Relations Representative (Fixed Term)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Relations Representative (Fixed Term)§§Advertiser: §Yellow Umbrella§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§There’s a successful, award winning, family owned company in Rotorua that thinks progressively, acts sustainably, and puts excellence at the forefront of their services, AND they happen to be looking for a like-minded individual to join their tight-knit team and take care of our inbound customers via the Customer Relations Representative role.§ §In this role you'll be asked to deliver friendly, professional and efficient Customer Services while also providing support to the Sales & Marketing team, assisting with Office and Administrative§tasks, Warehouse duties, and maintaining the§Showroom area.§ §It's all about playing your role in ensuring the Company delivers “outstanding” service to all its customers by satisfying and exceeding their expectations.§ §About the company:§ §Jasco’s story began some 40 years ago. Through dedication, innovation and responsiveness, the company has grown to become one of the largest independent wholesale distributors servicing the business to business sectors throughout New Zealand.§ §They’re built on strong traditional values, with emphasis on people and team culture, as well as a commitment to social and environmental responsibility. Their philosophy is to "Make a Beneficial Difference", so critical to your success will be your dedication and genuine intention to build strong customer relationships.§ §About the ideal candidate:§ §Jasco have a real growth mindset that spills over into their openness to taking on people with aptitude and attitude over  experience and expertise, however the ideal candidate will have the following:§ § §You'll have a great personality and you won't be afraid to use it!§ §You'll be personable yet professional .§ §You'll be confident, resilient and self-assured just incase we get some not-so-stoked customers.§ §Be drawn to serve others and have a genuine heart to get stuck in and help.§ §Be hungry, growing and driven to succeed - coz who knows this role might lead to some cool career opportunities!§ §This is a full-time fixed-term position to cover maternity leave, so while their may easily be a chance to join the team permanently, the role will initially be for 6 to 12 months.§ §We’d love to hear from you if you’re interested and believe you’re fit for the role.§ §While we will review the contents of your CV, we will read your cover letter with interest so feel free to entertain us with a summary of who you are and why you’re applying for this role!§ §Only those with the rights to work in New Zealand need apply.§ §Any queries please contact: §nicola@yellowumbrella.co.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§§§

§§§Based in Penrose, our client is a very successful Import and Distribution company. We need someone switched on, who can problem solve and react to a multitude of different situations and can focus on solving customer queries or issues, in the most effective way.§It is very important that customers receive the very best service and that their current and future needs are being looked after.§  §The Role:§ § §Answering inbound customer service and sales enquiries, and following through to resolution§ §Monitors the sales email inbox and action response§ §Preparing quotations, processing orders§ §Help problem solve and provide solutions to customer § §Setting up new clients, ensuring the data in our CRM is up to date.§ §Meeting customers’ requirements quickly and efficiently and ultimately add value to their business.§ §Fulfilling associated administration § §Working in with other departments, especially  thesales team§ §What you need to bring:§ § §Fantastic phone communication and relationship building skills§ §Previous Customer Service experience- 2 + years§ §The ability to work independently, flexibly, and with a high degree of initiative§ §Proactive working habits. § §Takes ownership of client relationships, giving great service and brilliant follow up.§ §Good systems skills, ERP exp, preferable SAP§ §Happily, adds value to the team§ §A long-term commitment to develop in your career§ §You will have great listening skills with an upbeat communication style that your customers enjoy and welcome your calls.§If you are a self-starter and think you have got what it takes to be successful in the above role, please apply Via Seek or to §lisa@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§.§  §Please note that only shortlisted applicants will be contacted, and this will happen within 3 days of your application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Māngai Hangarau Job in Northland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679984.txt	§Māngai Hangarau§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Māngai Hangarau§§Advertiser: §Vocus Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Northland§, §Rest of Northland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Māngai Hangarau §      §        §He mīharo a Slingshot hei wāhi mahi, ā, kei te hiahia mātou ki ētahi kaimahi mīharo mō tō mātou puni Te Reo Māori hou.§        §Ka kawe te puni nei i te ngākau whiwhita o Slingshot mō te ratonga kiritaki, waihoki, ka whakarawe āwhina ā-reo Māori ki ngā kiritaki o Slingshot - ahakoa mā te huarahi o te waea, te īmēra, te kōrerorero ā-tuihono.§        §E whakapono ana mātou he tuatahitanga tēnei mō tētahi rangatōpū o Aotearoa, ā, he hiahia nui tō mātou kia whai i ngā kaimahi kaiora kia hiki i tēnei kaupapa ki taumata ikeike.§        §Te Tūranga§        §He tūranga ukiuki ā-waea, ā-īmēra anō hoki tēnei e mahi ana kei raro i te maru o tō mātou Pū Whakapāpā. Ko te nuinga o te wā ka mahi koe ki tō ake kāinga, ā, ko ngā pātai ki te reo Māori (kāore e kore ko ētahi ki te reo Pākehā anō hoki) ka tukuna atu ki a koe.§        §Ko te āhuatanga o tētahi rā māori ki tēnei tūranga ko te tuku kōrero āwhina e hāngai ana ki ngā pātai hangarau ā-kāinga, te whakarongoā i ngā raru hangarau o ngā kiritaki, te whaiwhai atu i ngā raru kua tohua kētia, me te tautoko i ngā kiritaki kia whai rongoā. Ko te katoa o tēnā me te mātua aro anō hoki ki te whakatinanatanga o te whai hua ā-ipurangi a ngā kiritaki.§        §Ki te whakaaro koe he haepapa nui tēnā, kaua e māharahara, kua whakatauhia e mātou te 2.5 wiki te roa o tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū ā-Huitopa kia whakaakongia ngā āhuatanga katoa kia rite pai koe ki te kōkiri i ngā haepapa mahi - waihoki ka tuku atu ki a koe te katoa o ngā taputapu rorohiko kia whakatutuki pai koe i ngā mahi, ā, ka riro hoki i a koe tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tō hononga ipurangi.§        §Ka mahi tahi koe me tētahi ranga papai rawa me tā rātou kaha āwhina, kaha tautoko anō hoki mai i te timatanga. Ko tō mātou hiahia i a koe ko te paku mōhiotanga ki ngā āhuatanga hangarau, kia kounga tō reo Māori ā-waha, ā-tuhi anō hoki, kia tū koe hei tangata ngākau āhwina, ka mutu, kei a koe te āheinga kia ohia te hanga o te whakaaro!§        §Ko te katoa o tēnā mai i te āhurutanga o tō ake kāinga.§        §Ngā pūkenga me ngā āheinga me mātua kite§        §          §Me matatau i te reo Māori ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§          §Me kounga te reo Pākehā ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§          §Kia pai te taumata pūkenga rorohiko me te tere o te patopato§          §Kua 1-2 tau te roa o tō whai wheako ki tētahi Pū Whakapāpā, ki tētahi tūranga ratonga kiritaki rānei e āhua rite ana ki tēnei§          §E ngākau whakapuke ana ki te hangarau§          §Me mātua whakapuāwai ki roto i tētahi taiao terenga-kakama§          §E ngākau whiwhita ana kia whai rongoā, kia āwhina tāngata anō hoki§        §        §Ngā paearu/ngā māraurautanga kia mahi ki tō ake kāinga§        §          §Me mātua mārōrō te hononga ipurangi me te āheinga kia hono mā te itarangi§          §He wāhi mahi ngū kia tutuki pai ngā whiwhinga waea§          §Tētahi waea pūkoro§        §        §Ngā Hua§        §          §Ka āhei te whiwhi i ngā āpititanga utu ā-tau tae atu ki te $6000§          §Ka riro i tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Slingshot, ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Orcon rānei§          §Tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū e 2.5 wiki te roa, ā, ka utua hoki e koe§          §Kua wātea e koe te mahi ki tō ake kāinga§          §Ka riro i te $300 hei moni āwhina mō te whare whakapakari tinana§          §Ka riro i te ōrautanga āwhina, arā te 50% mai i te utu o tētahi inihua hauora mō ngā kaimahi ukiuki§        §        §He kōrero whakamārama mō Slingshot (me tōna rāngai matua a Vocus)§        §Ka manaakitia o mātou nuinga, ka pōwhiritia te ahurea kanorau, ā, ka whakanuia ngā hunga ka eke ki taumata ikeike. I te pō, i te ao e kimi ana mātou i ngā hunga rikarika, i ngā hunga koi, otirā i ngā hunga ngākau hihiko.§        §Kua waihangatia e mātou tētahi taiao ā-ranga pai me tētahi ahurea whaiwhai hua, ā, ahakoa kei te kāinga te nuinga o a mātou kaimahi e mahi ana, ka hiki tonu mātou i tētahi taiao hihiko mā te whakatū i ngā huihuinga ā-ranga, mā te whakahaere i tētahi karapu whakangahau, ā, mā te whakahaere i ngā momo whakapoapoatanga, i ngā momo whakataetae ā-marama anō hoki. Mehemea e āhua rite ana koe ki a mātou, arā, he tangata whakaaro kaikaha, he kaha koe ki te kimi huarahi kia whakapai ake i tētahi āhuatanga, he ngākaunui tōu kia mahitahi me te hunga tangata, ā, e hiahia ana koe ki te whakawhanake i a koe anō, kāti, ka mātua tau tō noho ki waenganui i a mātou.§        §I a koe ngā pūkenga me te ngākau uruhi kia piri mai ki te ranga? Pāwhiria te 'apply', ā, tīmatatia tō para i te ara o Vocus.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§He mīharo a Slingshot hei wāhi mahi, ā, kei te hiahia mātou ki ētahi kaimahi mīharo mō tō mātou puni Te Reo Māori hou.§Ka kawe te puni nei i te ngākau whiwhita o Slingshot mō te ratonga kiritaki, waihoki, ka whakarawe āwhina ā-reo Māori ki ngā kiritaki o Slingshot - ahakoa mā te huarahi o te waea, te īmēra, te kōrerorero ā-tuihono.§E whakapono ana mātou he tuatahitanga tēnei mō tētahi rangatōpū o Aotearoa, ā, he hiahia nui tō mātou kia whai i ngā kaimahi kaiora kia hiki i tēnei kaupapa ki taumata ikeike.§Te Tūranga§He tūranga ukiuki ā-waea, ā-īmēra anō hoki tēnei e mahi ana kei raro i te maru o tō mātou Pū Whakapāpā. Ko te nuinga o te wā ka mahi koe ki tō ake kāinga, ā, ko ngā pātai ki te reo Māori (kāore e kore ko ētahi ki te reo Pākehā anō hoki) ka tukuna atu ki a koe.§Ko te āhuatanga o tētahi rā māori ki tēnei tūranga ko te tuku kōrero āwhina e hāngai ana ki ngā pātai hangarau ā-kāinga, te whakarongoā i ngā raru hangarau o ngā kiritaki, te whaiwhai atu i ngā raru kua tohua kētia, me te tautoko i ngā kiritaki kia whai rongoā. Ko te katoa o tēnā me te mātua aro anō hoki ki te whakatinanatanga o te whai hua ā-ipurangi a ngā kiritaki.§Ki te whakaaro koe he haepapa nui tēnā, kaua e māharahara, kua whakatauhia e mātou te 2.5 wiki te roa o tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū ā-Huitopa kia whakaakongia ngā āhuatanga katoa kia rite pai koe ki te kōkiri i ngā haepapa mahi - waihoki ka tuku atu ki a koe te katoa o ngā taputapu rorohiko kia whakatutuki pai koe i ngā mahi, ā, ka riro hoki i a koe tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tō hononga ipurangi.§Ka mahi tahi koe me tētahi ranga papai rawa me tā rātou kaha āwhina, kaha tautoko anō hoki mai i te timatanga. Ko tō mātou hiahia i a koe ko te paku mōhiotanga ki ngā āhuatanga hangarau, kia kounga tō reo Māori ā-waha, ā-tuhi anō hoki, kia tū koe hei tangata ngākau āhwina, ka mutu, kei a koe te āheinga kia ohia te hanga o te whakaaro!§Ko te katoa o tēnā mai i te āhurutanga o tō ake kāinga.§Ngā pūkenga me ngā āheinga me mātua kite§Me matatau i te reo Māori ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§Me kounga te reo Pākehā ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki§Kia pai te taumata pūkenga rorohiko me te tere o te patopato§Kua 1-2 tau te roa o tō whai wheako ki tētahi Pū Whakapāpā, ki tētahi tūranga ratonga kiritaki rānei e āhua rite ana ki tēnei§E ngākau whakapuke ana ki te hangarau§Me mātua whakapuāwai ki roto i tētahi taiao terenga-kakama§E ngākau whiwhita ana kia whai rongoā, kia āwhina tāngata anō hoki§Ngā paearu/ngā māraurautanga kia mahi ki tō ake kāinga§Me mātua mārōrō te hononga ipurangi me te āheinga kia hono mā te itarangi§He wāhi mahi ngū kia tutuki pai ngā whiwhinga waea§Tētahi waea pūkoro§Ngā Hua§Ka āhei te whiwhi i ngā āpititanga utu ā-tau tae atu ki te $6000§Ka riro i tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Slingshot, ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Orcon rānei§Tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū e 2.5 wiki te roa, ā, ka utua hoki e koe§Kua wātea e koe te mahi ki tō ake kāinga§Ka riro i te $300 hei moni āwhina mō te whare whakapakari tinana§Ka riro i te ōrautanga āwhina, arā te 50% mai i te utu o tētahi inihua hauora mō ngā kaimahi ukiuki§He kōrero whakamārama mō Slingshot (me tōna rāngai matua a Vocus)§Ka manaakitia o mātou nuinga, ka pōwhiritia te ahurea kanorau, ā, ka whakanuia ngā hunga ka eke ki taumata ikeike. I te pō, i te ao e kimi ana mātou i ngā hunga rikarika, i ngā hunga koi, otirā i ngā hunga ngākau hihiko.§        §Kua waihangatia e mātou tētahi taiao ā-ranga pai me tētahi ahurea whaiwhai hua, ā, ahakoa kei te kāinga te nuinga o a mātou kaimahi e mahi ana, ka hiki tonu mātou i tētahi taiao hihiko mā te whakatū i ngā huihuinga ā-ranga, mā te whakahaere i tētahi karapu whakangahau, ā, mā te whakahaere i ngā momo whakapoapoatanga, i ngā momo whakataetae ā-marama anō hoki. As a Customer Care and Inbound Sales Representative, you will play an integral role in our business by providing impeccable customer care through all stages of customer interaction. Additionally, you will use your sales skills to sniff out opportunities to upsell or recommend products to clients when they ring in using your active questioning and listening capabilities.§  § §You will be responsible for:§ § §Quickly and accurately responding to customer requirements, whether it is via the phone, email or our website§ §Taking advantage of leads and opportunities for New Business§ §Managing a high volume of customer queries and processing of orders§ §Ensuring customers are kept in the loop and resolving any issues in a timely manner§ §Working closely with the wider divisions to ensure the process runs as smoothly as possible§ § Working 8am – 5pm, this Rosedale based role will reward those with the mindset of a problem solver, and the drive of a Salesperson.§ If your professional manner and capability shine through on the phone and you’ve always wanted to get some experience in Sales without having to cold call, this could be the role for you!§  § §Additionally, if you:§ § §Are passionate about providing impeccable service and going the extra mile§ §Have proven experience in a Customer Care role or similar§ §Exhibit the drive and energy to continuously learn, grow, and improve§ §Enjoy working at pace and producing results, even when under pressure§ §Pride yourself on your attention to detail and ability to multitask  § §Have exposure to diary and/or CRM management (ideally Salesforce)§ § Then we want to hear from you! jobTitle: Customer Case Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50680549.txt	§Customer Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Company description:§We want to inspire people to capture the opportunities of a digital future and connect for a better future. That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§Are you looking to work with an organisation that values diversity and inclusion, sustainability, wellbeing and connections to communities across Aotearoa?   §We value the diversity of thought, perspective, and backgrounds that our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027. Our world-leading wellbeing program supports your holistic wellness and connects you with the tools, skills and people that enable you to be at your best on a daily basis. § §Are you a customer service star? This is an opportunity for you to join our customer expert team – the X Squad – and build a career by defining what customer experience should be! § § § §In your new role as a §Customer Case Manager§ you will take ownership of customer service cases and manage the delivery of our customer’s requirements. You will handle a variety of cases through the call queue and through call-backs which will involve service or technical case management as well as new sale or service orders. § § § §You will actively contribute to delivering awesome customer experiences and improved processes by identifying trends and insights and championing them with the wider Vodafone team for the benefit of all customers.  § § § §What will I be doing? § § §Own the customer relationship and communications through to resolution § §Ensure all cases are resolved in a timely manner through effective jeopardy management § §Demonstrate thought leadership by actively identifying changes which can continuously improve the service experience and processes for all our Vodafone customers § § § § §What will I bring? § § §Passion for Customer Experience with a proven ability to determine priorities to exceed the customer requirements and expectations § §Customer service experience, ideally with experience in issue resolution or case management § §Flexible & open attitude, helping the customer is your highest priority § §Technical understanding of telecommunications products and services is useful, but not a requirement § §Motivation to stay current with technology § §Excellent interpersonal skills & eagerness to learn § §The ability to work to deadlines and multitask while operating with multiple systems, procedures, and customers § § §  §This role works on a rotating Monday to Sunday roster (including public holidays) of which the current hours are between 8am – 9pm. These rosters are subject to change depending on business requirements. The start date for this new team will be Monday 16 November. §  §Joining the Vodafone whānau will stretch you, challenge you and provide opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. You’ll engage in unique workplace experiences, be exposed to exciting and innovative technology, and gain opportunities for learning beyond Aotearoa.   §  §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. We work together for the benefit of all. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50681008.txt	§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Tauranga§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Bay Audiology Client Care Coordinator - Tauranga§§Advertiser: §Amplifon New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Who are we?§ §At Bay Audiology, the heart of our mission is to help people rediscover the joy of hearing.  With over 120 clinics located throughout New Zealand we have grown to become the country's largest hearing care provider.  We offer a range of services, from diagnosing hearing difficulties, to fitting, servicing and maintaining hearing aids, and offering ongoing support and care for our customers.   We aim to provide an excellent experience, and that’s where you come in...§ §About the role:§ §As our Client Care Coordinator, you will be the smiling face at the front desk of our Bureta Park clinic, making a real difference in the lives of those with hearing loss.  This is a varied role working closely with our clinicians, and no two days will be the same. You will be responsible for the scheduling of appointments, onsite hearing screening, consumable sales, and  basic hearing aid repairs, all the while providing an exceptional customer experience!  § §This is a full time, fixed term contract starting in November until 21st June 2021. §The hours for this role are Monday to Friday 8.30am - 5.00pm§ §What we are looking for:§ § §Previous experience in a customer focused role§ §Genuine passion for providing excellent customer service§ §Strong attention to detail§ §Sound computer skills as we are a paperless clinic§ §Well-developed problem solving skills§ §A positive, friendly personality§ §What we offer:§ §If you are looking for a meaningful, challenging career at the forefront of innovative hearing care services, a competitive salary, staff benefits and a supportive leadership team - explore your future with us!  Full training is provided.§ §Apply online with your CV and covering letter today§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Please indicate if you consent to the company holding your application information on file at the conclusion of this process in relation to any future employment opportunities within the Amplifon Group.§§§

jobTitle: Customer Services Representative Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681399.txt	§Customer Services Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Representative§§Advertiser: §Environmental Protection Authority (EPA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Make history with us§ §As New Zealand’s environmental regulator, the work we do today helps shape the future of Aotearoa.§ §Our Finance and Systems Group is responsible for the development, management and implementations of programmes and innovations to increase the EPA’s effectiveness and performance.§ §We are increasing our current capability by appointing an in house customer services representative (CSR) to be the first point of call for our customers.§ §The opportunity § §We are seeking an experienced customer service representative who’s looking for a role to get stuck in and add value from day one. This role will offer plenty of chances to help us design and improve our systems and processes to make sure we’re delivering the best service to our customers.§ §As one of our brand new CSR’s you’ll get the chance to help us shape what our contact centre will look like going forward. We’d also love you to bring your enthusiasm for continuous improvement – we’ll be looking to you to help us understand why our customers are calling and how we can improve our online tools.§ §The role will include answering calls and emails from our customers on a range of topics we regulate, including Hazardous Substances and the Emissions Trading Scheme. To keep you busy you’ll also provide our Finance and Systems team with administrative support during any quiet periods on the phone.§ §About you§ §We don't expect you to know everything from day one, but we’d love our successful candidate to have:§ § §Experience as a frontline customer service representative§ §Experience in general office and administration§ §Is exceptionally well organised§ §Has  a strong ability to build and maintain effective working relationships§ §Public sector experience§ §A proactive approach with great initiatives§ §All the usual skills it takes to succeed (a good work ethic, attention to detail, a great communicator, familiar with the Microsoft Office applications)§ §Science qualification (advantageous but not essential)§ §This position may also suit you if you are looking to get your foot in the door of an organisation with scientific experts and professionals with this same shared vision; or you may be seasoned in offering exceptional customer service; either way we want to hear from you.§ §What we can offer you§ §This is a permanent full-time position based in our central city offices on Lambton Quay. The role provides plenty of variety, interesting and challenging opportunities, working with colleagues focused on making a difference.§ §Some of the benefits of working with us include on-site weekly Māori language lessons and regular workshops to develop staff understanding and appreciation of Te Ao Māori; talks on a variety of topics from fascinating external speakers; and a range of clubs and groups, from gardening to adventure running, that cater to the diverse interests of our staff.§ §We also offer our staff extra leave on top of the standard legislative requirements.§ §How to apply § §For a copy of the job description please click here. Or contact §julia.holman@epa.govt.nz§ §Check out the careers section of our website for more information at www.epa.govt.nz§ §Applications close 5pm 19 October 2020§§§§

With multiple stations throughout New Zealand, our growth and success is driven by outstanding people who are motivated to do their best and have a passion for putting the customer at the heart of everything they do.  We thrive on a culture which is underpinned by our core values of Open Communication, Working Together, Feeling Valued and Customer Centric. We are always looking for talented people who are excited to join our team and help contribute to the continuing growth and success of Europcar. §        §We are currently seeking a dedicated and proactive part-time team member (8 hours per week) for our Napier location. §        §Reporting to the Field Manager this role plays a critical part in ensuring excellent sales and customer service for our clients whilst being dedicated to the growing success of the Station.§        §Some of the key responsibilities include:§        §          §Opening and closing car rental contracts§          §Making reservations and checking vehicles in and out as based on customer needs§          §Processing of Rental Agreements, accident and damage reports§          §Providing outstanding customer service to our valued customers§          §Cleaning / ferrying vehicles§          §Checking vehicles for damage and roadworthiness, using hand held device§          §Achieving targets in sales and Net Promoter Score§        §        §You will need to be flexible and available to work on a rotating shift roster. §        §To be considered, you should posses:§        §          §Full New Zealand work rights§          §Ability to work around a 7 day rotating shift roster§          §Open, manual licence§          §Experience working in a customer service/ Sales/ Retail environment§        §        §In return, the successful candidate will receive:§        §          §Multiple staff discounts (including Accor hotel staff discounts after 12+ months)§          §Employment with a company who invests in training their employees§          §Supportive team environment§        §        §Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§        §§      §      §      §    §  §§§About Us§ §Europcar is a world leader in vehicle rental and part of the global Europcar Mobility Group. With multiple stations throughout New Zealand, our growth and success is driven by outstanding people who are motivated to do their best and have a passion for putting the customer at the heart of everything they do.  We thrive on a culture which is underpinned by our core values of Open Communication, Working Together, Feeling Valued and Customer Centric. We are always looking for talented people who are excited to join our team and help contribute to the continuing growth and success of Europcar. § §We are currently seeking a dedicated and proactive part-time team member (8 hours per week) for our Napier location. § §Reporting to the Field Manager this role plays a critical part in ensuring excellent sales and customer service for our clients whilst being dedicated to the growing success of the Station.§ §Some of the key responsibilities include:§ § §Opening and closing car rental contracts§ §Making reservations and checking vehicles in and out as based on customer needs§ §Processing of Rental Agreements, accident and damage reports§ §Providing outstanding customer service to our valued customers§ §Cleaning / ferrying vehicles§ §Checking vehicles for damage and roadworthiness, using hand held device§ §Achieving targets in sales and Net Promoter Score§ §You will need to be flexible and available to work on a rotating shift roster. § §To be considered, you should posses:§ § §Full New Zealand work rights§ §Ability to work around a 7 day rotating shift roster§ §Open, manual licence§ §Experience working in a customer service/ Sales/ Retail environment§ §In return, the successful candidate will receive:§ § §Multiple staff discounts (including Accor hotel staff discounts after 12+ months)§ §Employment with a company who invests in training their employees§ §Supportive team environment§ §Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Are you available to work on a rotating roster?§Do you have experience working towards targets and KPIs?§Are you licenced to drive a manual vehicle?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50681733.txt	§Points Person§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Points Person§§Advertiser: §EnviroWaste Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Good old kiwi ingenuity, a great team culture and a relentless commitment to preserve New Zealand’s natural beauty and resources, EnviroNZ ensure we produce the best possible outcomes for both our customers and the environment.§2020 has seen our Hamilton team increase dramatically in size! Our Frankton based Transfer station are looking for a customer focussed §Points Person/Traffic Controller§ to join the team on a full time & permanent basis. The role is 40+ hours per week and includes weekends§What you’ll be doing §Working as part of a successful & close-knit team, you will be responsible for  §Directing all traffic on-site to ease traffic flow §Being mindful of hazards, and ensuring all employees & visitors are safe §Assisting customers on where to off load safely §General site maintenance which includes tidying up site & common areas §Growing your own career within a thriving organisation §Above all, our aim is to create a safe site for all visitors & customers, and continuing to provide great customer service§You will have:§2+ years face-to-face customer service experience §Previous traffic control experience is preferred, however full training will be provided §A can-do attitude and enjoy working outside §Have working knowledge and understanding of Health & Safety, and the importance of §Be Supportive and Respectful§If you wish to apply for this position please click apply now and complete the online application form and submit an updated copy of your CV.  We look forward to receiving your application!§Safety and wellbeing are paramount to us, so our recruitment process involves a Ministry of Justice criminal background check, and a pre-employment medical including drug test. You must also be eligible to work in NZ (either as a New Zealand Citizen or Resident or have a valid working visa) to apply for this role§§§§

jobTitle: Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50681872.txt	§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Social Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §Customer Service Representatives, Contact Centre Services, Ellerslie §    §      §        §Job Ref: 35036§        §Late November / Early December 2020 start §        §          §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§          §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture §        §        §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §        §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Ellerslie.    §        §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day. We will support you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§        §What we offer§        §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy an indepth training approach and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§        §Your hours of work:§        §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day. You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§        §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§        §Our general operating hours are:§        §          §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 6.15pm, and§          §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§        §        §As business demand grows, these hours of operation could change and would be discussed well in advance.§        §Position Description§        §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §        §About you§        § §        §          §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§          §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§          §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§          §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§          §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§          §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§        §        §Joining us§        §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§        §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §The Ministry of Social Development is one of New Zealand's largest government agencies. Our work to achieve better social outcomes affects almost every New Zealander, now or in the future.§        §https://jobs.msd.govt.nz/§      §    §    §  §§§Job Ref: 35036§  §Late November / Early December 2020 start § § §Complex, varied work where you get to work on the solution with the client§ §Vibrant and proudly diverse one-team culture § §MSD is an essential service and continues to provide services to support New Zealanders. We are calling for motivated and adaptable people who can hit the ground running and help deliver end to end services for our clients. §  §Now, more than ever, you can make a meaningful difference to the lives of New Zealander’s with our modern and busy contact centre team in Ellerslie.    §  §As a CSR in our Contact Centre you help many clients each day. We will support you to confidently work with clients, primarily through inbound calls and processing applications. You will have the authority to make a real difference in the lives of New Zealanders. You will be responsible for sourcing information and applying it to policy and legislation to make the call about assistance.§  §What we offer§  §We provide a positive and progressive work environment, where we all support each other to achieve excellent outcomes for our clients. You will enjoy an indepth training approach and opportunities to develop your career and an orientation / training plan backed by loads of support.  Our team is renowned for its high quality of training - this often means over time our CSRs are in high demand for progression to other roles in the Ministry.§  §Your hours of work:§  §Your standard hours of work will be 37.55 hours per week, which is seven hours and 35 minutes per day. You will need to be available for 5 days, with 1 of those shifts being Saturday as per the contact centre rotational roster.§  §We work on a no surprises basis and will ensure that you will know your scheduled shifts well in advance.§  §Our general operating hours are:§ § §Mondays and Fridays, between 6.30am to 6.15pm, and§ §Saturdays between 8.00am and 2.00pm.§ §As business demand grows, these hours of operation could change and would be discussed well in advance.§  §Position Description§  §http://www.msd.govt.nz/hr/documents/position-descriptions/service-delivery/contact-centre-services/customer-service-representative-dec-2019.docx§ §  §About you§  § § § §You enjoy quality conversations and can demonstrate a history of providing clients a positive experience on the phone.§ §You work efficiently, accurately and can make good decisions.§ §Quick to navigate your way around multiple IT systems you also have an eagerness to learn and desire for self-improvement.§ §You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where frequent change is normal.§ §Salary starts from $46,925.00 per annum.§ §Candidates must hold NZ Citizenship or a Permanent Resident visa at time of application.§ §Joining us§  §Joining MSD means being part of a whānau that celebrates the diversity each individual represents. We show manaaki, we care about the wellbeing and success of people and want everyone to thrive, and be who they are in a supportive and inclusive working environment. We work together to make a difference for communities while doing the right thing with integrity. We are a Treaty partner committed to strengthening relationships with§ §Māori,§ §Hapū§,§ Iwi and communities to realise their own potential and aspirations.§  §If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to tell us when you apply so we can assist you through the recruitment process.§§§§

You'll also ensure the customer understands what the next step is in the process for them.§        §You'll appreciate that we need to be here for our customers whenever they need us, so our Contact Centre is open 7 days a week (Monday to Friday, 8am - 8pm & Saturday, Sunday 9am - 6pm).
