jobTitle: Personal Insurance Consultant Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50687130.txt	§Personal Insurance Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Personal Insurance Consultant§§Advertiser: §IAG NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Personal Insurance Consultant §      §        §Our Contact Centres are an awesome place to be - we have a diverse and inclusive culture that supports a whole of life approach that we're proud of. We're currently looking for more talented people to join us on our journey to help make our world a safer place.§        §We're in the business of protecting the things that are important to our customers. You'll fit in here if you always have customers at the forefront of your mind, are able to ask the right questions to identify your customer needs and then develop the right solutions for them.§        §What you'll do:§        §As one of our Personal Insurance Consultants, you'll have proactive conversations to ensure everyone you speak to will be better insured and/or better-educated about insurance by the time they hang up the phone with you. You'll ask the right questions to understand more about each customer's immediate and future needs, and then discuss the features and benefits of the right solutions to protect their vehicle, house, contents and other assets. We want to set our customers up for a positive experience when they need to make a claim, so it's important to ensure they understand their cover completely and know exactly what to expect when they suffer a loss.§        §We need to be here for our customers whenever they need us, so our centre is open 7 days a week (Monday to Friday 8am - 8pm & Saturday to Sunday 9am - 6pm). Our shifts rotate to cover these days and hours, so you'll work 75 hours per fortnight (10 x 7.5-hour shifts). This may include one weekend day every fortnight.§        §What we're looking for:§        §We're seeking people who can build a natural rapport with customers over the phone, and who really want to help to make their world a safer place. You'll bring strong customer service experience but be ready for a new challenge. You'll be adept at uncovering customer needs using your inbound or outbound calling experience and finding the right solutions for them. A positive attitude goes a long way, as well as wanting to build genuine connections with your customers and colleagues. You'll really be immersed in the world of insurance and will need to absorb a lot of technical information, but we will set you up for success with a robust training plan and ongoing support and development.§        §Who are we:§        §IAG is NZ's largest general insurer and operates under the State, AMI, NZI, and Lumley brands, as well as underwriting insurance for some of NZ's leading banks. At IAG, we believe that everyone has a unique point of view to share, shaped by their life experiences, cultures & passions.§        §What we can offer you:§        §          §A positive working environment with loads of support§          §Internal development opportunities§          §Discretionary annual performance bonus and annual salary reviews§          §50% discount on IAG insurance (with any of IAG's brands)§          §Annual $500 Health & Wellness benefit after being with the company for more than 12 months§          §Opportunity to join the IAG employee share plan, along with a company contribution§          §Corporate discounts at various retailers e.g. Noel Leeming, OPSM, Bunnings, BNZ and more!§        §        §You will need the ability to work from home with Broadband installed. You'll be supported with an intensive training programme to get you across all elements of our products and systems. jobText: TXT/50687313.txt	§Customer Case Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Case Manager§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Company description:§We want to inspire people to capture the opportunities of a digital future and connect for a better future. That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§Are you looking to work with an organisation that values diversity and inclusion, sustainability, wellbeing and connections to communities across Aotearoa?   §We value the diversity of thought, perspective, and backgrounds that our people bring to work with them every day. We support our communities through the Vodafone New Zealand Foundation with an ambitious goal to halve the number of disadvantaged young people in Aotearoa by 2027. Our world-leading wellbeing program supports your holistic wellness and connects you with the tools, skills and people that enable you to be at your best on a daily basis. § §Are you a customer service star? This is an opportunity for you to join our customer expert team – the X Squad  – and build a career by defining what customer experience should be! § § § §In this Christchurch-based role as a §Customer Case Manager§ you will take ownership of customer service cases and manage the delivery of our customer’s requirements. You will handle a variety of cases through the call queue and through call-backs which will involve service or technical case management as well as new sale or service orders. § § § §You will actively contribute to delivering awesome customer experiences and improved processes by identifying trends and insights and championing them with the wider Vodafone team for the benefit of all customers.  § § § §What will I be doing? § § §Own the customer relationship and communications through to resolution § §Ensure all cases are resolved in a timely manner through effective jeopardy management § §Demonstrate thought leadership by actively identifying changes which can continuously improve the service experience and processes for all our Vodafone customers § § § § §What will I bring? § § §Passion for Customer Experience with a proven ability to determine priorities to exceed the customer requirements and expectations § §Customer service experience, ideally with experience in issue resolution or case management § §Flexible & open attitude, helping the customer is your highest priority § §Technical understanding of telecommunications products and services is useful, but not a requirement § §Motivation to stay current with technology § §Excellent interpersonal skills & eagerness to learn § §The ability to work to deadlines and multitask while operating with multiple systems, procedures, and customers § § §  §This role works on a rotating Monday to Sunday roster (including public holidays) of which the current hours are between 8am – 9pm. These rosters are subject to change depending on business requirements. The start date for this new team will be Monday 16 November. §  §Joining the Vodafone whānau will stretch you, challenge you and provide opportunities you’ve been seeking to expand your career. You’ll engage in unique workplace experiences, be exposed to exciting and innovative technology, and gain opportunities for learning beyond Aotearoa.   §  §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. We work together for the benefit of all. §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

We are underway with an exciting journey to design, deliver and introduce new ships and terminals (the iReX Programme). The investment in new assets also provides the opportunity to undertake a transformational change in our operations and customer centric culture. The InterIslander team is already renowned for our outstanding customer service. We are looking for experienced people to help lead Interislander to the next level to set a new world class standard in short run ferry services. §          §Reporting to the Executive General Manager, the Customer Experience Transformation Manager will champion and lead the InterIslander teams on their journey towards customer centricity, embedding a culture of service across all areas of the business as we embark on a major transformational shift in our culture and operations. This role will understand the strategic customer vision for the InterIslander business and translate this into operating and technical plans around culture, resources, assets, people and services taking the opportunity to optimise and streamline current processes ready for future requirements. The operating and technical plans will include the introduction of new assets, facility improvements, technology enhancements and future operational processes - keeping the customer at the centre of everything we do.§          §This role will bring innovative ideas to the InterIslander Leadership team to support the strategic vision, including:§          §            §recommendation of service offering§            §enhance the customer experience§            §increase revenue opportunities§            §drive a customer centric culture within the entire team§          §          §This role will be of real interest to a strong leader who is looking to leverage their extensive experience in transitioning multi-faceted operational teams into customer centric environments. This is an opportunity to lead and influence across an iconic New Zealand business undergoing major transformation change. You will have extensive expertise in translating strategic vision into tangible operating plans that enhance the customer experience and lift performance and efficiencies. You will be an engaging and collaborative leader who has proven ability drive culture changes within an organisation, particularly with front line operational teams and be a strong relationship builder to connect and influence key stakeholders internally as well as external stakeholder including our union partners.§          §Due to the nature of our operation it will be important that the successful individual will have flexibility around working hours based on our ships schedule and requirement to spend time onboard our ships.§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§InterIslander is an iconic New Zealand business that binds our two main islands together. This role will understand the strategic customer vision for the InterIslander business and translate this into operating and technical plans around culture, resources, assets, people and services taking the opportunity to optimise and streamline current processes ready for future requirements. The operating and technical plans will include the introduction of new assets, facility improvements, technology enhancements and future operational processes - keeping the customer at the centre of everything we do.§This role will bring innovative ideas to the InterIslander Leadership team to support the strategic vision, including:§recommendation of service offering§enhance the customer experience§increase revenue opportunities§drive a customer centric culture within the entire team§This role will be of real interest to a strong leader who is looking to leverage their extensive experience in transitioning multi-faceted operational teams into customer centric environments. We offer a 24/7 alarm monitoring service for our wide range of customers throughout New Zealand with offices in Levin, Tauranga, and Lower Hutt.  SECURELY® embraces cutting-edge international technology to deliver alarm solutions over and above what is expected and with an enviable product range, we’re experiencing fantastic growth.  The future looks bright.§ §This is a unique role which requires someone who loves all things technical and technology, has an inquisitive mind, loves variety and is exceptionally passionate about providing great outcomes to our customers.§ §The role has a mixed and varied list of responsibilities, that includes:§ § § Providing up to date and timely support to any customer enquiry§ §Supporting our Technical Specialist with coordinating medical cases (triaging of the diagnosis of issues, leading to repair or replacement of medical alarms) and when required providing support for our security-based customers§ §Refurbishing, reprogramming, and coordinating the servicing of medical alarms§ §Managing incoming stock, ensuring it is entered into the CRM for accurate inventory control§ §Recording the movement of stock§ §Dispatching and couriering of new alarms and equipment to customers, 3rd party suppliers and partners§ §About you:§ §You have a lovely, approachable personality where customers feel listened to, and looked after.  You are timely with your communication and keeping people updated whenever required. As this is a varied role, your attention to detail must be task focused, to ensure each task is always carried out with 100% accuracy.§ §You are supportive, focused on the minor details to ensure jobs are managed in a timely manner and meet service level agreements, and enjoy working in a busy and fast-paced role.  Your passion for technology will show through your inquisitive mind on the job, learning about and refurbishing and repairing our alarms, under the guidance of our Technical Specialist. § §You are computer savvy, love working with systems and seeing the outcome of the work you perform.  You do not mind working under pressure, and are deadline driven and able to multi-task.§ §You will have 2+ years of experience in a customer service role, perhaps from a telecommunication, POS refurbishment or similar technology-based product where repairs and service are part of the business’s operation!§ §On offer:§ §Is a competitive market salary, an enviable company benefits and wellbeing program, and the chance to learn and develop a unique set of skills, stamping your mark on this role and our business.§ §If this sounds like you, and our values resonate with you as a person, please, do not delay, apply today!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50702170.txt	§Customer Relations Agent - Auckland x 2§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Relations Agent - Auckland x 2§§Advertiser: §Ezi Car Rental a division of NZ Leisure Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Why join us? §  §Established in 1998, we are one of New Zealand’s largest 100% Kiwi owned and operated rental car operators, with over 25 years’ experience in the New Zealand rental car industry. We operate nationwide at six branch locations. §  §The Ezi Commitment §  §Ezi Vision:§ We endeavor to offer the very best car rental proposition. It is simple really, as our aim is to be the very best car rental company in New Zealand. We hope to always deliver: the very best cars; undeniable value and service that we are truly proud of. §  §Ezi Values:§ Welcoming, Genuine, Dynamic, Uncomplicated, Efficient. At Ezi we live our values to help create a more enjoyable journey for our customers, wherever it may take them. §  §To find out more about us, visit  §www.ezicarrental.co.nz.§  §  §The role: §  §We are looking for two Customer Relations Agents for our Auckland Branches to provide outstanding customer service to our customers, so they have great, hassle free and enjoyable travels across our beautiful country. These are full-time positions for 40 hours per week working Monday to Sunday on a rotating roster including weekends and public holidays. §  §Customer Relations Agent (CRA) play a key role in the company. As the first and last point of contact with our customers, a Customer Relations Agents are always required to maintain professionalism and display outstanding communication and customer service skills.  §  §CRA’s are responsible for processing rental transactions, ensuring a smooth and efficient counter process for our customers and will contribute significantly to branch incremental sales performance. As the face of the company, by focusing on the wants and needs of the customer you will have opportunity to positively influence customer satisfaction and retention critical in today's Domestic Tourism market due to covid - 19 restrictions. §  §In addition to the customer service and sales part of the role, there shall be additional responsibilities of administrative tasks like completing checklists and checking and completing reports.§  §Key skills and role requirements: § § § §Full Driver’s license §  § § §Excellent verbal and written communication skills §  § § §High level of computer literacy §  § § §Past experience of counter sales or confident selling our value-add products to benefit our customers §  § § §Experience working within car rental industry is preferable not essential §  § § §Past experience of using Car+ software or adapting well to new software technological systems §  § § §Ability to drive manual and automatic vehicles and all types of vehicles from small cars to cargo vans §  § § §Punctual and hardworking §  § § §Multitasker, attention to detail and team player §  § §Why work for us?§ §  §We are 100% Kiwi owned and operated business. In addition to a great team environment, on-going training, we offer a competitive hourly wage. We have a real focus on our people and believe that it's OUR PEOPLE that will drive us to the next level of success.  §  §If you are interested in the role, please apply via the link below. §  §YOU MUST HAVE THE LEGAL RIGHT TO WORK IN NEW ZEALAND.  §  §Please Note: Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you available to work public holidays?§§§

jobText: TXT/50702580.txt	§Inbound Sales Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Inbound Sales Consultant§§Advertiser: §GRAVITY INTERNET LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Inbound§§§§§§Gravity Internet is New Zealand’s only dedicated satellite internet provider. We are a proudly owned and operated Kiwi business and have been hard at work for the last 5 years connecting rural properties, families, farms and businesses to the fastest broadband they have EVER seen! Since launching our new product range at the start of 2020 we have seen significant growth which means we are now looking for passionate and driven individuals to join with us to take us to the next level!§We are looking for a driven sales professional with a passion for customer service to join our friendly team based in Auckland. The primary responsibility of this role is to grow and develop our customer base, whilst providing a key support role to our Commercial Team. The role requires a high level of customer interaction – primarily telesales focused.§Key responsibilities for this role include:§ §Dealing with inbound sales enquiries via phone and email§Managing the sales process through the CRM and making sure it’s always up to date§Managing follow-up sales calls to ensure all leads are covered§Negotiating deals, closing sales and achieving targets§Identifying new opportunities by remaining current on industry trends and feedback from customers§Supporting the wider sales and commercial teams in achieving goals and targets§The ideal candidate for this role would possess the following experience and attributes:§Min. 2 years of experience in a call centre or customer service environment§A passion for dealing with retail customers in a B2C capacity§Experience managing a sales process from first contact through to conclusion§IT skills in Microsoft Office and CRM management (ideally Zoho)§An approachable, friendly and professional communication style§A proven ability to think on your feet and offer creative solutions§Experience working independently with minimal supervision§In return for your hard work and dedication we offer a competitive salary + bonuses. We are a social workplace so we have staff lunches, drinks and quarterly incentive trips and experiences to keep you interested!§If you believe you have the relevant experience and skills, as well as an approach to customer service that goes above and beyond, then we would love to hear from you.§Please note that only applicants with the current right to work in NZ will be considered.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50702830.txt	§Trade Counter Sales- Fixed Term§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trade Counter Sales- Fixed Term§§Advertiser: §Carrier New Zealand Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§About the business§ §AHI Carrier (NZ) Limited is an international multi-discipline company active in a wide range of HVAC based equipment sales, installation, and service work with a nationwide presence. Our New Zealand business streams includes the sale of new equipment (including Carrier and Toshiba Heat Pumps), Spare parts through our Totaline stores and Service work.§ §Totaline Stores provide specialist products for the air-conditioning, heating and refrigeration trade providing our customers with a choice of aftermarket solutions nationally through our network of trade outlets located strategically across New Zealand.§ § § §We are currently seeking an experienced §Trade Counter Sales§person for our Auckland store, with trade sales and warehousing experience for a §fixed term§ to replace staff on maternity leave until mid-June 2021. Reporting to the Branch Manager, the overall responsibility of this role will focus on servicing and assisting customers with their HVAC parts and supplies, aiming to achieve exceptional customer satisfaction and promoting Totaline as their preferred one-stop-shop for all their after-market needs. Additionally, you will also have shared warehousing responsibility so warehousing experience would be beneficial.§ §A normal business day will include, but not limited to, interacting with trade customers, expediting sales orders & branch transfers, dealing with customers face to face and on the phone, sourcing parts, raising invoices, merchandising of stock, working with the team to improve branch results by building strong relationships with customers. You will also focus on developing new business initiatives through your business networks, aiming to build new customer base. As part of the team you will also be required to handle warehouse responsibilities, forming part of the store, that includes sorting, picking and packing goods, labelling, storing and other tasks as required by the Branch Manager.§ §Candidates with exceptional customer & communication skills, and computer proficiency with ERP & MS365 programs would be a minimum criterion you need, to be considered for the role. Preference will be given to applicants who have prior trade counter sales or HVAC&R, Electrical, Mechanical experience plus warehousing knowledge and holds a forklift license. § §Benefits and perks§ §We offer a competitive salary, a chance to work with an industry leading company and within a great working environment.§ §Skills and experience§ §This role requires a team player with a positive can-do attitude, attention to detail and willingness to learn & grow with exceptional customer service as your number one priority.§ §Computer literacy with ERP systems and MS programs with be a distinct advantage.§ §Only NZ citizens & residents or with persons with valid NZ work permit need to apply.§ §Apply in confidence through SEEK.§ §To apply for this role please email:§Nirmal.Gaunder@ahi-carrier.co.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

Responsibilities in this role include; Taking ownership of customer queries, especially inventory availability and pricing, processing customer orders, checking accuracy of sales orders and inventory prices, checking the system daily for forward and overdue orders for customer specific delivery dates, informing customers and Account Managers about existing orders, liaising with Account Managers on future and current stock requirements, filing and administration.§About you§Customer orientated with excellent interpersonal and communication skills; you are pro-active with a can-do attitude. jobText: TXT/50709453.txt	§Insurance Claims Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Insurance Claims Representative§§Advertiser: §AA Insurance§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$50,000+ depending on experience§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Here at AA Insurance we are humbled and grateful to say our business is valued more than ever and we are growing our teams to reflect our customer's needs.§You need no Insurance experience just proven experience in excelling at offering solutions to customers. You could be from the travel industry, emergency services, banking, store cards, telecommunications etc. You will be someone that genuinely wants the best for people and loves going the extra mile and really helping and solving your customer's needs, especially in times of real need. That's what it takes to be an Insurance Claims Representative, someone who is there for our customers often in times of crisis.§Using your highly effective listening, communication and interpersonal skills you will take ownership of getting customers sorted when they need it the most …. at claim time. With your exceptional customer service skills and your ability to effectively assess the needs of our customers, they will instantly feel at ease talking to you and know they are in safe hands. This role will see you as the first contact our customers have when they want to make an insurance claim. Often calling you in times of emergency, for example a car accident, house fire, flood etc. You will be the calming voice on the end of the phone, ready to help and reassure them.§You will be supported through our comprehensive training and coaching programmes to become empowered decision makers, to find the best solutions for our customers. With your proven customer service experience, you will use common sense and judgement in your decision making and have a strong sense of urgency with your work. You will enjoy thinking outside the box to identify opportunities to drive customers to our preferred suppliers, whilst also seeking out ways to consistently provide exceptional customer service.§To shine in the role:§Proven experience in a customer service role ideally in a similar role where you assess customer needs and offer solutions. A call-based environment is preferred but not essential.§You are passionate about helping people and providing solutions§You will have a strong sense of urgency§You are compassionate and reassuring in a crisis§You will use your initiative and common sense in decision-making§You will start with 3 ½ weeks of full-time paid training. You will then move onto a rotating roster, working 7.5 hour shifts totalling 37.5 hours a week between 8am - 8pm on weekdays and 8am - 6pm on weekends. Weekend work is generally 1-2 weekend days per month.§The Perks!§A generous starting salary of $50k+ depending on experience§Annual salary reviews and an achievable and generous annual bonus§A strong focus on training, staff developments and internal promotions§An award winning wellbeing programme§Fantastic discounts on our insurance products (including up to 50% off car insurance) as well as at a number of retail outlet§If you are ready to take on a new career and willing to learn then please send through your CV and cover letter by Monday 19th October. This role starts on Monday 23rd November.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50709528.txt	§Spark Representative - Hastings§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Spark Representative - Hastings§§Advertiser: §Spark New Zealand Trading Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§At Spark we're proud of helping of all New Zealand win big in a digital world. As part of fulfilling our purpose, we are embarking on a journey and a new way of working called Unified Frontline, with the overarching ambition that our people are unified in their customer obsession and can provide a consistent customer experience across all ways that we interact with our customers.§This is where you come in! We are on the lookout for amazing individuals to join us on this journey.§As a Spark Representative, I am someone who:§Is truly customer obsessed by putting them at the centre of everything we do.§Loves a variety of work and strives for continuous development.§Has a passion for working day-to-day within a team that thrives off sharing knowledge and expertise (to support a culture of continuous learning, where you learn from others and they learn from you).§Exuding passion and energy to foster enthusiasm among the team in bringing Unified Frontline's vision to life.§Is adaptable and flexible to changes as we evolve through Unified Frontline, as a team and as a business.§What will this look§ §like§ §for you?§-When you join Spark, we will kickstart your career with us by upskilling you in what we call the 'universal skillset' which is will provide you with the foundation of knowledge and skills to interact with a customer regardless of how they choose to get in touch with us. From there, you will be able to learn on the job, and apply your learnings to what we refer to as a 'touchpoint' (the way we interact with our customers) such as retail or contact centre.§-You will start with one form of interacting with a customer. However, the amazing thing is, once you build your confidence and hunger for development, you will be able to move onto another touchpoint.§-The team you will work with is made up of customer obsessed people who are also self-driving their own learning. This means that while showing up for our customers consistently, and you can lean on your team members to support you to ensure you can provide that end to end customer service.§This will mean that we can provide our customers with world class service by flowing to where the customer needs us, through the channel of their choice. This will further your sales career giving you incredible opportunities to grow and develop your career and skillset with us.§At Spark,§ we are a 7 day a week business with a very diverse customer base so there is a need for flexibility and embracing what it takes to support our people and customers. With that, there will be a need at times to be adaptable in terms of working across different Spark locations and different rosters/schedules.§If you have previous customer service or sales experience, love technology, thrive in a fast pace environment, and can connect with a diverse range of people, you could be just the person we are looking for.§Not only are we customer inspired but we're also about making you feel at valued and appreciated. That is why we have put in place a competitive salary and commission, and generous staff benefits.§Feel like being world class?§ §We need people like you to make it happen,§*§a§*pply today.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Operations Adviser - Wellington Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711168.txt	§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operations Adviser - Wellington§§Advertiser: §Department of Corrections§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Fixed Term Contract till 31st July 2021§You must be able to start training on the 2nd November 2020§Application progressed you must be able to attend an Assessment Centre on the 14th October 2020§Competitive salary: $57,398 - 67,527§§ §Are you looking for a role in which you can work with exciting technology and dedicated people while making a difference to the communities we live in? This could be the job for you.§Our Operations Advisers are part of 24/7 teams based at the Department of Corrections based in the Wellington Region. We assist frontline staff in the management of over 4000 electronically monitored offenders and defendants around NZ. Our tight-knit teams are busy, focused and committed to keeping the community safe. The environment is dynamic, fast paced, and energetic.§Any given shift in these teams will involve important responsibilities such as liaising with Police to coordinate a welfare check or the arrest of a high risk individual, assisting a Probation Officer in the management of their offender, or problem-solving over the phone with offenders or defendants who are facing difficult and stressful situations.§This is a demanding role - the phones can be exceptionally busy and no two days will be the same. People who are successful in this role will possess the following attributes:§§The ability to communicate and engage clearly with people from all different cultures and backgrounds§Integrity and professionalism§People skills and a sense of humour§Resilience to deal with shift work, challenging people and situations§Strong computer literacy§The ability to make sound decisions whilst adhering to process and established frameworks.§§Although a degree or experience in a relevant field would be beneficial, we value life experience, the ability to work the required shift patterns and a "can do attitude". This is a fantastic opportunity to kick-start your career in the Department of Corrections.§You will be using modern GPS technology and software. While training will be provided for these platforms, you must also be competent with Microsoft applications including Outlook, Word, and Excel.You can expect to be challenged, but also to leave each shift with a sense of satisfaction that comes from making an important contribution towards managing the people in our care and keeping our community safe.§Operations Advisers in our teams work a mixture of shifts 6am-4pm, 12-10pm, 8.30pm-6.30am, which will change on a rotational basis Monday-Sunday including public holidays. Please note that for all shift pattern options above, approximately four weeks of 9am-5pm Monday-Friday will be required for initial training when the role begins§Remuneration range: $57,398 - 67,527 (starting rate within the range may be negotiable based on relevant experience).§§Mō mātou | §About us§§Ara Poutama Aotearoa is a name that has been gifted to us by Iwi and conveys the responsibility we have to support and guide those in our care to reach their potential.  Our strategy, Hōkai Rangi (https://arapoutama.page.link/Eit5), provides a clear direction of travel - one that builds on the good things that are already happening, and, most importantly, how we can innovate to find new ways of doing things to achieve better outcomes for Māori, whānau and communities. §§Tono ināianei | Apply Now§To apply, submit your§ tailored CV and a cover letter (PDF)§ describing your motivation for wanting to join Ara Poutama and highlighting your relevant skills, experience and personal qualities essential to this role.  §It is an exciting time and we continue to seek out talented individuals who are committed to an inclusive, vibrant workplace. We recognise and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals, and that of the collective talent in our whānau.§For reporting and transparency, it is important that all applications are submitted through our careers site.  If you want to find out more about a career with us, visit §careers.corrections.govt.nz§ or email our team at §careers@corrections.govt.nz§§§§

You'll be speaking with customers and completing sales process so a positive and friendly attitude is a must.§You'll be expected to:§Develop new relations ships with customers in order to increase revenue, build loyalty and reduce churn by achieving or exceeding your targets§Work with the Sales & Retention Leader to gather & build competitor and market knowledge base on a daily basis§Meet hourly, daily, weekly and monthly sales targets, as well as set KPIs & other performance metrics§Deliver a high degree of customer service at all times through building knowledge of core business information and applying this knowledge to maximise customer satisfaction§About you:§We are looking for people who can clearly communicate with customers from all walks of life, who are dependable to their core and who have the grit and tenacity to show up and work hard, because that's just what they do.§Previous experience working in a sales environment§A can-do attitude, great communication skills and you must be a team player§Ability to make a high volume of calls daily§The Benefits:§In exchange for your dedication and hard work, we offer…§Competitive salary not to mention Genesis will contribute 4% to your kiwi saver provider§Ongoing coaching and training development§Flexible working with the opportunity of being able to work from home 2 x days a week§This is a fixed term, full time position of 40 hours per week Tuesday - Saturday 9:00 am:-5:30pm§Selected candidates will need to have a clear credit and police check, If you are on a Visa it needs to be an open Working Visa.§Please apply online!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50712138.txt	§Call Centre Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Call Centre Manager§§Advertiser: §Monster Group New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§Do you have a passion for excellent customer service and want to build on a strong delivery culture through developing a great team? Can you combine strategic input into the direction of the company as well as roll your sleeves up for the day to day activities? This role offers all that and more because you will be joining a high functioning collaborative team and a new organisation that genuinely makes a difference to our customer's cost of living. § §Our Story § §Since starting in 2015 Monster Group has grown rapidly by both hard work and a continual drive for success. We focused on the Australian market in our start-up phase. Our continued growth looks bright with our entry into NZ.  Our organisation has successfully run recruitment and recruited great minds from around the world, to help build our company. We started off in the electricity comparison sector, then quickly diversified our interests into the Solar Industry & Broadband. § §Our company continues to thrive in our field because of the unique working environment that excels with a collaborative approach to design, creation & then implementation. Monster Group relies heavily on tech & digital marketing.  Our portfolio of brands we have recruited to work with continues to grow as our company expands. Keen to join our success-driven team and help us enter the New Zealand market & soon to be Texas?§ §About the role§ §We are looking for someone who can lead our sales team and further develop our customer service strategy. The position sits with the leadership team and reports directly to our COO.§ § §Provide effective day to day leadership and direction of your team§ §Mentor, train and encourage staff to fulfil their potential and promote our values§ §Identify opportunities for process improvement and continuous customer service improvements§ §Embracing our overall vision build capability, develop KPI’s, and a sustainable structure for future growth and changing market conditions.§ §Ensure fit for purpose systems and technologies, analyse trends and data providing meaningful reporting§ §Ensures strong support for other business functions including production and sales force § §Conduct staff performance reviews assess needs, cost/benefit analysis and other operational strategy assessments.§ §Manage and improve centre performance through performance monitoring, problem resolution, system audits and quality assurance measures.§ §Aid human resources department in the recruitment process by interviewing potential hires and outlining clear job expectations.§ §Prepare annual budget after estimating necessities, correcting overspending, analysing cost variance and scheduling expenses.§ §Summarize, collect and analyse call centre trends and data for regular performance reports.§ §Oversee system maintenance and upgrade implementation. Call for repairs and troubleshooting as needed.§ §Maintain consistent professional improvement through company provided workshops, tracking call centre trends and active participation in team projects.§ §About you:§ § §A minimum of 10 years’ experience in a sales or customer service role including 5 years in a management role§ §A belief in people, training, mentoring, personal development and encouragement with the ability to listen and offer solutions§ §Naturally positive and collaborative in your outlook with the ability to engage with people at all levels§ §Customer-centric with the ability to empathise with the customer balancing with the needs of the business§ §The ability to handle surprises, identify and lead change growing your team's capabilities§ §Excellent communications skills both written and verbal§ §IT savvy with competence in MS and the ability to learn new systems.§ §A glass half full person with a willingness to make things happen.§ §How To Apply:§ §If you have experience or have a keen interest to work in a unique and vibrant atmosphere, then we want to hear from you! In return for your efforts, you'll get to work in a fun and creative industry where no day is ever the same!§ §Please apply via the link with a cover letter and CV attached to complete your application. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

As well as working with awesome people within the organisation, you'll find many opportunities to develop and progress your career with us. Christchurch City Council, where it's possible to love what you do.§Located in New Brighton, our hot pools by the sea is a unique drawcard for locals and visitors to relax and enjoy. Our contact centre is staffed from 7 days a week between the hours of 8.30am-9pm§ §Our Customer Service Representatives help and educate our customers with everything from their credit card statements, to seeing if our products can help them buy the things they want to enjoy life!§ §If you thrive working in an innovative and dynamic environment, are looking for an environment where you can make a difference, and you get a sense of pride when helping others and are looking for a business that will grow with you - flexigroup is the right place for you§ §What are we looking for?§ §Here are some of the must haves§ § §A stable work background with experience in providing quality customer service§ §Microsoft office suite trained and highly skilled§ §2 years working with computer based programmes§ §2 years' experience in customer service front line role§ §Experience in dealing with complex and multiple problems at once§ §Be able to identify process and solves problem§ §Experience in adhering to a rotational roster with scheduled breaks, including working weekends and late nights§ §Why work for us?§ §We have a playful culture at flexigroup. Apply today!§        §Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§      §      §        § Email: Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§      §    §    §  §§§We have numerous exciting opportunities for excellent role models to join the team at our premium client site, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand (RBNZ). The shifts are 12 hours from 08:00 to 20:00 and 20:00 to 08:00.§ §It is desirable for candidates to:§ § §Have an excellent attention to detail and a demonstrated experience in the Coordinated Incident Management System (CIMS) methodology, or with transferable experience.§ §Have the ability to lead and direct staff, and confidently address and document performance issues with them.§ §Have experience in Access Control, Intruder Detection and CCTV systems, and have the technical aptitude to learn new systems or software.§ §Hold a current Certificate of Approval (COA) with classes MO, PRG, PSG and CC.§ §Hold a National Certificate in Security (Level 2) or above.§ § § §It is essential for candidates to:§ § §Have the ability for attention to detail and the ability to motivate, coach and communicate effectively.§ §Have the ability to ensure that all communication and work delivered is maintained at a professional and appropriate level.§ §Have the ability to build and maintain professional relationships with our client, assessing and reviewing services provided to them to ensure we are meeting their security needs.§ §Have the ability to act as a role model to others in promoting the company's commitment to safe work practices, and adhering to health and safety legislative requirements, as well as promoting the professional image expectations that come with representing FIRST Security and the Reserve Bank of New Zealand.§ §Gain or hold and maintain a Reserve Bank of New Zealand Security Clearance. To be eligible candidates must have a clean criminal and credit history.§ §Be an NZ Permanent Resident or NZ Citizen, as you will need to obtain special clearance for this role.§ §This is an excellent opportunity for one to step up in to a supervisory role at New Zealand’s central bank. If you are looking for a new challenge and have the ability to lead, then we would be interested in hearing from you. Apply today!§ §Please click the 'Apply Now' button below.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Do you hold a current security licence?§§§

As Customer Service Manager you will be responsible for the day to day smooth running of the department.§  §Whether it's analysing reports, processing orders, locating stock or solving problems, good communication and time management skills are a must, as you will always have more than one task on the go at any given time.§  §This role is ideally suited for a practical "can do" person who has a passion for understanding our business while juggling multiple tasks.§  §While a rural background would be advantageous we are looking for someone with the following attributes:§ § §Experienced in leadership§ §Professional, empathetic and diplomatic manner§ §Skilled in delegation, follow up and a master problem solver§ §Has excellent time management and communication skills§ §Impeccable administration skills§ §Has the ability to work well within a team but also sees opportunities to grow/challenge and mentor those in the team to consistently improve their knowledge and skills§ §Ensures productivity and growth within the team§ §Has a friendly personality and a good sense of humour§ §Throughout our long history, Donaghys has remained firmly focused on the future and has evolved into one of New Zealand's leading developers and suppliers of performance products, across a range of industries and countries.§  §We are a 'can do' company, who believe our customers have a right to good service and who want people to know they can count on Donaghys... it's as simple as that.§  §Applicants must be a New Zealand resident.§  §If you think this sounds like you, don't wait, applications close Monday 26th October 2020.§  §To apply for this job go to: talentpropellerjobs.co.nz & enter ref code: 5241500. §  §Applications close 26 October 2020§§§§

We are the No.1 cavity slider manufacturer in Australasia for quality and remain proudly 100% New Zealand owned and operated.  We engineer and manufacture the best and most innovative door systems possible.  We have a huge range of cavity sliding systems and related products to choose from - suitable for both residential and commercial applications, including special systems for disabled access and healthcare, automatic cavity sliders and self-closing options.

This is a fantastic opportunity to start a banking career with ANZ. for delivering excellent customer service, this might be the role for you!§  §        §In this role, you would have the opportunity to:§        §          §Receive inbound calls from new and existing customers, assisting with their banking needs;§          §Build positive relationships with ANZ customers by ensuring their banking experience with us is easy, efficient and accurate;§ jobText: TXT/50747704.txt	§Customer Service Agent - Part Time§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Agent - Part Time§§Advertiser: §The Co-operative Bank§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About Us§The Co-operative Bank is a different kind of bank. We’re here to change banking for good.§Since 1928, our customers have been at the heart of everything we do, and we’re focused on helping New Zealander’s get ahead financially.§Whether it’s help from one of our friendly teams, or a seamless experience with one of our digital solutions, we’ve got our customers covered. To top it off, we’re the only bank in New Zealand that shares its profits with its customers. It’s all part of the co-operative difference.§Here, no two days are the same. Our people are empowered to innovate, share ideas and let our skills take us in unexpected and exciting directions. But most importantly, we can be ourselves at work; we have fun, but still get things done.§About the role§As part of our Customer Banking Inbound Team, you’ll be handling inbound contacts from our customers via phone, email, and social media. You’ll be expected to provide an excellent service experience by quickly and efficiently assessing customer needs and helping deliver the right solution.§Because The Co-operative Bank is owned by our customers, everything we do, every day, is for their benefit.§Part-time role - 15 hours per week.§Key responsibilities§  §Achieve the bank’s goals by delivering excellent customer experiences §  §Build relationships with customers by establishing rapport, proactively identifying their needs across our full product and services range, and deliver suitable solutions §  §Adhere to current policy, procedures, and legal requirements§  §Work collaboratively with other members of the team§  §Comply with Health & Safety requirements including practicing safe work methods, and helping management eliminate workplace hazards§You’ll bring the following experience to the table:§  §Proven customer service experience§  §Problem solving skills §  §Ability to work under pressure and time constraints§In return for your passion and commitment to helping us Change Banking for Good, we offer an outstanding work environment, ongoing training and the opportunity to work with people who are passionate about making a difference. jobText: TXT/50745581.txt	§Customer Support Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Support Representative§§Advertiser: §Otago Regional Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§One Year Fixed Term§ §At the Otago Regional Council (ORC), our mission is ‘for our future’. We’re here to protect and enhance the environment and enable our communities to do the same. To be sure we can deliver on our responsibilities, we are evolving as an organisation, and we’re not overstating when we say we have some really big targets to reach. We need the right people, in the right roles, to help us to get there.§ §The Opportunity§ §Our Customer Experience team plays a vital role within ORC and we are currently seeking a Customer Support Representative in a one-year full time fixed term capacity based at our Queenstown office.§ §This role will see you providing our customers with a first-rate customer experience across our phone, face-to-face, email and online service channels. Whether it’s assisting customers with rates payments, public transport and pollution enquiries, or simply greeting visitors at our reception desk – we are seeking people with an adaptable communication style to deliver exceptional service to our diverse community in Otago.§ §The role will require you proactively shaping the customers’ end to end experience and as part of improving the overall experience for our customers in the Queenstown Lakes area. You will be responsible for managing ORBUS Queenstown enquiries and in so doing become a local subject matter expert.  Working seamlessly with the other ORC depots and hubs you will use your excellent time management and communication skills to ensure a strong customer focus is apparent in all that you do.§ §About You§ §Our ideal candidate will:§ § §Have experience in a customer service, retail or hospitality environment§ §Proven sound and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate verbally, written, and face to face§ §Be professionally presented with a customer focused attitude§ §Strong organisational skills and ability to use computer systems§ §We think Otago’s a pretty special place. It covers a vast area – the third largest local government region in New Zealand. Those who call Otago home enjoy access to mountains, coastal lowlands, dramatic rivers and wild beaches. Our environment here is part of who we are, and at ORC, we work each day to look after it.§ §If you share this passion and can align your skills and experience to what we’ve outlined above, we would love to hear from you!§ §How to Apply§ §If you meet the above criteria, we welcome your application including your CV and cover letter outlining why you are the person for this role via § www.orc.govt.nz/our-council-our-region/join-our-team§ §Applications close Friday 30th October 2020.§ §Please note.§  We don’t always work to fixed closing dates and may start considering and interviewing candidates as their applications are received so we encourage you to apply early.§ §For further information, please contact § human.resources@orc.govt.nz§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50737564.txt	§iSign Customer Service Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§iSign Customer Service Officer§§Advertiser: §Deaf Aotearoa Holdings Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§§About the business§ § § §Have you ever thought about working with the Deaf community? § §iSign is a New Zealand Sign Language interpreter booking service providing qualified NZSL interpreters for jobs all around New Zealand. iSign provides over 19,000 hours of interpreting services each year, including medical appointments and announcements by the Prime Minister by matching and organising assignments for over 100 of our qualified interpreters.§ §iSign is a service of Deaf Aotearoa and is committed to improving access for Deaf people.§ §Deaf Aotearoa provides a workplace which values diversity, and where both New Zealand Sign Language (NZSL) and English are used. Staff members are supported in the development of their NZSL skills.§ §We are an equal opportunities employer and we have Deaf-friendly work practices in place. We employ Deaf people at all levels, NZSL interpreters are provided for all meetings and training courses. § §We encourage and support professional development and offer flexible, family-friendly work practices. § §We are strongly committed to following organisation standards that ensure we provide quality systems, work practices and services. We perform service audits and review our policies regularly. § § § §About the role§ § § §Responding appropriately to requests for interpreters from Deaf Community members, Government departments and the general public.§Prioritize requests for the bookings at the first opportunity.§Works with flexibility.§Undertake training in the booking system.§Works well under pressure and is able to manage own workload to ensure there is time to assist and support service users efficiently.§Key customer service principles of care, compassion and friendliness.§Seek opportunities to actively promote iSign and Deaf Aotearoa and act in the best interest of Deaf Aotearoa.§Role is based in Auckland.§ § § §Skills and experience§ § § §High administration skills§Experience in an admin/coordination position§Experience in customer service & sales§Relationship building skills§Experience in the not-for-profit/community sector (good to have but not essential)§Experience in using a variety of IT systems and applications (Microsoft Office)§Commitment to the Treaty of Waitangi & Pacific principles§ § § §Applications for this position close at §3pm§ on §Friday 30th of October§ §For a full job description, please go to http://deaf.org.nz/support-us/careers-at-da § §We also welcome applications in NZ Sign Language.§ §For a confidential discussion please contact Mark Crooke at mark.crooke@deaf.org.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

You'll be part of an awesome team based at the Wellington Ferry Terminal, we're a tight knit bunch, supportive and passionate about exceeding our customers' expectations.§What are we looking for?§You must love working with people and have a passion for delivering excellent customer service! You will get to meet and interact with a diverse group of travellers from all over the world and different walks of life, and you will get the opportunity to make their experience on the Bluebridge Cook Strait Ferries just a little bit more special. §We are looking for enthusiastic team players with a positive can-do attitude, fantastic communication skills and ability to remain calm under pressure. jobText: TXT/50753648.txt	§Advisor - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Advisor - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§The Ministry of Justice provides a range of justice services around New Zealand.  We have more than 3000 people working across 120 locations around the country, all working towards our vision of a safe and just New Zealand.§The Courts and Tribunals, Regional Service Delivery, Operations Support team is looking for advisors to join the team. This role provides direct advice and support to frontline service delivery across the Court and Tribunals team.§The key functions of this role are to provide advice and the delivery of work to a high standard in a variety of areas, including correspondence, technical advice, issue and risk management, data analysis and work programme priorities.§Mō te tīma/About our Team§At Tāhū o te Ture - the Ministry of Justice, we're committed to working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. §It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated. §§ §He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§The key functions of this role are to provide advice and the delivery of work to a high standard in a variety of areas, including correspondence, technical advice, issue and risk management, data analysis and work programme priorities.§To be successful in this position you will:§§have a proven history of delivering work on time and to a high standard,§have exceptional written skills,§be a proven communicator and able to build trust relationships across a wide range of audiences,§enjoy working in a fast-paced environment where you are required to influence and respond to changing needs and priorities,§be able to see things from many different points of view and make connections to various streams of work, and§have a strong focus on resilience, and the ability to deal with sensitive subject matter.§§We are looking for a motivated candidate who is eager to learn and grow. You will have room to develop your skills and knowledge across the wider Ministry of Justice.§This is an exciting time to join a fun and motivational team and help shape the services we deliver, working together for a fair and safe Aotearoa.§Salary range: $61,744 - $87,167§ §Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Applications close on 29 October 2020§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50748667.txt	§Kitchen and Bathroom Team Members§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kitchen and Bathroom Team Members§§Advertiser: §Mitre 10§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§ §Your locally owned and operated Mitre 10 Mega in Rotorua is looking for two Team Members to join our busy Kitchens/Bathrooms Department. This role will be primarily working in the kitchens department but also helping in the plumbing and bathroom area when necessary.§These positions are working part time fixed term for §24 hours per w§eek.§ We want the ideal candidate to start late October 2020 until early February 2021. §Role 1§: Thursday, Friday and Saturday (8 hours per day)§Role 2: §Sunday, Monday and Tuesday (8 hours per day)§This role will combine your excellent customer service skills, with your attention to detail, as you work alongside customers to help bring their projects to life. You will work closely with each customer at every stage of the process and will be responsible for ensuring the customer is satisfied with their products whether this is; placing and processing orders, flat-packing orders ready for delivery, monitoring progress and installation, and following up at completion to ensure customer satisfaction.§The ideal candidates would have:§A  confident, friendly approach when dealing with internal and external      customers;§A  high level of accuracy in all areas of work;§High  attention to detail;§Intermediate  to advanced computer literacy skills;§The  physical capability to manage the manual handling requirements of the      role;§In return, Mitre 10 Mega Rotorua can offer you:§Employee  bonus incentives;§Staff  purchasing privileges after 6 months of service;§Guidance  towards the completion of a Retail Level 2 Certificate;§And  most importantly, a friendly, supportive work environment.§As part of our commitment to workplace health and safety, we require all employees to undergo a pre-employment drug and alcohol screening.§If this role sounds like the right fit for you, please apply online before Friday 23rd October 2020. jobTitle: Entry Level Sales Executive Position Available Job in Wellington - SEEK

xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50724964.txt	§Entry Level Sales Executive Position Available§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Entry Level Sales Executive Position Available§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Are you providing excellent customer service but feel you are not being rewarded? Do you love learning and are looking to join an organisation that backs you? Every thought of sales? It's really just great customer service where you get rewarded for your hard work. We go by the motto do the Mahi get the treats! If this sounds like you, we are looking for entry-level Sales Representatives to join our growing team. §  §Our inside sales role offers an environment to learn, practice, challenge, and establish a strong foundation that's invaluable in your career. The focus is on supporting our sales teams with more leads, more closed deals and more revenue. Your efforts directly give to Monster Groups top-line growth – providing you with a professional development plan into a consultation selling, professional broker position. §  §Who We Are §  §The Monster Group was launched in 2015 to help consumers save on their energy needs. After a period of rapid growth, we have now diversified into both the Solar and Telco markets, helping households and business save even more! Our organisation has focused on recruiting great minds from around the world to help build our company. Keeping with this strategy, we are now inviting talented individuals to join our growing team.  §  §About the role§ § §Qualifying and disqualifying inbound leads in a high-volume environment using calls, email and chatbots. § §Representing our brand as the first point of contact between decision-makers and executive brokers. § §Building credibility and value in our solution through strategic research and preparation. § §Promoting our line of premium telco and energy brands to consumers and small businesses§ §Requirements § § §Intelligence, Character, Coachable, Experience§ §Focused on a long-term sales career§ §You will be successful if: § § §You want to win at all the time, and you find motivation in temporary setbacks§ §You don't believe in settling, you find ways to overachieve and keep improving § §Your ability to learn is off the charts and you are hungry for more § §You love connecting with people online, on the phone and face to face§ §You've done some selling in the past and want to learn how to be great at sales § §What do you get? § § §Tailored Professional Development Plan § §Daily Training and Coaching§ §Great Team Environment § §Uncapped Commission Structure§ §Monthly Team Incentives § §Our Top 5 Earners For the Week of 28th September§ § §Jett $1,502,§ §John $1,490,§ §Sam $1,480,§ §Fergus $1,416,§ §Lennon $1,312§ §Planned Monthly Team Incentive§ § §September – MG Quarterly Paintball Champs§ §October – MG Martinborough Wine Adventure § §November – MG Orienteering Challenge § §December – MG Christmas Party§ §What we Value §  §At the Monster Group, we go by 11 core values that have steered us to success. Never Stop Learning, Opportunities Are Everywhere, Be Personally Responsible, Customer First, Trust the Process, No "I" in "Monster", Radical Transparency, No Lazy Brain, Speed with Accuracy, Cutting Edge Technology and finally Mahia te Mahi! §  §How to Apply§  §If some or all of these resonate with your personality, then we want to hear from you! Please apply by clicking the button below. Otherwise, you can call our corporate recruiter Drew on §04 333 0638§ or email §drew.lemmerick@monstergroup.com.au§ with a cover letter and copy of your CV. §  §Do The Mahi Get The Treats§  §---------------------------------------------------------------------------------§  §Keywords: Sales Representative, Sales Consultant, Sales Executive, Sales Specialist, Sales Coordinator, Inbound Sales, Outbound Sales, Sales Developer§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: All ROUNDER - Deliveries, Installations & Onsite Technician & Showroom Sales Job in Wellington - SEEK
experience: Our client represents the most well recognized high end, premium Spa brand. For over thirty years
jobText: TXT/50745281.txt	§All ROUNDER - Deliveries, Installations & Onsite Technician & Showroom Sales§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§All ROUNDER - Deliveries, Installations & Onsite Technician & Showroom Sales§§Advertiser: §KINGS RECRUITMENT LTD§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Salary§§Salary + Commission + use of car§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §All ROUNDER - Deliveries, Installations & Onsite Technician & Showroom Sales §    §      §        §          §WORLD No.1 Selling brand for this premium product – Business is BOOMING!§          §Seeking all-rounder for mix of Deliveries, Installations, Customer Service & Showroom Sales§          §Must be physically fit, technically savvy and have good Customer Service skills§        §        §Our client represents the most well recognized high end, premium Spa brand. For over thirty years, they have sold this premium spa brand directly to the consumer, via a national chain of showrooms, which now has grown to 24 branches in NZ and Australia. They pride themselves on being the best in the business!§        §On their behalf we are to appoint a capable, customer focused person to take on a hybrid role, which will be a mixture of Customer Deliveries and Installations, some onsite Technical Support§ and some Customer service and Showroom Sales.§        §This is a Monday to Friday role, with some occasional hours on a weekend and will be based out of their Lower Hutt Showroom.§        §How the role will work?§        §1 day a week: §You will be responsible for the Spa delivery & installation service to customers who have purchased a Spa. For this part of the role, you will need to be able to drive a manual vehicle and be able to reverse a trailer. (Must have a Full  drivers license). This is the physical part of the role, so you will need to be able use the equipment to support the spa delivery.§        §Delivery of a new spa is a very exciting time for their customers.  So, we need someone who will take the care and time to give a first-class customer service experience.  Not only will you be making the delivery, you will be installing the spa and providing the customer some training on how it runs.  It is really important for this part of the role that you are well-groomed, with exceptional communication and customer service skills.§        §2 days of the week: §You will also be trained up as a Spa Technician and will be responsible for fault finding and repairing spas. You will get full training in this area, but it would make it much easier if you came armed with some practical technical skills and experience. Basic handyman type skills will be good start!§        §For the other 2 days of the week§, you will be based in the Lower Hutt showroom and will be performing a Sales and Customer Service function. Assisting customers in their spa choices and sharing just why their spas are the very best that you can buy.§        §This is a great time to flex your sales skills and you will get paid commissions on any spas you sell (as well as spa chemicals and consumables).§        §Again, you will get in-depth product and sales training to ensure you are confident in this area.§        §This company will give you plenty of training across all the functions of this role. But there are certain skills and attributes that are not so easy to train -   Your Enthusiasm, Your Motivation and your   ability to connect with Customers, so we want you to bring that to the role.§        §Remuneration§: Salary + commission + use of company vehicle §        §So, if you are looking for a busy role with piles of variety and you want to be rewarded well for your hard work, then get in touch today!§        §Apply Via Seek or to §info@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§  §09 600 5155§ / 0800 FORJOBS - Ask for Cherish§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§ §WORLD No.1 Selling brand for this premium product – Business is BOOMING!§ §Seeking all-rounder for mix of Deliveries, Installations, Customer Service & Showroom Sales§ §Must be physically fit, technically savvy and have good Customer Service skills§ §Our client represents the most well recognized high end, premium Spa brand. For over thirty years, they have sold this premium spa brand directly to the consumer, via a national chain of showrooms, which now has grown to 24 branches in NZ and Australia. They pride themselves on being the best in the business!§  §On their behalf we are to appoint a capable, customer focused person to take on a hybrid role, which will be a mixture of Customer Deliveries and Installations, some onsite Technical Support§ and some Customer service and Showroom Sales.§  §This is a Monday to Friday role, with some occasional hours on a weekend and will be based out of their Lower Hutt Showroom.§  §How the role will work?§  §1 day a week: §You will be responsible for the Spa delivery & installation service to customers who have purchased a Spa. For this part of the role, you will need to be able to drive a manual vehicle and be able to reverse a trailer. (Must have a Full  drivers license). This is the physical part of the role, so you will need to be able use the equipment to support the spa delivery.§  §Delivery of a new spa is a very exciting time for their customers.  So, we need someone who will take the care and time to give a first-class customer service experience.  Not only will you be making the delivery, you will be installing the spa and providing the customer some training on how it runs.  It is really important for this part of the role that you are well-groomed, with exceptional communication and customer service skills.§  §2 days of the week: §You will also be trained up as a Spa Technician and will be responsible for fault finding and repairing spas. You will get full training in this area, but it would make it much easier if you came armed with some practical technical skills and experience. Basic handyman type skills will be good start!§  §For the other 2 days of the week§, you will be based in the Lower Hutt showroom and will be performing a Sales and Customer Service function. Assisting customers in their spa choices and sharing just why their spas are the very best that you can buy.§  §This is a great time to flex your sales skills and you will get paid commissions on any spas you sell (as well as spa chemicals and consumables).§  §Again, you will get in-depth product and sales training to ensure you are confident in this area.§  §This company will give you plenty of training across all the functions of this role. But there are certain skills and attributes that are not so easy to train -   Your Enthusiasm, Your Motivation and your   ability to connect with Customers, so we want you to bring that to the role.§  §Remuneration§: Salary + commission + use of company vehicle §  §So, if you are looking for a busy role with piles of variety and you want to be rewarded well for your hard work, then get in touch today!§  §Apply Via Seek or to §info@kingsrecruitment.co.nz§  §09 600 5155§ / 0800 FORJOBS - Ask for Cherish§§§§
