jobText: TXT/50722197.txt	§Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard/Driver), Waihi§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard/Driver), Waihi§§Advertiser: §Goldpine Industries Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §Outdoor Timber Specialist (Sales/Yard/Driver), Waihi §    §      §        §Here at Goldpine, we are proud of being not just Kiwi-owned, but family-owned. We are the 'Outdoor Timber Specialist', run by and focused on rural people. We are committed to working as a team, to deliver value to our customers and achieve our company and individuals' success.§        §          §Varied customer/yard focused role§          §Includes being our back-up delivery driver (class 2 required)§          §Product/sales training provided§        §        §Superpost®, Rhino™, Strongbuilt®, Ned's Sheds®, Ecoliving®, GOFENCE™ and RainStopper™ are just some of the exclusive and innovative products you'll find at Goldpine. These are all products designed specifically to deliver great value options to outdoor timber users.§        §Do you enjoy helping customers in the rural industry and being part of a team?§        §We are looking for someone with the personality, drive and confidence to become one of our Outdoor Timber Specialists. Plenty of variety here as you'll be greeting customers with a smile and 'can do' attitude, offering options for their projects, preparing orders, loading/unloading trucks, maintaining stock and ensuring our products are presented with pride. Being part of a sales team you will also need to thrive on giving great service to ensure our customers receive the best value option for their project. This role will include being our back-up delivery driver (class 2 required).§        §While a background in either customer service, yard work, driving, or farming may be an advantage, as full training will be provided, it is more important that you are able to demonstrate:§        §          §Self-motivation and reliability.§          §Honesty, integrity and a commitment to deliver what you promise.§          §A friendly, energetic and positive personality.§          §Physical fitness appropriate for lifting timber/posts with a commitment to safe work practices.§          §A willingness to be trained and learn new skills.§          §A commitment to safe work practices.§        §        §What's in it for you?§        §          §Training and development - this includes our product knowledge as well as developing sales skills. Training will also be provided if required to drive a forklift (F).§          §The satisfaction of building ongoing relationships with our customers - not just transacting a sale.§          §A position that can suit different stages of working life.§          §Team discount scheme on commencement.§          §As well as getting to work with great team mates who are committed to supporting each other and are recognised for their specialist knowledge.§        §        §You will need a full manual driver's licence (class 2) as you will be required to drive our vehicles.§        §Hours of work are Monday to Friday 7:30 am to 5:00 pm and rostered Saturday mornings 8:00 am to 12:30 pm.§        §Join a team that support each other to achieve and value having an enjoyable place to work. This also includes a wider team of 22 retail stores, three production sites and a national support office.§        §APPLY NOW!§ Visit §https://careers.goldpine.co.nz§ to complete our online application or alternatively call into the store (2 Dean Crescent, Waihi) for a printed application form. Should you require further information regarding this opportunity please contact Mel Thompson, Talent Adviser on 027 244 8170.§        §Please note as this is a permanent position applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand indefinitely and subject to a criminal convictions check.§      §      §      §    §    § Apply online at: https://careers.goldpine.co.nz §  §§§Here at Goldpine, we are proud of being not just Kiwi-owned, but family-owned. We are the 'Outdoor Timber Specialist', run by and focused on rural people. We are committed to working as a team, to deliver value to our customers and achieve our company and individuals' success.§Varied customer/yard focused role§Includes being our back-up delivery driver (class 2 required)§Product/sales training provided§Superpost®, Rhino™, Strongbuilt®, Ned's Sheds®, Ecoliving®, GOFENCE™ and RainStopper™ are just some of the exclusive and innovative products you'll find at Goldpine. These are all products designed specifically to deliver great value options to outdoor timber users.§Do you enjoy helping customers in the rural industry and being part of a team?§We are looking for someone with the personality, drive and confidence to become one of our Outdoor Timber Specialists. Plenty of variety here as you'll be greeting customers with a smile and 'can do' attitude, offering options for their projects, preparing orders, loading/unloading trucks, maintaining stock and ensuring our products are presented with pride. Being part of a sales team you will also need to thrive on giving great service to ensure our customers receive the best value option for their project. This role will include being our back-up delivery driver (class 2 required).§While a background in either customer service, yard work, driving, or farming may be an advantage, as full training will be provided, it is more important that you are able to demonstrate:§Self-motivation and reliability.§Honesty, integrity and a commitment to deliver what you promise.§A friendly, energetic and positive personality.§Physical fitness appropriate for lifting timber/posts with a commitment to safe work practices.§A willingness to be trained and learn new skills.§A commitment to safe work practices.§What's in it for you?§Training and development - this includes our product knowledge as well as developing sales skills. Training will also be provided if required to drive a forklift (F).§The satisfaction of building ongoing relationships with our customers - not just transacting a sale.§A position that can suit different stages of working life.§Team discount scheme on commencement.§As well as getting to work with great team mates who are committed to supporting each other and are recognised for their specialist knowledge.§You will need a full manual driver's licence (class 2) as you will be required to drive our vehicles.§Hours of work are Monday to Friday 7:30 am to 5:00 pm and rostered Saturday mornings 8:00 am to 12:30 pm.§Join a team that support each other to achieve and value having an enjoyable place to work. This also includes a wider team of 22 retail stores, three production sites and a national support office.§APPLY NOW!§ Visit §https://careers.goldpine.co.nz§ to complete our online application or alternatively call into the store (2 Dean Crescent, Waihi) for a printed application form. Should you require further information regarding this opportunity please contact Mel Thompson, Talent Adviser on 027 244 8170.§Please note as this is a permanent position applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand indefinitely and subject to a criminal convictions check.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50720675.txt	§Customer Service Representative§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Service Representative§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§A bit about us... §CRS Software Ltd is the leading provider of farm management software in New Zealand. We are a 100% kiwi owned agribusiness company with over 30 years’ experience in the development of software for the rural sector. With more than 10,000 farmers and businesses throughout New Zealand and Australia using our software, our role is to help them to measure and manage their business performance and make better decisions for their future. §   § The recent release of our next generation solution Cash Manager Focus almost completes our evolution to a fully cloud based SaaS business. But there is still plenty to do and we would love you to come and join us on the journey! §   § We aim to keep our customers at the heart of everything we do and are looking for a Customer Service Representative to join us on our mission. If that’s you, read on! § §The role §Based in our Masterton office, the Customer Service Representative is a pivotal part of our business and provides exceptional service to our customers. Every day, you will be building strong relationships with our customers and assisting them with queries in a timely way. You will also be the one to share information with customers about new products and services that may help them with their farming or agricultural business.  Day to day this role will: § § §Engage with customers over the phone, email and chat to resolve issues and problem solve § §Escalate issues when appropriate to the CST Manager § §Share customer feedback with the CST Manager to assist with product or process improvements § §Look for ways to add value to customers by suggesting additional products  § §Keep up to date with our product, including any new features or upcoming releases § §Share knowledge with the wider Client Services Team and contribute to our collaborative culture § § §About you § You will be a natural when it comes to engaging with a variety of people and have a customer-centric approach to your work. Ideally, you will come from a farming or accounting background and be able to connect with our customers quickly. jobText: TXT/50728291.txt	§Customer Care Specialist - FIXED TERM§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care Specialist - FIXED TERM§§Advertiser: §Airwork NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§We are looking for a Customer Care Specialist for a 12-month Fixed Term contract who is quick-thinking and solutions-focussed, you'll provide a refreshing and positive experience to our customers. This role requires inbound & outbound calls, administration and support to others within the wider teams.  You’ll have a strong customer service focus, be someone that is patient, empathetic and happy to work through options with customers to find the best solutions. You must be able to work in flexible work environment that caters to different time zones. § §At Airwork customer care is at the heart of everything that we do, we are 100% focused on going the extra mile to keep our customers flying.  We have customers in New Zealand, Australia and across the world and we are focused on continually improving their experience with us.  § §To succeed in this role, you will be:§ § §Passionate about providing the best possible experience for our customers§ §Able to play a part in a small but highly flexible team with a passion for customer care§ §Quick-thinking and solutions-focussed with the ability to deliver quality outcomes§ §Engaging and able to develop lasting positive relationships with both customers and colleagues§ §Resilient, with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment where no two days are the same§ §Someone with fantastic computer skills, including a sound knowledge of the Microsoft suite§ §Our Customer Care Team receive a diverse range of queries over any given day, you will need to be on top of your game and focused on:§ § §Providing our customers with the highest possible level of support and care§ §Proactively solving customer enquiries; following them through to successful resolution§ §Providing customers and colleagues across the business with relevant information to enable business success§ §Provide pricing and availability information, cross-reference, research & source of products for customers§ §Where required make proactive outbound calls in line with marketing campaigns, quotes follow-up etc§. § §What we can offer you:§ § §The opportunity to work with a great team that is passionate about what they do§ §The chance to help shape the future direction of customer care in the business§ §Competitive remuneration§ §Great South Auckland location§ §If you believe you are the right person for this role, then apply now!§ §PLEASE NOTE – Airwork has a two (2) week shut down period over the Christmas and New Year period. If insufficient leave has been accrued, these days will be taken as leave without pay.§ §Applicants for this position must have the right to work in New Zealand.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50746772.txt	§Sample Reception Technician- Foods Division §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sample Reception Technician- Foods Division §§Advertiser: §Analytica Laboratories Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§​About the opportunity§This is your chance to become part of a fast-growing commercial testing laboratory that provides information to Australasia's food and environmental sectors. We have a fantastic opportunity in our Sample Reception team for someone who is driven to provide exceptional customer service for a company passionate about helping its customers. The roles on offer are both in a Permanent and Fixed term capacity.§The person we are looking for to fill this role will enjoy dealing with people in person, by phone and by e-mail. They will have good attention to detail, so that we can rely on them to correctly identify and register samples for testing. The successful applicant will ideally have a minimum of two years customer experience, good attention to detail, with a genuine interest in science and a willingness to learn how we use testing techniques to deliver a fast, accurate service to our customer. §Role description§Sample Reception Technicians are primarily responsible for processing and registering inwards samples and goods and providing support and service to customers. They need to keep precise records for tracking samples with 100 percent accuracy whilst also being able to multitask in a busy and dynamic environment.§The Sample Reception Technician is required to follow ISO 17025 quality requirements, Transitional Laboratory protocols and develop a good knowledge of the tests offered, pricing and customer relationships.§Responsibilities include§o Receipting in Samples§o Ensure the accuracy of the client details and the database §o Responding to queries by phone, email or in-person §o Explaining the tests available and pricing §o Sample tracking, returns and subcontracting §o Always follow ISO 17025 laboratory accreditation principles §o Actively practise continuous improvement§o Keep the workplace clean, tidy, and safe §o Adhere to Analytica's Health & Safety policies and practices§This role will suit someone with the following background/experience/qualities§Great communication skills, interpersonal skills, and work ethic§Self-motivated, works well with minimum supervision, not afraid to ask for help§Able to multi-task and well organized, pays attention to detail§Willing to learn and accept constructive criticism§Strong commercial and customer focus§Keen to learn and develop§Confident user of computers and software§Ability to follow written and verbal instructions§About the company§We began developing innovative testing solutions in 2011, building on decades of prior experience in commercial testing, research and science-based business. Today our strong team of over 120 technical and operational staff use world class equipment to deliver testing services that are faster, better, and cheaper than those available from other laboratories. Our customer service is widely regarded as being the best in the industry. We are ISO 17025 accredited by IANZ, meaning that we are independently assessed to have skilled staff, using robust testing methods, to deliver results that clients trust.§What we will offer§Career progression§Competitive income§Positive working environment§§§§

No two days will ever be the same where some days you will be presenting your customers their brand new motorhome and others you could be just helping them check or fix whatever needs doing to get them back adventuring again. §Extremely varied, rewarding and ultimately satisfying is the best way to describe this diverse and unique role. Having a customer focus mindset; extraordinary organisational, problem-solving and adaptability skills means you will be the person we are looking for. Having an interest or background in automotive or technical type roles may also be advantageous. §Here at SmartRV we're big on collaboration and values. Working here is not just a job but a way of life. Each day you will come to work looking to make a difference for our customers.§ §Think you have just what we’re looking for, please apply today by submitting your CV, cover letter and phoning to leave your voicemail message. Showcase your superior telephone manner by leaving a message that blows us away. §How to Apply§If you think this sounds like your dream opportunity, we'd love to hear from you so please apply now by sumitting your CV and cover letter and then follow up by leaving a voicemail message with all of your details on our dedicated recruitment number §09 281 3619§, which is listed at the bottom of our application form.§Application Process & Updates§Part of the application process includes completing a job specific application form and calling and leaving a voicemail message to tell us why you think you have what it takes. Depending on the job board and device you apply with, you'll either see the form on the next screen or it will be emailed to you immediately, upon receiving your application. §Please check your inbox (and junk mail) for application updates. Emails are sent via our recruitment software, Chilli Factor. §§§§§

We are hiring Monitoring and Dispatch Operators to join our Triton, Alarm Monitoring team.§Triton monitors alarms throughout New Zealand from our high security Central Alarm Monitoring station. Reporting through to the Compliance Manager, you will handle a variety of customer enquiries around repairs and returns of our electronic products, manage outcomes, providing a seamless customer experience for our customers. § §As an §Electronic Returns Specialist§ §your key responsibilities will be:§ § §Testing and inspecting returns from customers to send back to the suppliers for repair or replacement.§ §Responding to customer enquiries, taking ownership through to resolution.§ §Building rapport with the customer by active listening and adapting communication style.§ §Running efficient case management and follow-up within agreed timeframes.§ §You will manage the majority of customer contact via written communication.§ §Keep up to date with processes and procedures to ensure accurate information is provided§ § § §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Vast experience in a customer services environment with a proven track record of offering exceptional customer service.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including an outstanding email manner§ §Great attention to detail and accuracy of work.§ §Experience with the full MS Office suite is an added benefit.§ §The ability to work with a sense of urgency and thrive working under pressure.§ §Have the ability to work with a diverse array of people and build successful working relationships both internal and external customers.§ §An ability to demonstrate flexibility and adaptability – thinking outside the box.§ §A great attitude and work ethic.§ §Some extra skills would be highly beneficial! § § §Experience with mobile device repair and knowledge.§ §A passion for all things tech-related.§ §A good grasp of the Consumers Guarantees Act and Fair Trading Act.§ §An understanding of both Windows and Mac operating systems.§ §Working within a small team, this role is about teamwork! Woking to tight timeframes and KPIs, you're a reliable and trusted team player with strong time management, punctuality and record of attendance.§ § § §Additional information§ §These opportunities are a great foot in The Warehouse Group door; offering loads of development and insight about the Warehouse Group business, working with passionate like-minded people with some good fun and laughs along the way. We have some great staff perks and guarantee an energetic and fast-paced environment. § §This role is 40 hours a week, Monday - Friday between 8am - 5pm. § §If this sounds like you, apply now and join the team!§ § § §1-day was established in 2007, and until August 2019, it operated as part of the Torpedo7 Group. It now operates as its own business unit as part of The Warehouse Group.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50748052.txt	§Outbound Telesales Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Outbound Telesales Consultant§§Advertiser: §NZME§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Outbound§§§§§§New Zealand Media and Entertainment keep Kiwis in the know about what matters most to them. We dig into what’s going on in the world and why, along with the latest and greatest in entertainment. We do it across over 50 of New Zealand’s leading media brands – each with its own voice, and each powered by the country’s top media personalities, journalists, broadcasters, writers, and commercial thinkers.§ §Combining radio, digital and print we reach over 3.3 million Kiwis every week. § §THE ROLE:§ §The purpose of the Outbound Telesales Consultant is to increase subscription revenue by actively selling subscriptions to prospective subscribers and lapsed or cancelled subscribers of NZME’s publications. These will be predominantly residential but may include some business subscriptions.§ §We are currently looking to fill 3 part-time roles. § §SKILLS REQUIRED:§ § § §Sales Ability:§ Able to build rapport and positive working relationships; ascertain subscribers needs through effective questioning techniques and/or up-sell wherever possible.§ §Results Orientation: §Maintain motivation for personal achievement of results and success; tenaciously working towards exceeding targets and better previous performance. Deriving satisfaction from the process of goal achievement and continuous improvement.§ §Communication:§ Expressing thoughts, feelings, and ideas effectively in individual and group situations; clearly expressing ideas, correct grammar, and language and terminology; adjusting language to the characteristics and needs of the audience.§ §Resilience: §Handling disappointment and/or rejection while maintaining effectiveness and not letting emotions take over in a difficult call. Maintain stability of performance under pressure and/or opposition. Use empathy and acknowledgement when dealing with upset or difficult customers.§ §Contributing to wider team success:§ Actively participating as a member of a team to move the team toward the completion of goals.§ §EDUCATION & PROVEN SUCCESS REQUIRED:§ § § §Sixth Form to NCEA Level 1 or 2§ §Customer Service/Contact Centre course and/or qualification or experience preferable but not necessary§ §A can-do attitude§ §THE PERKS:§ §Join this fun, fast-paced, supportive team today - located at our offices in Ellerslie, with shifts running every Monday-Friday from 5pm-8pm, this permanent part-time job is ideal for people wanting to work in the evenings. There’s plenty of parking available and a gym onsite! Apply now, ensuring you highlight your brilliance via your CV and cover letter.§ §Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50722698.txt	§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Face-to-Face Fundraisers§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Red Cross§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Face-to-Face Fundraiser§§Be part of the largest humanitarian network in the world! § §Help establish New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising team and make a difference.§ §Competitive hourly rate, paid training and opportunities to grow within New Zealand Red Cross.§§New Zealand Red Cross is extremely excited to be announcing the launch of §its first ever in-house face-to-face fundraising team§.§ We are looking for a select number of friendly, outgoing and confident individuals to help build and grow this initiative.§§As an In-House Face-to-Face Fundraiser, you will play an integral role in building the culture and dynamic of the team. By inspiring members of the public to become a New Zealand Red Cross supporter, you’ll be making a massive difference to the lives of millions of people. This role will provide you with the opportunity to use your passion for making a difference, not only here in New Zealand, but all over the world, whilst building your career in the sales, marketing and the charity sector.§Key responsibilities:§§Inspire members of the public to become regular monthly donors and encourage people to be part of this global humanitarian movement.§ §Represent New Zealand Red Cross in a positive and inspiring manner.§ §Build rapport with people and provide an excellent donor experience.§ §Support new and existing team members.§ §Actively participate in relevant New Zealand Red Cross team building, meetings, training or group activities.§ §Assist with other duties as assigned by the In-House Face-to-Face Fundraising Team Leader or Manager.§ §Adhere to the New Zealand Red Cross policies and Public Fundraising regulations.§ §Ensure accurate processing and administration of donor sign-ups.§The position is based in Wellington with an expectation to travel within the region. This is an exciting opportunity to stamp your mark and contribute to the overall establishment of New Zealand Red Cross’ first in-house face-to-face fundraising programme. Along with this, you will be improving your communication and marketing skills, as well as obtaining many transferable skills for your future career.§What’s in it for you? §§Competitive hourly rate and incentives§ §Social, fun and supportive team environment§ §Paid, full comprehensive training on fundraising skills and charity knowledge§ §Charity uniform and tablet to use while working§ §Being an integral part of the foundation of the team§ §Opportunity for career progression and growth§ §Leadership opportunities and training§§To be considered for this role, you must be:§§Confident, social and passionate about the cause§ §Energetic, with a can-do positive attitude§ §Reliable, trustworthy and hardworking§ §Fluent in English, with strong communication skills§ §A supportive team player§ §Motivated, with the willingness to learn§ §Driven to meet targets§ §Committed to a minimum of three months’ full-time work§ §Experience in a public facing role is preferred§ §A New Zealand citizen or permanent resident or hold a valid working visa§ §Immediate start is available.§To apply for the position, please apply at §https://mclaren.co.nz/vacancies/§Applications to: §Ngan Nguyen via mclaren.co.nz§Position description: §Available to view at mclaren.co.nz§ §§Applications will be reviewed and actioned as received.§§ §P: §04 499 1069§W: §mclaren.co.nz§E: §admin@mclaren.co.nz§§ §§§§§

We are inclusive and count ourselves lucky to have people from all backgrounds working with us.§        §LIC is based in Newstead, Hamilton, where we enjoy more affordable housing, relaxed commuting, easy parking and a readily accessible outdoor lifestyle. Our campus is in a rural setting just outside Hamilton and includes a social club, swimming pool, onsite parking, tennis and volleyball courts and a café with great coffee.§About the Role§We are looking for an Implementation Manager to lead and manage our team of SPACE specialists at an operational level. jobText: TXT/50721674.txt	§Lead Generator - Great product, easy target market!§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Generator - Great product, easy target market!§§Advertiser: §Eziswap Gas§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$20 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Sales - Outbound§§§§§§We're an industrial gas provider based on Aucklands' North Shore. We're on the lookout for a talented telemarketer to generate warm leads for our sales team. What you'll be happy to hear is that our product is extremely well received in the market and we have a strong competitive advantage making telemarketing very successful. §Workdays and times are flexible with a need for between 8 and 16 hours a week. We're happy to customise the workdays around university or other commitments. Suitable applicants will have previous experience in a telemarketing or telesales environment, have excellent written and verbal communication skills and be able to commit to a period of work no less than 1 year.  § §The role consists of:§ § §Market research to identify suitable business’s (Assistance provided)§ §Generating sales leads for our sales reps on the ground to followup.§ §Applicant must have:§ § §Previous B2B or sales experience§ §Experience in lead generation§ §Excellent communication skills and an excellent telephone manner§ §Ability to work independently§ §Excellent verbal and written skills (English)§ §Ability to use software (provided to track leads)§ §Applying is easy. Pick up the phone and call Tristan on §021760247§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§§§

jobTitle: Team Leader Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50737451.txt	§Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Byron-Wood Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§Our Client: Refund Club§Covid-19 has caused massive personal and commercial loses for kiwis and for those who suffered the financial loss of cancelled flights have gone through a long wait only to be refunded in the form of airline credits. §We believe Kiwis need their cash back and we are achieving cash refunds right now. Demand for our services have grown significantly and our team is growing too. Does this exciting and worthwhile venture interest you?§Your Role:§Directly manage our team of Refund Club Case Managers as they process applications made via our Chargeback tool.§Your Key Responsibilities:§Act as an owner of overall team performance; actively monitor all work queues and respond rapidly when additional support is required§Contribute to a culture of customer advocacy, continuous improvement, and exceptionally high standards§Train and develop Case Managers §Engage in performance management activities as needed§Direct handling of escalated contacts as needed§Motivate team members to perform their best work in a fast paced environment where change can happen every day.§Oversight of performance expectations including but not limited to attendance, schedule adherence and performance in operational metrics§Participate in process improvement and process change projects, including operational readiness components of new process launches.§You Will Have:§Outstanding customer relationship management skills §Excellent communication skills§Curiosity and investigative capabilities§Strong attention to detail§Enthusiasm and a willingness to learn§Past experience as a Data Analyst or similar role preferred but not essential§Proficient in Hubspot preferred but not essential §The Benefits and Perks:§An exciting and fast paced environment.§Innovation is encouraged and rewarded.§Fast growing company with massive scope for your future growth & development.§Work from the office, from home, or both. §Why work with RefundClub:§We're trying to build the best culture possible. As a fast-growing start-up, you will have the ability to shape where we are going and how we will get there. It’s not just about the nuts and bolts of what we do that matters, but the “why” behind it all.§Refund Club has a high-trust philosophy behind our work. We are proactive and do everything we can to make the working experience engaging and enjoyable for everyone.§Please visit refundclub.co.nz [link removed] to find out more §Please Note:§- Due to the large volume of candidates we will only respond to shortlisted applicants. §- You must have NZ work-rights to be considered for this job and hold a valid passport in order to travel overseas.§- By submitting your application to Byron-Wood Consulting you are giving us, our partner companies and clients consent to collect and retain your data for recruitment and hiring purposes for this role and others for which we may think you are suitable.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have experience in a role which requires relationship management experience?§§§

jobText: TXT/50754469.txt	§Customer Services Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Services Officer§§Advertiser: §Lyttelton Port Company§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§About us§LPC is the largest Port in the South Island of New Zealand, the gateway for the goods that keep our region moving. With a focus firmly on the future, these are exciting times for LPC with major infrastructure developments in full swing and a strategy focused on innovation, optimisation and business growth. Working for LPC means you are joining a company with a people focus, and a passion to play a key role in the global transport network.§The Role§Acting as a key point of contact for our customers, our Customer Services Officers' provide a high level of service to our customers, 7 days a week. This fixed-term opportunity involves answering questions and delivering resolutions to any requests and queries. Providing a high level of administrative support, this role provides a critical communication link between customers, and internal and external stakeholders. Although this is a fixed-term role, there is an opportunity to become permanent for the right person. §Key responsibilities include:§Quick turnaround on a very busy shared customer services email inbox - processing customer requests and queries.§MPI inspection and wash coordination.§First point of telephone contact for customers calling LPC, ensuring that a high level of customer service is provided, and the customer receives a resolution to their query.§Completing and updating vessel schedules, including delays, rotations and omissions.§Investigating and resolving any discrepancies.§Administering /removing holds in accordance with shipping lines, border security and LPC instructions.§Ensuring billing information is entered into N4 Billing accurately and in a timely manner.§Supporting our Container Control team as required in the acceptance and release of containers.§Coordination of transport moves to and from Lyttelton Port Terminal for both road and rail for containers and road transport for cars.§Process management of EDI messages in/out of systems.§The successful candidate will:§Have experience working in a fast-paced and time critical customer service role (ideally within the shipping or logistics industry).§Be comfortable working in a team environment and evenly sharing the work tasks.§Have a high regard for Health & Safety responsibilities and actively promote and support our "Home Safe" policy.§Possess a calm and composed nature that will allow you to display a high level of empathy when dealing with our clients.§Be able to work effectively when the pressure is on and use your initiative to take appropriate action to resolve any issues.§Be proficient in using your own initiative to develop ideas and increase skill effectiveness.§Have a high level of attention to detail and be a competent and confident computer user.§Be available to work a five- week rotating shift roster currently comprising of one weekend and one night shift in the five week rotation.§To apply:§If you're up for the challenge, hit the apply button and submit your completed application via our recruitment website. Applications for this position close §Friday 30 October 2020 at 5.00PM§Alternatively if you require further information, please contact our Recruitment Team via §recruitment@lpc.co.nz§As LPC is committed to providing a safe and drug free workplace, our preferred applicant will be required to pass a pre-employment medical and drug test.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Streamline offers its Business Process solutions and SAAS products to corporate entities throughout Australasia.§We currently have a full time vacancy for an individual to be trained in the diverse range of activities that make up this customer support role. §The person we seek will need to be a quality fanatic, hardworking and enjoy the multitasking requirement associated with the job. A keen interest in technology and a sound understanding of business practice is essential. §Your typical day will involve solving customer support issues that can be generated by phone, email or support tickets. Our ideal candidate will enjoy engaging with our customers, remedying their queries and ensuring each engagement is dealt with in a timely and complete manner. Follow ups to customer issues raised, may include liaising or escalating to our teams in Fiji and India or to our product development team lead here in Auckland§Streamline has a great team culture, which, whilst hardworking, does have it's fair share of laughs. §As a business we are totally committed to a flexible work environment, with the majority of the NZ team electing to work remotely at least 2 or 3 days a week. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds who want to provide an outstanding service to our patients.§Our centre is based in the easily accessible Justice and Emergency Services Precinct in the Central City, close to public transport and carpark facilities - although we are unable to provide car parking.§This is an important and meaningful role in which you will encounter a wide range of calls. The nature of many of these will require a high level of resilience on your part. No two days are the same.§To be successful, you do not require a medical background as you will undergo an intensive training period to enable you to give initial advice and instruction to callers.§We are looking for people with empathy, exceptional communication skills and the ability to gather and analyse critical information quickly.§You will work an average of 42 hours per week on rostered shifts over a 24/7 pattern of 12 hour shifts - generally two days and two nights followed by four days off.§The full-time starting salary is $51,938, rising to $55,184 when signed off to take calls solo and again to $59,513 at around the one year mark subject to meeting performance requirements, and ongoing training requirements (which continue throughout your career).§Essential criteria for this role:§A minimum typing speed of 40 wpm (this will be tested)§Be a New Zealand Citizen or Permanent Resident§Ability to work rostered shifts§Have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English§Ability to multi-task in a Windows operating environment§Excellent health and well-being§The recruitment process is:§Initial assessment through an email screening potentially followed by a short phone interview - a Talent Sourcing Advisor or someone from the team will give you a call to assess your suitability based on the above essential requirements.§You will then be asked to attend an information evening to be held at 4:00pm on Wednesday, 18th November, 2020. There will be some preliminary testing on this evening including a typing test, a listening test, and a short interview.§Those further shortlisted after the Assessment Centre will be invited to attend a 1 hour behavioural panel interview.§The next step in the process is an observation shift.§Psychometric assessment, typing tests, and other due diligence including the completion of a health questionnaire, police vetting, reference checking.§A thorough training and mentorship programme will provide the successful candidates with the skills and knowledge to undertake all key aspects of the role, including first aid, prioritizing calls, giving telephone advice and using the computerised triage system.§The anticipated commencement date is Monday,§ §11th of January, 2021.§ §There will be 10 weeks of training/mentoring§ §from that start date which§ §will§ §require your full attendance§.§Apply by Wednesday,§ §1 November 2020,§ §by clicking the "Apply" button below. Please note, applications will only be accepted via the St John Careers website.§We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce and adhere to best practice equal employment opportunity principles in all aspects of our recruitment and our ways of working.§Haramai ngā tai o te āniwaniwa, he kāhui rangatira tēnei, he kāhui whakamana tāngata whaimahi, e te iti, e te rahi e§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

The task at hand was feeding peckish beach goers on pies and ice creams. And thus, one small step for Dad’s Pies became a giant leap for pie-kind. jobText: TXT/50756863.txt	§Customer Care§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Customer Care§§Advertiser: §Repairhub§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§About Repairhub§ §Repairhub is a vehicle collision repair business. We are proud of our facility and our aim is to deliver consistently outstanding experiences for customers, getting them back on the road faster. Our business is centred around our people and the use of innovative technology to ensure cars are repaired to the highest standards. We are a highly customer focused business and everyone in our business has a role to play in bringing our vision to life.§  §About the role§ §Customer Care will act as the contact point for our customers, supporting and communicating with them through the repair of their vehicle. They are the voice and face of Repairhub for our customers.§  §The best Customer Care staff are genuinely excited to help customers, they’re patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative. They love to listen, understand then respectfully communicate. Problem-solving comes naturally to customer service representatives, they are confident, calm and know how to support our customers in challenging situations.§  §The target is to ensure excellent service standards, respond efficiently to customer inquiries and maintain high customer satisfaction.§  §Activities will include:§ § §Organising documents ahead of schedule in preparation for customer appointments§ §Booking, confirming and reminding customers assessment appointments§ §Warmly, clearly and effectively communicating with customers§ §Supporting the customer through the assessment and repair of their vehicle§ §Assisting the Estimator in their estimation of the customers damaged vehicle§ §Contacting partner organisations to provide services to our customers§ §Providing the customer with a suitable mobility solution and the supporting paperwork§ §Being the point of contact for customer questions and concerns§ §Keeping the customer updated with the status of their vehicle especially if there are repair delays§ §Inspecting returned hire car condition and completing the required paperwork§ §Taking customer policy excess payments§ §Leading customers through our customer survey§ §About you§ §We are seeking candidates that have:§ § §Preferably high school diploma or equivalent§ §0-3 years experience in customer care within the automotive repair or related industry§ §Proven customer care experience§ §A current driver’s license§ §And candidates that are:§ § §Punctual and reliable and available for work during designated operating hours§ §Able to follow specific work instructions, have a keen eye for detail and pride in workmanship§ §Able to work in a team environment and have a ‘can-do’ attitude§ §Patient, empathetic, and passionately communicative§ §A flexible approach to team work and duties will be required as successful applicant will be expected to assist in other day to day operations of the business§ §Comfortable multi-tasking and prioritising activities.§ §Capable phone conversationalists§ §Confident using IT and cloud based computer systems§ §Able to demonstrate an understanding of the health and safety requirements of a busy vehicle repair workshop§ §At Repairhub, we are committed to:§ § §Equal opportunity employment. We don't just accept difference, we embrace and support it§ §Health and Safety of our workplace. We operate a harm free zone and have a zero drug and alcohol tolerance policy§ §Providing training, personal development and career progression opportunities§ §Joining us§ §If the above sounds like you, we would love to hear from you. §  §Applications close on 28th October, so get your CV across now!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50756506.txt	§Caring Crew Superstar§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Caring Crew Superstar§§Advertiser: §Cerule NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Who Are We?§ §We are a biotech company that sells proven, one-of-a-kind, wellness products. § § § §We have a range of nutritional products that support the body’s natural release of stem cells, circulation and inflammation and skin care products that look after your body’s largest organ ‘Your Skin’.  § § § §What's the Role About?§ §We are looking for a talented person to join our caring crew, who loves providing world class customer service, with great growth potential for the successful person. To join our team, you will be required to take initiative, think on your feet and provide quality service in a fast paced environment whilst having fun! We run on a really high frequency here - so you must be upbeat, positive, have a great attitude and be eager to learn and grow!§ §Our Customers and Independent Business Owners are the reason we have a job, so providing them with the best service possible is the most important aspect of our business! § §Based in Rosedale, Albany.§ §If you can put a tick beside each of the skills in the list below we would like to hear from you.§ § § §Your duties will include (but not limited to):§ § § §Providing excellent telephone and email based support.§ § § §Efficient management of telephone and email support.§ § § §Assisting both Business Owners and consumers with product and business information (don’t worry - we’ll train you first!!).§ § § §Assisting with the end to end process of orders including dispatching of orders in our warehouse .§ § § §Maintaining a constant flow of communication with customers regarding the issues raised through to resolution.§ § § §Escalating any urgent issues through the appropriate channels.§ § § §Educating Independent Business Owners so that they become increasingly self-sufficient.§ § § §Helping improve, build and implement processes we need to grow.§ § § § §Desired Skills and Expertise:§ § § §Must be fluent in and have very clear spoken and written English.§ § § §Amazing communication skills (both written and verbal).§ § § §Must possess numerate literacy.§ § § §Attention to detail.§ § § §Ability to think practically and multi task.§ § § §Big smiler and excellent attitude (if you're high maintenance or into company politics please don't apply).§ § § §Hard working, punctual, self-motivated and driven.§ § § §Strong general computer skills and proficiency with learning web based applications.§ § § §Looking for a fast paced environment.§ § § §Passion, passion and some more passion.§ § §If you truly believe this is you, tell us why by submitting your Cover Letter and CV.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

demand, and covering a wide sector of businesses.  Not only is their product offering exceptional, the service and ongoing client care has a reputation of excellence.§ §Providing a range of Advanced Technology Solutions (Apps, Systems, Hardware, Software, Data, Automation) for many large and small organisations, retailers, councils, and govt agencies.  § §A position has arisen for a Customer Service Coordinator, to manage a team of two internal service support staff and manage the client relationships.§ §You will be confident dealing with a range of customer queries, issues and problem solving where required.§ §Responsible for weekly/monthly courtesy calls, ensuring the team are handling service support promptly and efficiently as well as maintaining the performance of the support division.§ § § §This is where you come in…§ §You will have local New Zealand experience and proven success within a 2IC or Leadership function.  You may have come from within a Call Centre environment, and now seeking to step away from this and with a smaller team with more responsibility.§ § §A Snapshot Of Your Day:§ § §Providing leadership and support to two service reps who are managing a range of service calls.§ §Coordinating weekly team performance meetings and seeing new areas for improvement.§ §Managing your own service support calls with clients, including escalations and technical queries.§ §Maintaining strong relationships with clients by regular calls.§ §Managing the CRM system, ensuring this is entirely kept up to date with key information.§ §Weekly/monthly reporting of data based on customer trends through to key staff performance.§ § § §Your Experience:§ §Technology - Hardware - SAAS would be hugely beneficial.§ §2IC or Team Leadership experience is a requirement (minimum one year)§ §Experience in tier 2 Call centre § §Able to deal with urgent client requests (service support, hardware, software training and or installation or repairs)§ §Ability to problem solve and identify quickly who needs to resolve issues, where and when and arranging.§ § §Very organised person, strong administration skills (MS Suite) and confident using a range of CRM Systems and reporting of data.§  § § §Joining a small NZ team, (but actually a global business) - with a start up feel, this is a a great opportunity to further your skills within Leadership, learning new technology, systems and hardware.§ §While small, this team have extensive reach, loyal clients and who have been competing in a very fast paced environment for several years.§ §You will be advance.§You are joining a very busy team here, so much variety on offer.  You will be reporting to a proactive and very supportive manager, have the backing of a reputable brand and organisation who want you to have a very long-term career ahead with them.§  §If this opportunity sparks an interest and you would like to speak further, please send across your application to us today and lets get the conversation started.§ §Please Note: §Relevant New Zealand work experience is a requirement for this position.§ § §Let's get the conversation started:§ §Contact:§  Jess Cree, Senior Recruitment We're currently looking for more talented people to join us on our journey to help make our world a safer place.§        §We're in the business of protecting the things that are important to our customers. You'll fit in here if you always have customers at the forefront of your mind, are able to ask the right questions to identify your customer needs and then develop the right solutions for them.§        §What you'll do:§        §As one of our Personal Insurance Consultants, you'll have proactive conversations to ensure everyone you speak to will be better insured and/or better-educated about insurance by the time they hang up the phone with you. You'll ask the right questions to understand more about each customer's immediate and future needs, and then discuss the features and benefits of the right solutions to protect their vehicle, house, contents and other assets. We want to set our customers up for a positive experience when they need to make a claim, so it's important to ensure they understand their cover completely and know exactly what to expect when they suffer a loss.§        §We need to be here for our customers whenever they need us, so our centre is open 7 days a week (Monday to Friday 8am - 8pm & Saturday to Sunday 9am - 6pm). Our shifts rotate to cover these days and hours, so you'll work 75 hours per fortnight (10 x 7.5-hour shifts). This may include one weekend day every fortnight.§        §What we're looking for:§        §We're seeking people who can build a natural rapport with customers over the phone, and who really want to help to make their world a safer place. You'll bring strong customer service experience but be ready for a new challenge. You'll be adept at uncovering customer needs using your inbound or outbound calling experience and finding the right solutions for them. A positive attitude goes a long way, as well as wanting to build genuine connections with your customers and colleagues. You'll really be immersed in the world of insurance and will need to absorb a lot of technical information, but we will set you up for success with a robust training plan and ongoing support and development.§        §Who are we:§        §IAG is NZ's largest general insurer and operates under the State, AMI, NZI, and Lumley brands, as well as underwriting insurance for some of NZ's leading banks. We're 100% for the trade which means CARTERS' model is purely business to business. Our success truly is our customers' success. That's why we strive to be the best building partner in the market and always make sure we're performing or exceeding the level of service our customers expect. CARTERS is committed to providing a safe working environment. All successful candidates would be required to under-go pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.§        §TIME TO FOOT THE GROUND WORK§        §Click §'apply now'§ below or visit §www.careers.carters.co.nz§. This role is predominately based at our trade counter with an all-rounder approach to service and advice. You'll have a range of duties - so expect to:§Provide advice to our trade customers both face to face and over the phone§Identify products quickly and efficiently§Process sales documentation§Arrange quotes/pricing information for new and existing customers§Maintain showroom stock levels, identify gaps from store shelves & update product displays§Work closely with other areas of the business including the yard, despatch and inventory§KEEN TO NAIL THIS?§The foundations to this role will see you demonstrating the below skill set:§People skills, people skills, people skills! With a genuine interest in talking to customers, building relationships, providing information and solving problems§Confidence using a computer and learning a new system§Possible retail background with an understanding of how a showroom environment works§Industry or building supply product knowledge would be advantageous, but not essential§The ability to learn new things and willingness to develop further§Efficiency is key as well as being a hands-on person, able to help out with some heavy lifting and assist in other areas when busy§WE WILL LOOK AFTER YOU TOO:§If you're wanting a partnership that's built on genuine trust and desire to grow together, this could be the opportunity for you. Aswell as a positive, supportive, professional work environment, we also offer:§A competitive remuneration package§Company Buying Privileges across CARTERS Stores§7.5% Benefits Plan which includes Superannuation, Death & Disability Insurance, Southern Cross Medical Insurance not to mention a voluntary savings scheme!§HAVE WE STRUCTURED YOUR INTEREST YET?§CARTERS is a unique New Zealand owned and operated business and we've helped build the country for over 150 years. We're 100% for the trade which means CARTERS' model is purely business to business. Our success truly is our customers' success. That's why we strive to be the best building partner in the market and always make sure we're performing or exceeding the level of service our customers expect. CARTERS is committed to providing a safe working environment. All successful candidates would be required to under-go pre-employment drug and alcohol testing.§TIME TO FOOT THE GROUND WORK§Click §'apply now'§ below or visit §www.careers.carters.co.nz§. Join the CARTERS team and gain access to the support and opportunities offered by one of NZ's top employers!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50764964.txt	§Samples Team Leader - Southern§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Samples Team Leader - Southern§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Panels Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §North Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Supervisors/Team Leaders§§§§§§About the business§Specified by New Zealand's top architects and designers, our products can be found in the country's leading homes and commercial buildings.  Our products include natural timber veneer, melamine, acrylic and laminate interior panel products.  We also supply high pressure laminates and engineered stone benchtops along with a range of substrates. Due to increasing activity we need to appoint a team leader for our Kaiapoi based samples hub.§About the role§This is a hands-on role and one that requires high standards of customer service.§The role is responsible co-ordinating and managing the despatch of architectural samples to sales teams and customers throughout the South Island and the Lower North Island.  This is both a hands-on role and one that requires superb organisational skills and high standards of customer service.§In this role you will need to collaborate internally with our Auckland-based Samples Distribution Manager, sales teams, customer services, despatch and the marketing team.§Responsible for: §Stock control.  §Carrying out regular stock reviews of sample chips, folders, keychains, brochures, boards and other items and ordering the required samples from the Auckland team to ensure that stock-outs do not occur.§Sample assembly§: managing the updating of existing sample folders, keychains and the merchandising of sample boards and sample boxes as needed.§Client service§ §and despatch§ – promptly responding to requests for samples via website, internal samples portal, via email and direct to the South Island and Lower North Island sales and specification teams.§Tracking and reporting§ of samples received and despatched§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have customer service experience?§How would you rate your English language skills?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§§§

jobTitle: Business Enhanced Specialist Job in Auckland - SEEK
experience: At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years
jobText: TXT/50765219.txt	§Business Enhanced Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Business Enhanced Specialist§§Advertiser: §Vodafone New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Company description:§We want to inspire people to capture the opportunities of a digital future and connect for a better future. That is why we are here. §At Vodafone we have changed the lives of billions of people for over 30 years. We made the first ever mobile phone call over 30 years ago. And we sent the first SMS: “Merry Christmas”. From taking 4G to the Moon and using big data for social to intelligent transport systems and emergency drones, we are still shaking things up. §Be part of a company which helps those who need it most. Whether teaching girls to code, providing connectivity to disaster hit areas or putting on our trainers and running for charity. §The future is exciting. Ready?§Job description:§We’re looking for someone who is passionate about the service they provide and driven to work towards a one-stop shop for our high-value clients. As a §Business Enhanced Specialist§ you will ensure we keep lines of communication open until we find a resolution for our customers. Your resilience and self-motivation will be key in this role as you work alongside your team to case manage any escalations. As the liaison between the resolver group and the customer, your communications skills will be impeccable as you support multiple customers from government to wholesale businesses.  This team works on a roster in which current hours for this role are between 7am – 7pm Monday to Sunday, these hours may be subject to change due to business requirements.   §What will I be doing?§ § §Respond and trouble shoot all customer interactions via any channel, and identify appropriate service solutions.§ §Make a positive impression with the customer through every interaction.§ §Take ownership and follow up on issues to achieve first call resolution at all times while adhering to targets.§ § §What will I bring?§ § §You will have strong customer service and likely come with experience in either call centre, service desk or a relevant environment that may involve troubleshooting, incident or case management.§ §You will be a confident and effective communicator, communicating to business customers and our internal teams both verbally and through email.§ §A telecommunications background is not essential but knowledge of related products, technology, processes and systems to solve problems that impact our customers would be beneficial. § §Ability to troubleshoot and manage escalations.§ §Experience with business customers would be advantageous.§ § § §As part of the application process, should you be successful in being shortlisted for this position you may be required to complete an online digital interview.§ §Me mahi tahi tātou mo te oranga o te katoa. We work together for the benefit of all.§§§§

jobTitle: Court Registry Officer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50778492.txt	§Court Registry Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Court Registry Officer§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Justice§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$48,853 - $68,968§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Customer Facing§§§§§§Court Registry Officer - Kaikohe District Court§§We are looking for some talented individuals to come join our District Court as a Court Registry Officer in Kaikohe. §Te āhuatunga a te tūranga/About the Role§§Court Registry Officer -§  in this role you will work with a team responsible for the successful operation of the Court. You will liaise with multiple stakeholders who are interacting with the Justice system. This includes being able to communicate confidently with Judges within the courtroom and their chambers, as well as other members of the judiciary.§The tasks include but is not limited to:§§Court Taking - this is the facilitation of running the court. This includes introducing Judges (in English and Te Reo Maori), working closely with them in the Courtroom and Chambers, managing jurors and general administration of the court.§Customer Service - interacting with customers on any court related matter. Customer queries can come in via face to face, phone or email interactions - so you will need to be confident with all methods.  §Case management - this involves ensuring files are accurate and up to date. This part of the role involves a large component of data entry.§§About us and why you will enjoy working here§At the Ministry of Justice we deliver people centred services to provide access to justice for all. Te tuku ratonga ā-tangata kia āhei atu ai te katoa ki te ture.§Creating a continuous learning environment is important to us. As the successful applicant, you will bring your thirst for knowledge and improvement. You will have an individual training plan and be supported to carry out the role. As a Court Registry Officer this includes exercising Deputy Registrar Powers. §As an organisation we empower our people with building their wellbeing knowledge, offering a range of wellbeing tools and support.§He pūkenga tou/Skills and Experience§With pride in your work, you will strive to deliver a service to our customers with high accuracy and professionalism.§Our customers are diverse, and our workforce reflects this. This role is no different and would suit a variety of backgrounds. Whether you have an interest in the Justice system, returning to the workforce, have a passion for working with customers this is your chance to join us on our journey to deliver people centred justice services for all.§To be successful, you will need to be§§Detail orientated and observant -§ the court has many different processes and case information needs to be accurate;§Self-aware -§our customers are unique, and you will be confident working, both individually and as a team, across a range of situations;§Multi-task -§some of our processes are repetitive, but you'll be able to manage conflicting priorities and move from one task to another quickly;§Willing to learn -§ legislation and processes in the courts is always changing and you will be able to adapt and take onboard feedback.§Resilience -§ there are times when working in the courts, you will be working on sensitive cases and sometimes at high volume.§§Joining the Ministry of Justice means you will become part of an inclusive organisation that values you and the communities we serve. It's our promise to ensure our workplace is one where our people feel healthy and safe, supported and able to be themselves at work. We value respect as the foundation for building a positive workplace culture and one where diversity is welcomed and celebrated.§§Tono mai/How to Apply§To apply, click the Apply button below to be directed to our Careers Website. You can view a detailed position description here, as well as complete an online application form by attaching your CV and cover letter.§Starting salaries are generally $48,853 and are dependent on skills and experience.§Applications close on Sunday 1 November§If you have any questions please contact §recruitment@justice.govt.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50782053.txt	§Shopify Support Advisor (Remote Customer Service Representative)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Shopify Support Advisor (Remote Customer Service Representative)§§Advertiser: §Shopify§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$50,000 - $54,999 + equity, perks, and benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Customer Service - Call Centre§§§§§§Kia Ora! We're so excited you are reading this job description, and hope you take a minute to apply! §Please note, this role is a remote role (work from home,) available for anywhere in New Zealand.§As an Advisor, you’ll work remotely from the comfort of your home while working within a dynamic, diverse and supportive environment. You won’t always know the answers to the questions you’re being asked, so your ability to be resourceful is key! We believe in human-centred, high-quality customer experiences. Using chats, phone calls and emails, you’ll be there to listen, teach, problem solve and explore growth opportunities with Shopify merchants. As part of that growth, you’ll be there to connect merchants with potential new features or plans to ensure they get the most out of the Shopify platform. §If you’re up for the challenge and enjoy working in a high-pressure environment, we encourage you to apply and take part in a hiring process that will allow you to meet folks at Shopify and get a taste for what the job entails. We aim to provide you with as much information about the role early in the process so that you know what to expect throughout, and in your first few months.§Following 4 weeks of training and 2 weeks of mentoring, you will begin responding to our merchants on live channels as part of a small squad, who is there to support you. All Advisors work a combination of weekdays, weekends and holidays in a full-time capacity. §We believe in supportive teams, an inclusive work environment and providing growth opportunities within your role. We also work remotely - which means you get to be part of a fast-growing global tech company from the comfort of your home.§Even if you’ve never held a similar position but you’re interested so far and relate to the things we’ve outlined below, we want to hear from you! §Responsibilities:§Adhering to a daily schedule that includes a mix of: Phones, three (3) simultaneous chats, and emails.§Ensuring merchants have a quick response time by staying on top of your assigned tickets, with same-day ticket review.§Acting as a business coach and thinking about the merchant’s business holistically when offering solutions.§Completing essential follow-up documentation after each interaction.§Engaging in human conversations with merchants to identify and resolve issues, and provide coaching/growth opportunities for their businesses.§Offer needs-based solutions, not pushy sales.§Advocating for merchants and the Shopify platform by communicating with stakeholders.§Owning your own development through reflection, reviewing past interactions and preparing to discuss growth opportunities with your lead in regular 1:1 meetings.§Requirements for the role:§Live and have legal authorization to work in New Zealand.§Extensive experience providing exceptional customer service in a contact centre, retail or service environment.§Have appropriate remote work set-up - such as quiet space, stable internet connection, and a back-up location in case of issues with the primary location.§Have access to a wired internet speed of at least 25 Mbps download speed and 10 Mbps upload. You can check your speed here.§The hours that we are currently hiring for are set to be a rotating schedule with varying 8-hour shifts starting anytime between 7:00 am - 11:00 am in your local timezone. This means some days your shifts could be as early as 7am-3pm, and as late as 11am-7pm. You would have notice well in advance for your scheduled times, and the idea would be to have them as consistent as possible, but due to varying needs we do require full availability. This would also include rotating weekend shifts.§Proven track record of being incredibly resourceful and finding solutions even when there is no clear path.§Ability to adapt to new processes and work accurately in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment.§Proficiency with technology paired with excellent typing skills.§Have strong reading, writing and communication skills.§Willingness to learn all about entrepreneurship, care deeply about people support and enjoy having genuine human conversations.§Possess high level of understanding, patience and empathy. Able to navigate more difficult conversations/interactions with professionalism.§Are committed to continuous growth and learning. You understand that every challenge is an opportunity and you get excited about learning new things.§Ensure privacy and security practices are followed at all times for both merchants and Shopify.§Bonus experience:§A background or interest in business, marketing, retail, or sales.§Ran or had exposure to running a business or being an entrepreneur.§At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.§If your experience is §this§ close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying. Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply.§Join a world-class team§PLEASE APPLY DIRECTLY on our careers page through this link: https://jobs.lever.co/shopify/4490db27-9d2f-483e-abeb-0bc25a4b2194?lever-origin=applied&lever-source%5B%5D=Seek§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50774304.txt	§Service Centre - Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Service Centre - Team Leader§§Advertiser: §HealthCare NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§Generous salary on offer§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Call Centre & Customer Service§, §Management & Support§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Service Centre - Team Leader §    §    §      §        §          §Who we are§          §HealthCare NZ provides a wide array of health and human services to people throughout New Zealand. Since 1988 we have been empowering people in need to live independently, safely and well in their community as well as in specialized treatment settings. We help people across the country gain access to needed services, ensuring they receive vital services, are safe, well-cared for, and live as independently as possible.§          §What's the role about?§          §We are looking for a vibrant, forward-thinking and resilient Team Leader to join our Service Centre in Albany. This is an exciting opportunity that will see you lead from the front, managing your team to success.
